item.title: Project Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Project Engineer obtains, evaluates, coordinates and distributes the information and authorizations necessary to construct the project on time, within budget and to the quality specified. In the performance of this function, the Project Engineer is responsible to protect and promote the interest of both the business and client in all matters as well as demonstrate the personal characteristics of a mid-level leader.

Responsibilities
  • Successfully manage the change management process
  • Participate and meaningfully contribute to monthly cost report meetings
  • Successfully adhere to the project controls procedures to include monthly cost control, pay requests and cost reporting
  • Effective expediting of material deliveries
  • Accurately estimate and prepare shop drawings
  • Continually encourage others to seek opportunities for different and innovative approaches to problems and opportunities
  • Develop business through identifying client needs , identifying Gilbane opportunity matches, and communicating the value and differentiation of Gilbane to prospective clients
  • Proactively review customer feedback, build a customer centric mentality within teams, and demonstrate knowledge of different market sectors and delivery systems to ensure positive customer relations
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 4+ years with CM/General Contractor Organization working on $20-$50 mm construction project
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Proven capability to establish specific measurable, attainable performance goals and hold others accountable for achieving them
  • Demonstrated ability to build active team participation, team trust and strengthen positive interactions
  • Ability to articulate financial knowledge and customer satisfaction awareness of how the company makes a profit
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt personal communication style to suit the target audience and situation including highly effective presentations, clear and concise writing on complex and sensitive topics, and understanding through paraphrasing and use of relevant examples
  • Strong verbal and written skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office programs
  • Financial Management familiarity
  • OSHA 10-Hour Certified
  • MEP Knowledge
  • Understanding of Contract Document & Specifications
  • Proficient in Prolog
  • Expertise in CMiC preferred
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Sr Credit Analyst
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Work from any CWB Office or Branch Location in CanadaCWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

Our Commercial team includes a diverse group of banking professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated commercial bankers knows the value of relationship building and brings that perfect combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table. No day is ever the same in commercial banking. Whether it’s providing proactive client solutions, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.

Opportunity Overview

The Senior Credit Analyst, utilizes advanced skills in credit writing, financial statement analysis, loan structuring, risk management and communications to provide exceptional service and responsiveness within business line functions of credit underwriting, loan applications and recurring credit review.

The underwriting focus of the Senior Credit Analyst is primarily directed toward more complex and higher value credits that require in-depth knowledge and experience to appropriately assess and mitigate all attributes of risk in alignment with CWB’s defined risk appetite. This position provides direct functional mentorship and guidance to newer credit analysts, as well as support for effective risk-based loan pricing and profitability management as required.

What Your Day Will Look Like
  • Credit Underwriting. As a skilled credit underwriter, you will: process applications, analyze, collaborate, write, structure, recommend and approve terms and conditions of credit within related delegated limits. Review, report, defer,
  • Risk management. You will utilize your risk management skills to ensure appropriate measures are put into place and risk assessment protocols and structures are implemented, while balancing risk and reward in line with CWB’s risk appetite. You will be responsible for ensuring data integrity and portfolio quality.
  • Creative problem solving. Acting as a go-to resource to provide solutions & functional support with complex credit applications or when faced with negative results or performance trends
  • Coaching. You are a great teammate and love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality. You become a trusted partner and coach to those on your team that need and crave feedback and support. You will assist in elevating their growth & development.
  • Partnership development. As a key resource for many business divisions, you will create relationships with different CWB groups.
Who you are & what you bring
Credit knowledge. Mentor. Collaborator. Financial savvy. Coach. Compliance strategist. Trusted partner.
Knowledgeable. In all things banking, lending, collateral security, leasing documentation requirements & equipment financing.

Client focused. You have the right tools implement stewardship strategies and provide advice to exceed client expectations while maintaining positive relationships.

Excellent communicator. You are confident in your written, verbal and presentation skills. You take pride in your ability to influence and negotiate win-wins.

A strategic planner. You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and a great one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allows you effectively multitask and meet deadlines.

Think big and beyond. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems. You have a knack for strategy and solutions.

Technologically proficient. You are adept at learning new software that you will use on a day-to-day basis.

Foundational Knowledge & Experience

A Bachelors Degree in business or related discipline and a have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in banking or business lending inclusive of 3 years credit adjudication. You already have or are working towards an accounting or financial designation. You have a real passion for credit structuring, credit underwriting and risk management that runs through your veins. Your hard work ethic, in-depth financial knowledge and decision making skills are the main attributes to your success and it’s your competitive advantage to rise above that makes you stand out amongst your colleagues.

Why work for us? Benefits to benefit you.

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, this role has incentives on top of incentives!!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/13/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Adviseur Jeugd
item.content:encoded:
Ben jij op zoek naar een functie als adviseur in de jeugdhulpverlening? Heb jij na je studie al enige praktijkervaring opgedaan en ben jij toe aan een volgende stap? Met jouw talent kan dit bij BMC!




Als Adviseur Jeugd word je, zelfstandig of in teamverband, ingezet op boeiende opdrachten binnen de jeugdhulpverlening en het sociaal domein. De projecten waaraan je een bijdrage levert zijn divers en afwisselend van aard. Denk hierbij aan de implementatie van een verbetertraject bij bijvoorbeeld een Gecertificeerde Instelling, een efficiëntie vraagstuk bij een gemeente, een tijdelijke teamleiders klus bij een Veilig Thuis organisatie of een rol als interim-gedragswetenschapper bij een jeugdhulpverleningsorganisatie. Je bent in staat om collega’s mee te nemen in jouw kennis en ervaring en het coachen en begeleiden van (junior)collega’s is jou op het lijf geschreven. Intussen heb jij de zekerheid van een vast contract bij BMC Implementatie, een ideale uitvalsbasis om jezelf te blijven prikkelen en jouw expertise te verdiepen.




Naast bovenstaande heb je affiniteit met het werken in een commerciële setting. Zo vinden wij het belangrijk dat je, naast het uitvoeren van je opdracht, actief en inhoudelijk jouw netwerk onderhoudt. Bij BMC wisselen we graag kennis en ervaringen met elkaar uit om zo elke dag beter te kunnen worden. Zo organiseren we werkgroepen en themabijeenkomsten en kun je trainingen volgen, waar ook jij je steentje aan bijdraagt.

item.title: IT Platform Engineer IV
item.content:encoded:
For one of our favourite clients in the financial domain, we're currently looking for a Devops Platform Engineer.

You're be responsible for both development/improvements and support. It's your role create highly optimised and highly reliable pipelines and cooperate with adjacent teams and departments to continuously improve the pipelines and increase both the breadth and width and the level of compliancy. Software packages that need to be maintained & upgraded periodically.

The Project

Start: As soon as possible
Duration: 12 Months
Location: Currently 100% remote - Officially in Amsterdam
Construction: Payroll preferred (freelance possible)
Language: English

To be successful in our team, you will need to have:
  • You have experience maintaining applications and application stacks in any stage, including production for a medium/large company
  • You have experience with lifecycle management for applications.
  • You have experience with using Ansible.
  • You have experience with Azure.
  • You are aware of the risks & security issues involved with deploying tools on a production environment and are willing to help resolve these.
  • You are willing to get good at resolving operational tasks/incidents related to the applications.
  • You are interested in a future career path geared towards Azure DevOps and Azure Platform as a Platform Engineer.
  • Knowledge of (or an interest to learn) Python is a big plus!
  • Knowledge of (or an interest to learn) Golang is a plus!
  • and you need to be: a team player, pro active and have a improving mindset


Sounds like you? Please send your most recent CV.

item.title: Senior Project Executive
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Project Executive is representative of the Company responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of simultaneous complex construction-management projects; as well as mentoring multiple Project Executives.

Responsibilities
  • Direct and supervise work of project administration, project superintendents, and engineers to establish operational priorities and maintain satisfactory relationships with owners, subcontractors, unions, etc.
  • Enforce project reporting requirements
  • Manage critical issues
  • Assume overall accountability for jobsite safety and quality
  • Mentor Project Executives
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 10-15 years in the lead role on projects valued at $150 million or larger
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • High rise experience highly preferred
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong technical and communication skills are critical
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Leadership and management skills
  • Knowledge of Prolog, Microsoft Office (preferred)
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Description

Finance Automation team at Amazon is looking for Data Engineer to play a key role in building next generation Financial data warehouse to in Finance space. The ideal candidate will be passionate about building next generation extremely large, scalable and fast distributed systems on AWS stack and will want to be part of a team that has accepted the goal to democratize access to data and enabling data driven innovations for entire Finance business in Amazon. We are one of fastest growing Data Engineering team across Amazon with strong technology orientation.

Looking for a candidate with strong background in new age AWS stack (S3, EMR, Redshift) or traditional BI & DW with interest in data mining and ability to sieve emerging patterns and trends from large amount of data. Data Engineer should have strong experience with all standard data warehousing technical components (e.g. ETL, Reporting, and Data Modeling), infrastructure (e.g. hardware and software) and their integration. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in dimensional modeling, excellent problem solving ability dealing with huge volumes of data and a short learning curve. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required as the candidate will work very closely with diverse teams and senior leadership.

Along with complex problems to solve, we provide you world class work environment and a chance to work with few of industry most talented team members in data engineering space and opportunity to contribute and create history while having fun.

Responsibilities
  • Design, build and own all the components of a high volume data warehouse end to end.
  • Build efficient data models using industry best practices and metadata for ad hoc and pre-built reporting
  • Interface with business customers, gathering requirements and delivering complete data & reporting solutions owning the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
  • Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers
  • Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from a wide variety of data sources
  • Own the functional and nonfunctional scaling of software systems in your ownership area.
  • Provides input and recommendations on technical issues to BI Engineers, Business & Data Analysts and Data Scientists.

Basic Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
  • Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
  • Experience in SQL
Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
  • Strong understanding of ETL concepts and experience building them with large-scale, complex datasets using traditional or map reduce batch mechanism.
  • Strong data modelling skills with solid knowledge of various industry standards such as dimensional modelling, star schemas etc
  • Extremely proficient in writing performant SQL working with large data volumes
  • Experience designing and operating very large Data Warehouses
  • Experience with scripting for automation (e.g., UNIX Shell scripting, Python, Perl, Ruby).
  • Good to have experience working on AWS stack
  • Clear thinker with superb problem-solving skills to prioritize and stay focused on big needle movers
Preferred Qualifications
  • Must have excellent knowledge of Advanced SQL working with large data sets.
  • Must have excellent dimensional modelling skills.
  • Experience with AWS technologies including Redshift, RDS, S3, EMR, EML or similar solutions build around Hive/Spark etc.
  • Experience with reporting tools like Tableau, OBIEE or other BI packages.

Company - ADCI HYD 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1280392

item.title: Senior Quality Control Manager
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Quality Control Manager manages all QC staff, processes and activities for large DoD construction projects.

Responsibilities
  • Interface in professional manner with client representatives and subcontractors.
  • Review designs and provide feedback to designers.
  • Manage in-depth technical reviews of submittals against design documents and manage submittal review and approval status through use of submittal register.
  • Implement the requirements of approved QC Plan, assuring all required records are generated and managed.
  • Identify deficiencies and non-conformances, prepare documentation, and monitor and verify corrective actions.
  • Stop work if necessary to resolve non-compliant work or matters that negatively affect safety.
  • Coordinate and document commissioning and formal completion inspections.
  • Manage a timely project closeout to include compilation and turnover of all required documents.
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS degree in Engineering, Architecture or Construction Management or CMAA Certification
  • Minimum 10 years construction experience, 4 as QC Manager
  • USACE/NAVFAC Construction Quality Management for Contractors training certification preferred.
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong leadership and communication skills.
  • Proactive management approach.
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Skilled using Microsoft Word and Excel; USACE QCS a plus
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Talent Acquisition Advisor (6 month term)
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

And we need a proactive full-cycle recruiter to help make it happen.

We hire with intention. Do you?

If you are a practiced recruiter driven by collaboration, partnership, service and fundamental guiding principles read on, and reach out! We are a dispersed team working remotely and united by our love for recruitment. Due to growth and internal promotions, our 6 month transition plan needs an extra set of hands.

Recruiter. Talent Acquisition Advisor. Head Hunter. Sourcer. Scout. Talent Agent.

Whatever Your Title, The Calling Is In The Same.

You use a people first approach to support and facilitate talent acquisition strategy and processes. Primarily, you will act as a partner to recruiters & people leaders in attracting, sourcing, assessing and selecting, and acquiring top talent to meet the needs of the organizations’ strategic direction. This will include recruitment portfolio coordination & management, participating in virtual campus recruitment, diversity recruitment initiatives & CWB sponsorship activities.

You need to be, to have, to create, to demonstrate:

Passion for recruitment. Driving the end-to-end recruitment process including job postings process, strategic placement on external websites, participating in intake meetings, shortlisting qualified and diverse applications, conducting assessments and interviews, administers assessments, completing background checks and offer recommendations.

Relationship Focus. Establishing meaningful and sustainable relationships with employees and leaders, through collaboration on initiatives that promote the objectives and directives of the organization.

Candidate Centric. Creating and promoting a “candidate centric” recruitment experience, working to develop a pipeline of qualified and diverse applicants for strategic business requirements.

Active Networking & Interpersonal Skills. The ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels of the organization and with all external contacts. Facilitating partnerships with suitable educational institutions, staffing firms and specialty groups/associations and diverse community partners. Coordinating and participating in internal and external recruiting events for CWB!

Sales. Engaging conversationalist, story-teller, relationship builder, brand advocate. Connecting and engaging with others in-person, over the phone, via virtual connections and social media platforms.

Operational Efficiency. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, access to wifi & a phone to support remote work, solid organizational skills, ability to prioritize and effectively communicate with others.

Remote Team Player. Ability and willingness to work remotely both independently and collaboratively as part of a dispersed team.

Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. Gay rights activist. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.

All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love you to apply.

Closing Date
  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
02/11/2021 Inclusion &

Diversity
CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
Accessibility

CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Take-Off
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

We are seeking enthusiastic, positive candidates who wish to contribute to a successful operation. Machine Operators will be trained to monitor and operate their production line in our 10-line operation. Over time, you will be trained on additional lines to improve operational flexibility.

All applicants must be able to work any shift in our 7/24 facility. We operate the plant under a 12-hour shift system (8:00 to 8:00) which has the benefit of only requiring seven work days in a 2-week pay period. This shift schedule offers the benefit of additional earnings compared to a standard forty-hour per week schedule. We are also seeking applicants who understand that employees make key contributions to developing a pro-safe work environment.

Candidates must be grade 12 graduates, at minimum. Additional consideration will be given to applicants offering completed post-secondary studies relevant to manufacturing. Other qualifications of interest would include Level II first aid, current forklift certifications, etc.

Abbotsford Pipe offers an hourly rate of $20.43/hr. ($18.79/hr. in probation) plus night shift premium ($0.50) and Continuous Shift Premium ($0.20/hr). Regular hours of work are assured. Within approximately one and one half years, the guaranteed rate of pay will escalate in two steps to at least $25.72/hr. Full company-paid medical, dental and group insurance plans plus an 8.0% Group RRSP are offered. In addition, our hourly team are eligible for two separate bonus plans that have paid out consistently.

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

item.title: Banking Associate
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Multiple positions, Multiple locations across Canada! Please provide resume & detailed cover-letter outlining interest in program.
Transcripts will be required for all candidates selected for interviews.

CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

We’re on a mission to become a powerful force in Canadian banking. Our target clients are small and medium-sized business owners, and they expect a clear alternative. They deserve a proactive partner who helps them succeed. We’re caring. We’re forward-thinking. We’re specialized. And we’re redefining a proactive client experience in a constantly evolving climate. We have real relationships with our clients. We genuinely care about them & their success. We don’t sit back passively. We respond with urgency & speed, anticipate our clients’ needs, come to them with valuable ideas, and advise. That’s how we become the best full-service bank for business owners in Canada. It's how we deliver on our brand promise of being obsessed with your success™.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. LGBTQ2S+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this program, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.
Difference makers. Life-long learners. Proactive achievers. Change advocates. Game changers. Self-starters. The passionately committed.We hire with intention. The mildly interested need not apply. Decided on a career in Business Banking?
Learn what it takes to be a commercial banker in our Banking Associate Program. You’ll be part of an exclusive cohort gaining real work experience while learning sought after industry skills. Through hands-on mentorship and coaching, you’ll dive deep into commercial banking and become a critical member of our team dedicated to serving our clients. Hiring in all four programs: General Commercial, Equipment Financing, Real Estate & Specialty Lending and Cash Management, we will align you to the ideal accelerator program based on your expertise and interests.

Put your education to work and ignite your career with a proud Canadian owned company. While we may have grown up in the Prairies, we are excited to continue to build on our growth strategy as we rapidly expand our national footprint coast-to-coast. Mobility is an asset and often rewards you with fast-tracked developmental opportunities and greater exposure.
The program specifics
Banking Associates are part of a developmental program designed to equip new graduates with a foundation for a commercial banking career. This role focuses on developing core-banking skills and provides credit structuring, credit underwriting, risk management and delivering client solutions with increasing autonomy and complexity over the course of a 12-month accelerator program. Partnering with experienced professionals in the branches, including account specialists, relationship managers, credit analysts, and business development managers, to support the day to day operations of the business.

What Makes You a Fit
  • You’re completing your undergraduate degree and can begin work in the spring of 2021.
  • Building relationships and networking with people from a diverse group of backgrounds is in your DNA.
  • You have an analytical mind, are naturally curious, and love diving into data to inform your decisions.
  • You’re fascinated by financial services and understanding business operations of today and tomorrow.
  • You're prepared to be brand ambassador and sell client-based solutions with confidence, negotiating impactful outcomes for all.
  • You are results driven with a bias for action. You push yourself to achieve goals, welcoming challenges and pursuing objectives with energy, drive and the need to finish, and finish well.
  • You take ownership of your own learning and development, actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged.
  • You’re agile in the face of change and can operate effectively even when the way forward is unclear.
  • The word inclusion has deep meaning to you. It’s more than a concept, it’s a way of thinking, behaving and holding yourself accountable.
  • You collaborate and contribute to optimize every interaction.
Why work with us? Benefits to benefit you.
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup. We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

 Learn more about the Banking Associate Program.

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

It’s more than a concept, it’s a way of thinking, behaving and holding yourself accountable.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou collaborate and contribute to optimize every interaction.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Why work with us? Benefits to benefit you. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWinners of \u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020 \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Your voice matters. \u003C/strong\u003E Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E The opportunity to make a difference \u003C/strong\u003E . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Physical health and mental fitness are priorities \u003C/strong\u003E . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Community giving. \u003C/strong\u003E Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Bring your whole self to work. \u003C/strong\u003E Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Innovation. \u003C/strong\u003E Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Connection. \u003C/strong\u003E Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Organization wide coaching services \u003C/strong\u003E . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Recognition. \u003C/strong\u003E Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Financial rewards \u003C/strong\u003E . Yup. We pay you too. Base \u003Cstrong\u003Eplus \u003C/strong\u003Eperformance incentives!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Retirement investment strategy. \u003C/strong\u003E You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Company ownership. \u003C/strong\u003E The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Great Places To Work. \u003C/strong\u003E CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EClosing Date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Learn more about the Banking Associate Program. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cli\u003E P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E02/28/2021\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Inclusion & \u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiversity\u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Entry level","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Canadian Western Bank","sameAs":"https://ca.linkedin.com/company/canadian-western-bank","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE06Sg0zJHr_Q/company-logo_200_200/0/1594241574876?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=HDD6Iwv8gKUznw1qDrT7_FJnMn8c08uUVErctxIcBhM"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Canadian Western Bank","value":"R2967"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE06Sg0zJHr_Q/company-logo_100_100/0/1594241574876?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=Pu3QSyBOxtlubfCL5_yGc4rkYeXKGkyIltbnADzKlkE","industry":"Banking,Financial Services,Commercial Real Estate","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Jasper","addressRegion":"AB","postalCode":"T0E1E0","addressCountry":"CA"}},"skills":"","title":"Banking Associate","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:46.000Z"}</script>

item.title: SPRO Capacity Planning PM
item.content:encoded:
Description

Have you ever thought about what it takes to detect and prevent fraud among hundreds of millions of e-Commerce transactions in different countries? What would you do to create a trusted marketplace where millions of buyers and sellers can safely transact online? What kinds of processes and systems would you build to maximize customer satisfaction? Amazon is seeking a Capacity planning program manager who will be responsible for driving service levels, developing strategies for service expansions and optimizing resource utilization/occupancy through innovative ideas.

Our overall mission is simple: We want Amazon to be the place where our customers can find, discover and buy anything online. Whatever our customers want, we will find the means to deliver it. With your help, Amazon will continue to enable people to discover new worlds. This is your chance to make history.
We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build trust of our customers and sellers. Amazon hires the brightest minds, are you one of them?

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and intelligence driven people. The ideal candidate is expected to operate with significant autonomy and discretion, influences internal & external teams. He/She will possess leadership experience in the workforce management domain with respect to best in class real-time mechanisms, intermediate level reporting skills, optimizing manpower in contact center environments. and lead a high performing team across the globe as manager of managers. The individual must be capable to support and own proactive tactical & strategic workforce management responses to address service level challenges. In this role you will experience a wide range of problem solving situations that require immediate real time intervention.
  • Timely and accurate delivery of headcount plans for respective STAR operations programs considering factors of forecast and operational productivity inputs for each sites.
  • Create hiring plans and govern the process by coordinating with involved teams like recruitment, training and operations.
  • Create estimated capacity to deliver against forecast basis on the derived headcount plan.
  • Independently solve and deliver for business problems related to planning with occasional direction. Drive an agile capacity model to meet customer promised SLA standards.
  • Deliver cost efficient HC plans and driving hiring demands for the STAR Ops organization. Set long-term vision and direction for team projects.
  • Lead new program launches from an STAR capacity planning perspective & manage initiatives for continued improvement
  • Constant communication with WFM, business team, finance, senior leadership, operations, recruitment and other internal clients on status of plan vs actual delivery variance.
  • Makes trade-offs: overtime vs. hiring vs productivity stretch vs headcount movement for the headcount/capacity planning.
  • Identify/Implement capacity planning and management tools and technology enablers that will improve operating accuracy and efficiency.
  • Establish reporting mechanism to create transparency on the teams effort associate to the assigned goals.
  • Participate and contribute to business review meetings and document writing to promote team efforts.
  • Improves previously defined processes with quantified positive impact.
  • Optimizes cross-team processes that improve team efficacy and delivery.
  • Responsible for gathering and summarizing feedback on project launch, misses and communicating to all teams involved in a timely manner.

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, statistics or equivalent)
  • 5+ years’ experience in Capacity planning/ WFM experience .
  • Experience in building and analyzing models for forecasting and headcount optimization.
  • Strong commitment to exceptional customer experience, and a high level of dedication, enthusiasm, motivation, and persuasive ability in a team and cross-functional environment
  • Proficient in advanced usage of Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent communication skills
Preferred Qualifications
  • Analysis experience in Customer Service or Operations preferred
  • Experience automating or improving tools functionality through collaboration with Engineering or other Program Management teams.
  • Experience working with globally managed service providers.
  • Operations Research or Capacity Planning experience strongly preferred.
  • Some programming experience is a plus to automate tools whenever appropriate.
  • Basic/Working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques preferred.
  • Excellent speaking-listening-writing skills, attention to details, proactive self-starter.
  • Ability to work successfully in a dynamic, ambiguous environment.
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads.
  • Ability to develop new ideas and creative solutions.
  • Exceptional influencing and leadership skills

Company - ADCI - BLR 14 SEZ
Job ID: A1280752

item.title: Project Management Officer
item.content:encoded:
Imagine…

your communicating skills and organizing capabilities could support the projects and implementation working on improving KYC. Imagine you’re a trusted support for line and program management and all boards. Imagine that you take the program communication, planning, budgeting and reporting to a next level. Together with other teams of experts you will facilitate the change. As a Project Management Officer, you can make the difference!

At Rabobank, we are currently working on structurally improving KYC. To achieve this improvement, we are looking for a Project Management Officer (PMO) who will be able to work with various line and project managers within a large dynamic environment to achieve this improvement. As a Project Management Officer you will play an active role within the department KYC Expertise center Retail NL and work closely together with the Operations Change and Support area, Transaction Monitoring, KYC Operations Retail NL and other KYC departments.

Making the difference by

  • Supporting planning of change activities throughout the different stages of the program.
  • Monitoring and reporting on progress activities to the management and other stakeholders.
  • Executing change management activities, such as the creation and coordination of communication, process improvements in way of work, and the development and coordination of training requirements.
  • Facilitating project and change workshops with line, project and implementation management.
  • Preparing the agendas of the diverse governance bodies, facilitate decision making and monitor follow up of action items.
  • Ad hoc project investigations.

With Each Other

KYC Expertise center Retail NL joins forces with our Customer Due Diligence colleagues from Operations, CAMS and DTO. Together we shape the social responsibility Rabobank has as gatekeeper of the the integrity of our financial system.

In your role you support KYC Expertise center Retail NL and actively help with the project management work of the managers. You will participate in the preparation of training and communication. You will also work closely with the various managers to monitor progress and quality and to present it to the governance bodies.

PMO colleague: “It's great to work together with people across KYC to make the projects and implementation more tangible. There is a lot of positive energy in the team and every day is different!”

With you

Customer focus, analytical skills and being able to deal with resistance are indispensable for a Project Management Officer. In addition, it is important that you recognize yourself in the following:

  • master's degree in, for example, Change Management, Business Administration, Finance;
  • project management experience is preferred;
  • excellent command of the Dutch and English language;
  • experience/affinity with LEAN and working in an agile work environment
  • expert user of supporting tools (e.g. SQL-server; Power BI; PowerPoint; Excel; Word; Teams);
  • independent, self starting, result and detail oriented;

Growing a better world together
You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for more than 8.5 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

  • “Many people are not yet aware of the benefits of energy-efficient housing. We take responsibility by telling our customers how they can reduce their energy bills, while also helping the environment.”
  • “We want to share our knowledge about sustainable financial solutions. For example, we offer a discount to corporate clients with a sustainable hallmark.”
  • “With a 48% share of all green financing in the Netherlands, Rabobank is the largest Green Bank.”

Interested?
Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 40-hour working week), you can also expect:

  • a gross monthly salary between €2.750,28 - €4.586,28;
  • a thirteenth month and holiday pay;
  • an Employee Benefit Budget (9% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout;
  • a personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;
  • 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport or car.
  • a pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5%.


Let's meet
Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Project Management Officer and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.

Good to know:

  • Apply via the “Apply now” button. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy.
  • If you have any questions about the specific details of this position, please contact John Daamen, Programmanager KYC on john.daamen@rabobank.nl or +31 6 10347729
  • Cornel Roest, recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via Cornel.Roest@rabobank.nl.
  • The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.
  • The application process for this vacancy includes an individual assessment.
  • Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link.

Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

There is a lot of positive energy in the team and every day is different!”\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/em\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWith you\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECustomer focus, analytical skills and being able to deal with resistance are indispensable for a Project Management Officer. In addition, it is important that you recognize yourself in the following:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003Emaster's degree in, for example, Change Management, Business Administration, Finance;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Eproject management experience is preferred;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Eexcellent command of the Dutch and English language;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Eexperience/affinity with LEAN and working in an agile work environment\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Eexpert user of supporting tools (e.g. SQL-server; Power BI; PowerPoint; Excel; Word; Teams);\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Eindependent, self starting, result and detail oriented;\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGrowing a better world together\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EYou'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for more than 8.5 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E“Many people are not yet aware of the benefits of energy-efficient housing. We take responsibility by telling our customers how they can reduce their energy bills, while also helping the environment.”\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E“We want to share our knowledge about sustainable financial solutions. For example, we offer a discount to corporate clients with a sustainable hallmark.”\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E“With a 48% share of all green financing in the Netherlands, Rabobank is the largest Green Bank.”\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EInterested?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EDo you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 40-hour working week), you can also expect:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003Ea gross monthly salary between €2.750,28 - €4.586,28;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Ea thirteenth month and holiday pay;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Ean Employee Benefit Budget (9% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Ea personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport or car.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003Ea pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5%.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELet's meet \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EAre you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Project Management Officer and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EGood to know:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EApply via the “Apply now” button. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EIf you have any questions about the specific details of this position, please contact John Daamen, Programmanager KYC on john.daamen@rabobank.nl or +31 6 10347729\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECornel Roest, recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via Cornel.Roest@rabobank.nl.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EThe application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EThe application process for this vacancy includes an individual assessment.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYour privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003EEveryone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Niet van toepassing","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Rabobank","sameAs":"https://nl.linkedin.com/company/rabobank","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH2kxVJT-AFXw/company-logo_200_200/0/1519855859284?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=y4OLBf0AVlNdRJFIQkUdVbGX2DZryCml6QwKHcUI90M"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Rabobank","value":"JR_00038006"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH2kxVJT-AFXw/company-logo_100_100/0/1519855859284?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=ir4_cTyAsvEcLYIFAR3lPs8vCtKGnunBMyv3zkixe30","industry":"Bankwezen","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Binnenstad","addressRegion":null,"postalCode":"3512","addressCountry":"NL"}},"skills":"","title":"Project Management Officer","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:25.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Manager - DLS
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon’s Disability and Leave Services (DLS) team in the Employee Services (ES) organization is building a best-in-class case management program to deliver leave of absence, disability and accommodation services to Amazon employees globally. To support this growth globally, DLS is driving to redesign our processes and tools for service globalization and infinite scalability, requiring strong operational leadership to help us achieve this.
While some in our organization will work on new service designs and specifications, we need expert operational / service delivery manager, with strong leadership skills, service operations in line with our leadership principle of customer obsession. The DLS Manager will pride themselves and have a track record of flawless execution, continuous improvement of service operations using people, tools and processes, demonstrating ownership and a bias for action. The ideal candidate must possess energized and challenged bias in a role where they lead and develop people organizations whose focus is on exceptional service delivery. The DLS Manager will lead successfully through a well-developed, cohesive leadership team that amplifies the vision and commitments they declare. The DLS Manager will work across multiple business groups and locations delivering DLS services to employees, managers and HR colleagues, earning trust of stakeholders.

The DLS Manager role consists also in providing exceptional customer service, partnership and coordination with business teams, senior leadership, managers and HR. The ideal candidate require exceptional operational knowledge, execution, data understanding and leadership skills to take on a highly impactful specialist role while managing a team of 12-15 DLS members regarding leaves and accommodations. The successful candidate will assist in fostering the growth of the program and development of the process changes and opportunities to improve efficiency and the customer experience.

This role will need to see things through to completion, have the ability to manage and coordinate complex processes, possess exceptional communication skills with all levels of employees and management, superior attention to detail, ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment, strong critical thinking and fact-finding skills, and exceptional customer service focus. Additionally, the ideal candidate must possess a bias for action to develop and improve processes, take ownership and show initiative. This individual will need deep subject matter knowledge, strong communication and interpersonal skills and an ability to provide phenomenal customer service.

Position Responsibilities

Project Management And Communication
  • Developing team capabilities: This position will work at an individual and team level to develop HR and leadership skills, provide stretch opportunities to advance the team and provide career development opportunities for team members.
  • Identifies customer impacting issues and implement solutions and process improvements to increase customer satisfaction. Participates in cross-functional process improvement initiatives influencing site and country procedures with little or no guidance.
  • Knows how to deal with ambiguity taking calculated risks at the moment of making decisions that are impactful to the operation.
  • Assists in developing and implementing training programs to improve the quality and productivity of the teams.
  • Drives continuous improvement processes/initiatives to enhance the operational efficiency of the site. Understands and effectively utilizes resources provided by internal systems, departments, policies, and procedures. Executes business goals.
  • Creates business cases and manages enhancements. Presents high quality data findings.
  • Responds to escalations, providing root cause analysis and recommendations. Develops remediation plan and drives to resolution with minimal guidance from Manager.
  • Subject matter expert in contact center environment involving Work Flow, training, finance, among other support teams.
  • Possess high capacity and planning knowledge. Forecast and recruiting skills.
People Management
  • Leads and develops work teams; responsible for the overall direction, performance management, coordination and evaluation of the teams. Manages and ensures high service delivery and execution.
  • Achieves performance goals and objectives in line with the network wide vision and goals. Has the ability of dealing with conflict despite personal comfort.
  • Communicates policies to the team and become the primary information source for staff; following-up to ensure compliance and consistency; taking corrective action as necessary and documenting the issue and actions taken.
  • Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Amazon’s policies and procedures; additional responsibilities include interviewing, training and motivating employees; planning, assigning and directing work; and effective conflict resolution.
  • Creates a safe, trusting environment for communication based on open dialogue; encourage team members to express views.
  • Represents Amazon’s Leadership Principles at all times.
Subject Matter Expertise
  • Acts as a Subject Matter Expert for customers, team and vendors. General understanding of ES workload and priorities.
  • Knows and works with outside sources to develop interpretations and solutions for complex issues.
  • Performs audits of team’s work, providing coaching and feedback to support ongoing performance improvement. Assists in developing and approving performance guidelines
  • Advocates for ES.
Basic Eligibility

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Overall 8-10 years of experience.
  • Minimum 5 years of managerial experience with client facing roles on US geography.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a field such as Business Administration, B. Com Human Resources or equivalent graduation degree.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Strong People & operational leadership skills.
  • Strong Analytical Ability
  • Ability to manage large & complex projects
  • Experience of managing diversified portfolios /processes ( Voice / back-office)
Preferred/Essential Skill Requirement

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Ability to handle projects using the Project Management principles and methodology.
  • Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma.
  • Fluent in English and third language proficiency is an added advantage.
  • Basic US legislation Leave of Absence and Accommodations knowledge.
  • Preferred 2 years of Leave and/or Accommodations experience., Knowledge of federal and state leave and disability laws
  • Experience in providing consultation and guidance on leave of absence, human resources, benefits, or complex employee matters
Note: Only Permanent L5 with minimum 1 year at current role candidates will be considered for this role


Company - ADCI PNQ 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1282220

item.title: Front End Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Description

Front End Engineer will be responsible for design, development, delivery and support of large-scale, multi-tiered, distributed software applications.

In Our Team You Will Have The Opportunity To
  • Build fascinating new products
  • Work directly with your customers and shape the vision of the web stack
  • Create and drive metrics to measure complexity
  • Brainstorm, prototype, test, and iterate on new ideas
  • Work with the latest technologies and tools.
  • See the positive impact of your work on real customers
  • Brainstorm, design, and implement front end components and user experience for Kinesis
Inclusive Team Culture
Our team is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers; someone who will help us amplify the positive & inclusive team culture we’ve been building.


Basic Qualifications
  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or related discipline; or equivalent experience
  • Familiar with developing front-end software, with deep experience in one or more relevant front-end frameworks (ReactJS, Vue, Angular, etc.)
  • Familiar developing rich applications with HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Experience with JavaScript testing frameworks, such as Jasmine, Mocha, Jest or equivalent.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
  • Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
  • Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
  • Ability to convert a design document into a working service with no loss in fidelity
  • Advanced CSS skills
  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Ruby, Java, C# or Python
  • Analyzing application and user metrics to define our team strategy.
  • 1+ years professional experience in software development
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Company - Amazon Dev Center U.S., Inc.
Job ID: A1273392
