item.title: VP Finance & Chief Accountant
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
CWB Financial Group is not your typical employer.
We are steadfast in proactively finding ways to help you succeed. By listening intently and asking the right questions, we uncover your dreams and goals and provide learning opportunities to put you in the driver's seat of your career. Most importantly, we’re here, because we genuinely care. You might even say that we’re obsessed with your success.™

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

And we need a leader to make it happen.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. Indigenous activist. LGBTQ+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB, we know that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. Our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to bring to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.
The opportunity
Leadership. Financial execution. Operational expertise.

Success of the Finance team will be evaluated against execution of foundational requirements; value-add nature of the solutions we provide; and effectiveness and value-add of the connections we sustain.

Primary responsibilities include providing leadership & continued development for CWB Financial Group’s (the Group) financial operations, accounting, accounting policy, internal controls over financial reporting, & corporate tax requirements. The role will take leadership responsibility for managing the finance related execution of key business & strategic projects, including the modernization of Finance’s systems, software, and key processes. The role requires an individual who has the acuity to influence across various levels of the organization, including the communication of significant developments that impact accounting & financial reporting for CWB leaders, & our Board of Directors. This role holds an active membership with several Committees of the Group & will engage with third party regulators (OSFI, CDIC, Bank of Canada) & external auditors as required.

Fundamental Knowledge & Experiences To Grow From

The incumbent holds a university degree in Accounting, Business, or Finance and is a designated Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) who actively demonstrates participation in continuing professional development.
  • Executive or senior level financial and/or accounting officer background with experience in publicly traded and complex service oriented organizations, including with corporate tax.
  • Experience implementing financial and accounting systems.
  • Previous banking or financial services experience is a definite asset.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and sound understanding of risk management
  • Knowledge of and experience in organizing employees around a dynamic strategy in an entrepreneurial environment.
Skills that will take you further
  • Leadership. A proven ability to provide strong leadership for the financial concerns of an organization similar to CWB required. A leadership style that is open, collaborative yet results-oriented, and respects the capabilities and independence of employees, while providing them with a clear sense of direction and supported by a strong focus on mentoring and motivating professional employees.
  • Critical thinking & strategy execution. Propensity to think strategically and plan effectively for an organization working in a diverse and sophisticated environment. Validated ability to lead and implement a technology improvement/accounting system replacement plan; adept at managing organizational change and seizing opportunities for growth.
  • Relationship building. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop positive relationships both externally and internally within a multifaceted organization while relating well to people of all backgrounds and at all levels.
  • Committed to inclusion. A deep commitment to promoting and supporting a diverse organization, and an emphasis on diversity in all operations.
  • Analytical & articulately balanced. Strong analytical capability and the adeptness to comprehend and articulate intricate business and regulatory situations.
  • Communication skills. Excellent written and oral communications skills and an ability to articulate the value of CWB to potential customers, shareholders, investors, communities and to the public at large.
  • Agility & equanimity. Proficient in processing a multitude of tasks simultaneously and to perform under pressure with a temperament that is constantly seeking new opportunities while thriving in a changing environment.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit. Possesses an innovative bent with well-honed business instincts.
Why work with us?
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements . Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Compressed work weeks & more.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, or lead an employee-regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup. We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to put your money to work for you.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada
Find your purpose. Make your mark. Go further with CWB. Apply today.
CWB is proud to partner exclusively with Caldwell Partners on our search. All applications will be reviewed and assessed upon receipt - only individuals selected for interview will be contacted. All responses to Caldwell Partners are confidential. Please indicate your interest in Project 210136 caldwell.thriveapp.ly/job/954

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Preconstruction Executive
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Preconstruction Executive will be an integral member of the team on a daily and weekly basis, attend or delegate attendance at all pertinent meetings, and become the go to resource, which ensures cost and constructability considerations become an integral part of all design decisions and ensure no surprises in the areas of cost, schedule, and quality. It is inherent that the Preconstruction Executive is recognized by the entire team as someone who adds true value to the process so they actively seek out the advice and concurrence of the Preconstruction Executive.

Responsibilities
  • The Preconstruction Executive functionally performs the role of a Project Manager on multiple projects during the design phase.
  • The prime responsibility is management of the entire preconstruction process to ensure a design which meets the clients functional, cost, and schedule requirements without engaging in significant redesign.
  • Working through the Support Operations Manager and the Regional Operations Manager, the Preconstruction Executive ensures that all necessary resources, both field and office based, are efficiently utilized for all: estimates, value engineering sessions, constructability and coordination reviews, schedules, project buyout, early procurement, permitting, and planning requirements to ensure a seamless transition into the construction phase.
  • This level of full service involvement will typically be focused on at risk projects.
  • Their ability to manage larger, more logistically or technically challenging preconstruction efforts.
  • Manage a variety of delivery methods (CMAR, D/B, IPD), as well has possess the business acumen to understand contractual instruments of service.
  • Ability to manage teams.
  • Business Development and presentation skills.
  • Ability to mentor and manage succession.
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • Bachelor’s or Master's degree
  • 10+ years of purchasing and/or construction experience
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • In depth knowledge of design and construction practices and materials
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and stand up communication skills
  • Working knowledge of estimating, purchasing, and scheduling
  • Highly refined interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Strong planning and risk management skills
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Medewerker vergunningen APV
item.content:encoded:
Voor het team APV Vergunningen zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste beoordelaar van APV-vergunningen, die zorgvuldig te werk gaat, maar ook een hoge productie kan leveren. Heb jij ervaring in het behandelen van vergunningaanvragen en onderhoud je graag contacten? Lees dan hieronder verder!

Wat ga je doen?
Als vergunningverlener behandel je vergunningaanvragen voor de APV-activiteiten terrasvergunningen, verkeersontheffingen, opbreekvergunningen en verkeersbesluiten. Je bent in staat deze aanvragen zelfstandig te behandelen aan de hand van wet- en regelgeving en gemeentelijk beleid en je bent verantwoordelijk voor toekenning of afwijzing daarvan. Je onderhoudt daarbij contacten met adviseurs, zoals van wegbeheer en de veiligheidsregio. Je signaleert en beoordeelt afwijkingen en draagt oplossingen aan.

Wat vragen wij?
Je bent klantgericht en kunt goed samenwerken. Je bent resultaatgericht en omgevingssensitief, waardoor je goed kunt verbinden op uitvoeringsniveau. Je hebt een juridische opleiding gevolgd of ruime ervaring in juridische functies. Je toont verantwoordelijkheid, door bijvoorbeeld rekenschap te geven over ondernomen activiteiten in relatie tot de gekozen doelen. Daarnaast hou je van een goede uitdaging.

Daarnaast beschik je over

  • Mbo werk- en denkniveau.
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring binnen een grote en bestuurlijke organisatie.
  • Kennis van en/of ervaring met vergunningen is een grote pré.
  • Kennis van relevante wet- en regelgeving.



Kortom je bent een leuke collega met kennis van zaken.

Wat bieden wij?
Bij ons vind je een inspirerende en dynamische werkomgeving en kansen voor eigen initiatieven en om jezelf persoonlijk te ontwikkelen.

Afhankelijk van je achtergrond en (werk)ervaring bieden we je

  • Een arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd voor de duur van 12 maanden met eventueel een proeftijd. Bij goed functioneren is er mogelijkheid tot verlenging of een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd. Heb je bij de gemeente Den Haag een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd of heb je recht op een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd in verband met de ketenbepaling, dan behoud je je arbeidsrecht.
  • Een salaris van minimaal € 2.170,- en maximaal € 3.176,- bruto per maand op basis van een volledige (36-urige) werkweek (schaal 7).
  • Een 22-urige werkweek met de mogelijkheid om compensatieverlof op te bouwen.
  • Diverse opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden.



Ook kun je rekenen op een uitstekend arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket

  • Opname in het ABP-pensioenfonds.
  • Een maandelijkse bijdrage aan de ziektekostenverzekering.
  • Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB) ter waarde van 17,05% bovenop jouw salaris wat je naar keuze kunt inzetten voor bijvoorbeeld extra verlof, salaris of lidmaatschap van de sportschool gevestigd in het stadhuis.



Wie zijn wij?
Binnen de dienst Stadsbeheer (DSB) is de Handhavingsorganisatie verantwoordelijk voor het afhandelen van vergunningsaanvragen, het toezicht op en handhaving van de wet- en regelgeving in de openbare ruimte. Het werkgebied is heel breed van horecacontroles tot hondenoverlast en van parkeren tot rommel op straat. Wij vertegenwoordigen de gemeente met betrekking tot leefbaarheid.

De Handhavingsorganisatie bestaat uit vier afdelingen. Team APV Vergunningen valt onder de afdeling Vergunningen en Handhaving. Naast de APV Vergunningen worden binnen deze afdeling andere soorten vergunningen verleend. Voorbeelden zijn Parkeervergunningen, maar ook vergunningen voor het kappen van bomen, aanbrengen van handelsreclame en het realiseren van uitwegen. Ook wordt er binnen de afdeling Vergunningen en Handhaving de bestuurlijke handhaving afgehandeld en behandelt zij de bezwaren tegen naheffingsaanslagen bij het betaald parkeren.

Meer weten?
Voor meer informatie over de functie en de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact opnemen met Nadine van Brakel (teamhoofd APV Vergunningen) te bereiken via (06) 311 010 91.

Extra informatie
  • Meer over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden vind je op www.werkenvoordenhaag.nl/arbeidsvoorwaarden.
  • Afhankelijk van je opleiding en werkervaring kun je in de aanloopschaal geplaatst worden.
  • Het opvragen van referenties kan een onderdeel zijn van de procedure.
  • Het aanvragen van een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) kan deel uitmaken van de procedure.
  • Indien we niet fysiek met sollicitanten in gesprek kunnen in verband met de ontwikkelingen rond het coronavirus, vinden de sollicitatiegesprekken online plaats met de applicatie Microsoft Teams. Onderaan de pagina is een bijlage toegevoegd met tips voor een online sollicitatiegesprek.

item.title: Java Kotlin Software Architect | tot € 78.000 + vast contract!
item.content:encoded:
Jouw baan: Java Kotlin Software Architect Amsterdam / Technical Lead

  • Houd je van architectuur / design, terwijl je de technische leiding hebt en hands-on tastbare greenfield systemen van scratch kan gaan bouwen?
  • Ben je geïnteresseerd om te werken aan greenfield, zeer betrouwbare, high available en superveilige greenfield betalingssystemen die dagelijks door honderdduizenden consumenten worden gebruikt?
  • Hoe zit het met het werken aan lange termijn projecten terwijl je samenwerkt met jouw collega's vanuit jouw eigen geweldige kantoor?
  • Vind je het leuk om real life uitdagingen op te lossen, waar software en hardware elkaar ontmoeten terwijl je vanaf dag één een vast contract wordt aangeboden!?

Wacht dan niet langer, dit is misschien wel jouw volgende nieuwe baan!

Jouw werkgever: meer dan 30 jaar ervaring met het oplossen van real life voor honderdduizenden consumenten!

Er is momenteel een revolutie gaande! In onze 24/7 wereldwijde economie zijn wetten rond betalingen / transacties flexibeler geworden. Hierdoor zijn er allerlei disruptieve spelers in de huidige markt verschenen. Het wordt dus steeds makkelijker om te betalen waar en hoe je wilt. Per kaart, via software, jouw telefoon, crypto, In het openbaar vervoer, in winkels, op kantoren en natuurlijk peer-to-peer!

Dit middelgrote, zeer tech gedreven softwarebedrijf is een van DE specialisten achter deze innovatie, met hardware- en softwarespecialisten die hand in hand werken. Hier werken betekent het oplossen van real life uitdagingen en altijd tastbare resultaten zien voor honderdduizenden mensen over de hele wereld!

Ze zijn een van de best bewaarde geheimen in de regio Amsterdam en groot genoeg om een aantal van de meest uitdagende Europese softwareprojecten van begin tot eind uit te voeren. Toch zijn zij klein genoeg om iedereen bij naam te kennen en kun je gemakkelijk jouw collega's benaderen voor hulp. Zelfs mensen die in aanmerking kwamen voor een baan bij bedrijven als Amazon en Google, kozen er uiteindelijk voor om hier te werken!

Hun cultuur is zo uniek: zeer informeel, gepassioneerd, super sociaal, korte lijnen en platte hiërarchie geleid door enkele van de meest inspirerende en gepassioneerde engineers die er zijn. Gemiddeld werken mensen hier al meer dan 8 jaar, omdat ze continu uitdagingen blijven aangaan met veel plezier!

Jouw baan: Java Kotlin Software Architect Amsterdam / Technisch Hoofd

Als je geïnteresseerd bent om te groeien in architectuur en het ontwerpen van systemen, ben je hier aan het juiste adres! Je bent altijd betrokken vanaf het begin van elk project, terwijl je kunt sparren met veel van je zeer ervaren (hands-on) software architect collega's.

In je rol als Java Kotlin Software Architect Amsterdam speel je een fundamentele rol in elk softwareproject, met een looptijd van ongeveer 1,5 tot 2 jaar. Je hebt dus altijd genoeg tijd om hoogwaardige kwaliteit software te bouwen! Je staat direct in contact met een groep zeer vertrouwde (internationale) klanten die jouw visie echt waarderen, hun uitdaging analyseren, de beste technische oplossing voorstellen, de architectuur / design opzetten, het beste team vormen en hands-on werken met jouw team om verbazingwekkende greenfield-software van schaal te leveren.

Uitdagingen die jij zult aanpakken, zijn non-blocking, security, availability, reliability en schaalbaarheid. En dat terwijl je elk project altijd vanaf scratch begint, zodat je maximale creatieve impact hebt en ten alle tijden kunt werken met de modernste technologieën.

Enkele van de technologieën waarmee ze momenteel werken: Java11, Vert.X, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Reactive Programming, Non-Blocking, Kafka en Lambda’s. Goed om te weten: er is geen eerdere ervaring met Kotlin nodig, alleen Java! Als echte engineer kun je Kotlin hier leren!

Wat vereist is?

  • Minimaal 6+ jaar professionele ervaring ontwikkeling ervaring
  • Professionele ervaring met Java of Kotlin (en de bereidheid om met beide samen te werken)
  • Ervaring met architectuur en design
  • Ervaring met het leiden van een of meer teams van software-engineers + mentorschap
  • Een afgeronde technische bachelor of master is een groot pluspunt
  • Ervaring met Reactive Programming is een pluspunt
  • Ervaring met Spring Boot en Kafka is een pre
  • Ervaring met het bouwen van zeer veilige en / of hoogst beschikbare systemen zijn pluspunten


Wat wordt er aangeboden?

  • Tussen € 70.000 bruto en € 78.000 bruto per jaar op basis van toegevoegde waarde
  • Een vast contract! (ideaal voor het kopen van een huis)
  • De mogelijkheid om 32, 36 of 40 uur te werken!
  • Solide pensioen
  • 27 vakantiedagen, gebaseerd op fulltime (2 boven het gemiddelde!)
  • Maximaal twee dagen thuiswerken
  • Flexibele werkuren
  • De beste hardware
  • Dagelijkse lunch op kantoor
  • Opleidingsbudget
  • Reiskosten worden voor je betaald!


Heb je passie om leidend te zijn in zeer betrouwbare en veilige greenfield-systemen met de JVM terwijl je samenwerkt met enkele van de coolste, door technologie gedreven collega's die je hebt ontmoet?



Soliciteer dan via het onderstaande formulier of stuur je cv naar Robert Hawker stuurt via r.hawker@codeguild.nl

Hierdoor zijn er allerlei disruptieve spelers in de huidige markt verschenen\u003C/strong\u003E. Het wordt dus steeds makkelijker om te betalen waar en hoe je wilt. Per kaart, via software, jouw telefoon, crypto, \u003Cstrong\u003EIn het openbaar vervoer, in winkels, op kantoren\u003C/strong\u003E en natuurlijk peer-to-peer!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EDit middelgrote, zeer tech gedreven softwarebedrijf is een \u003Cstrong\u003Evan DE specialisten achter deze innovatie\u003C/strong\u003E, met hardware- en softwarespecialisten die hand in hand werken. Hier werken betekent het \u003Cstrong\u003Eoplossen van real life uitdagingen\u003C/strong\u003E en altijd \u003Cstrong\u003Etastbare resultaten zien voor honderdduizenden mensen\u003C/strong\u003E over de hele wereld!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EZe zijn een van de best bewaarde geheimen in de regio Amsterdam en groot genoeg om \u003Cstrong\u003Eeen aantal van de meest uitdagende Europese softwareprojecten van begin tot eind uit te voeren\u003C/strong\u003E. Toch zijn zij klein genoeg om iedereen bij naam te kennen en kun je gemakkelijk jouw collega's benaderen voor hulp. Zelfs mensen die in aanmerking kwamen voor een baan bij bedrijven als \u003Cstrong\u003EAmazon en Google, kozen er uiteindelijk voor om hier te werken!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EHun cultuur is zo uniek: \u003Cstrong\u003Ezeer informeel, gepassioneerd, super sociaal, korte lijnen en platte hiërarchie\u003C/strong\u003E geleid door enkele van de \u003Cstrong\u003Emeest inspirerende en gepassioneerde engineers\u003C/strong\u003E die er zijn. Gemiddeld \u003Cstrong\u003Ewerken mensen hier al meer dan 8 jaar, omdat ze continu uitdagingen blijven aangaan met veel plezier!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EJouw baan: Java Kotlin Software Architect Amsterdam / Technisch Hoofd\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EAls je geïnteresseerd bent om te groeien in architectuur en het ontwerpen van systemen, ben je hier aan het juiste adres! \u003Cstrong\u003EJe bent altijd betrokken vanaf het begin van elk project\u003C/strong\u003E, terwijl je kunt sparren met veel van je zeer ervaren (hands-on) software architect collega's.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EIn je rol als Java Kotlin Software Architect Amsterdam \u003Cstrong\u003Espeel je een fundamentele rol in elk softwareproject, met een looptijd van ongeveer 1,5 tot 2 jaar\u003C/strong\u003E. Je hebt dus \u003Cstrong\u003Ealtijd genoeg tijd om hoogwaardige kwaliteit software te bouwen!\u003C/strong\u003E Je staat direct in contact met \u003Cstrong\u003Eeen groep zeer vertrouwde (internationale) klanten die jouw visie echt waarderen\u003C/strong\u003E, hun uitdaging analyseren, \u003Cstrong\u003Ede beste technische oplossing voorstellen\u003C/strong\u003E, de \u003Cstrong\u003Earchitectuur / design\u003C/strong\u003E opzetten, het \u003Cstrong\u003Ebeste team vormen en hands-on werken \u003C/strong\u003Emet jouw team om \u003Cstrong\u003Everbazingwekkende greenfield-software van schaal te leveren\u003C/strong\u003E.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EUitdagingen die jij zult aanpakken, zijn \u003Cstrong\u003Enon-blocking\u003C/strong\u003E, \u003Cstrong\u003Esecurity, availability, reliability\u003C/strong\u003E en schaalbaarheid. En dat terwijl je elk project altijd vanaf scratch begint, zodat je maximale creatieve impact hebt en ten alle tijden kunt werken met de modernste technologieën.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EEnkele van de technologieën waarmee ze momenteel werken: \u003Cstrong\u003EJava11, Vert.X, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Reactive Programming, Non-Blocking, Kafka en Lambda’s\u003C/strong\u003E. Goed om te weten\u003Cstrong\u003E: er is geen eerdere ervaring met Kotlin nodig\u003C/strong\u003E, alleen Java! Als echte engineer kun je Kotlin hier leren!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWat vereist is?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E \u003Cli\u003EMinimaal \u003Cstrong\u003E6+ jaar professionele ervaring ontwikkeling ervaring\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EProfessionele ervaring met \u003Cstrong\u003EJava of Kotlin (en de bereidheid om met beide samen te werken)\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EErvaring met \u003Cstrong\u003Earchitectuur en design\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EE\u003Cstrong\u003Ervaring met het leiden van een of meer teams van software-engineers + mentorschap\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EEen afgeronde \u003Cstrong\u003Etechnische bachelor of master is een groot pluspunt\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EErvaring met \u003Cstrong\u003EReactive Programming is een pluspunt\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EErvaring met \u003Cstrong\u003ESpring Boot en Kafka is een pre\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EErvaring met \u003Cstrong\u003Ehet bouwen van zeer veilige en / of hoogst beschikbare systemen\u003C/strong\u003E zijn pluspunten\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWat wordt er aangeboden?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E \u003Cli\u003ETussen \u003Cstrong\u003E€ 70.000 bruto en € 78.000 bruto per jaar op basis van toegevoegde waarde\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EEen vast contract! (ideaal voor het kopen van een huis)\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EDe mogelijkheid om 32, 36 of 40 uur te werken!\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003ESolide pensioen\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E27 vakantiedagen, gebaseerd op fulltime (2 boven het gemiddelde!)\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EMaximaal twee dagen thuiswerken\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EFlexibele werkuren\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EDe beste hardware\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDagelijkse lunch op kantoor\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EOpleidingsbudget\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EReiskosten worden voor je betaald!\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EHeb je passie om leidend te zijn in zeer betrouwbare en veilige greenfield-systemen met de JVM terwijl je samenwerkt met enkele van de coolste, door technologie gedreven collega's die je hebt ontmoet?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESoliciteer dan via het onderstaande formulier of stuur je cv naar Robert Hawker stuurt via r.hawker@codeguild.nl\u003C/strong\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Medewerker","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"CodeGuild","sameAs":"https://nl.linkedin.com/company/codeguild","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQE0NuvSN6DjwA/company-logo_200_200/0/1540306065609?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=Q0pbDi1kxpcs_HZUE385-36dXpTaGeSwCrltUor31zk"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"CodeGuild","value":"4397d63d4da40e6e36aaab47649b5627"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQE0NuvSN6DjwA/company-logo_100_100/0/1540306065609?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=SObsvSB8HLBTCa3CBz2bL55no9BlwGJLSwVitH7kxOQ","industry":"Informatietechnologie Kotlin Software Architect | tot € 78.000 + vast contract!","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:05:10.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Head Customer Strategy- Amazon Pay
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Pay ( APIPL) is seeking an innovative and highly motivated customer strategy leader to define the payments customer roadmap in India.
This role is to design and implement the customer understanding roadmap to make Amazon Pay the most trusted, convenient and rewarding payment experience for customers and merchants alike The leader will inform the customer/merchant input and segmentation strategy to enhance the customer value proposition across product concept evaluation, attribute tradeoffs and marketing input measurement to achieve this goal . The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of tech/digital product user research methods and best practices, along with a nimble, creative and pragmatic approach, and top-notch communication skills.
This position requires the ability to work with the leadership team on distilling customer problem statements from customer anecdotes, industry best practices and business trends as well as the capacity to work quickly while delivering high-quality outputs. This position will work on overlapping projects, so strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task are critical. Amazon is a fast-paced and exciting environment. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with considerable ambiguity and will be able to thrive in a resource-constrained environment.


Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

10+ years experience in a top 5 management consultancy org leading consumer projects
Has set up/scaled a consumer strategy consulting practice across a leading consumer business in India
MBA from top tier B School


Preferred Qualifications

Retail/E-commerce research experience in a global context


Company - Amazon Pay(India) Private Lmtd
Job ID: A1266020

item.title: Sales Representative
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

Position Summary

This role is responsible to manage all marketing and sales activities in his/her assigned territory. This role works closely with the Customer Service team located in Woodbridge, ON who supports job quoting, order entry, inventory confirmation and liaison/sequencing with manufacturing and product shipping.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Promote company image.
  • Monitor customer and end users on an ongoing basis:
    • Offer pricing when required
    • Keep Royal literature up to date
    • Track inventory levels
    • Track product use on a project basis
  • Follow territory sales plan to meet regional and national sales strategy
  • Build relationships with distributors, consulting engineers, municipalities, contractors and developers
  • Document supporting information gathered in your territory
  • Maintain log books outlining territory contacts
  • Gather competitor information and report to Senior Management.
  • Identify new opportunities/markets.
  • Train customers and end users.
  • Gain approval at Municipalities and coordinate with Specification Engineers therein.
  • Solve non-technical related problems.
  • Develop relationship with customer and end users
  • Act a liaison between customer and company, and keep inside sales office informed of pricing and trends.
  • Manage territory/expenses and track against budget levels.
  • Visit each city every two to three weeks
  • Plan to meet: utilities, consulting engineers, contractors, distributors, municipalities
  • Prioritize based on forecasted/budgeted sales, price negotiation, upcoming project potential (use Daily Commercial News)
  • Targets for developing new contacts should be developed with the Sales Mgr.
  • Complete all assigned paperwork on a weekly basis. This includes call reports, C.A.R’s, and expense reports.

Education And Experience
  • Skilled in selling techniques (5+ years’ experience), knowledgeable in one or more of the waterworks, plumbing and/or electrical supply industries
  • Requires tact and empathy to resolve customer concerns in satisfactory fashion
  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and verbally with customers and co-workers at all levels, i.e. Senior and local customer personnel, Department Managers/Supervisors, Sales Managers. Must be confident public speaker when delivering sales presentations (PowerPoint)
  • Must be computer literate with Outlook, MS Word and Excel. Also familiar with up-to-date sales reporting processes
  • Requires recognized post-secondary education relevant to sales/marketing. Preference for a recognized business management degree with specialization in sales/marketing

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

item.title: React Native Developer, Remote, Full Time
item.content:encoded:
Are you an experienced software engineer with deep experience in building and shipping amazing products? Do you have high standards when it comes to code quality and user experiences? Are you the best developer on your team? Are you ready to work alongside the best engineers in the world for name-brand, industry leading companies? Do you want to work in a positive, uplifting work environment, for a company with a 4.5 star rating on GlassDoor? Is a competitive compensation and benefits package important to you?

Join FullStack Labs as we revolutionize the software consulting industry, and execute on our mission to rid the world of ugly, outdated, buggy software.

As an engineer at FullStack Labs you will help our incredible clients achieve their technical goals in one of two ways: 1) Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client’s team and work alongside their existing engineers on a daily basis. 2) Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs development team to build and ship greenfield applications for our clients.What We're Looking For:
  • 4+ years of professional software development experience. 6+ years preferred but not required.
  • 2+ years of professional experience working with React Native.
  • Experience with the following technologies a plus, but not required: React.js, Swift, Java, Node.js, Ruby on Rails
  • Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.
  • A four-year college degree is required.
  • Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon, both in regards to estimates and to general process.
  • Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
  • An understanding of React Native best practices and a commitment to following them.
  • Ability to work through new and difficult React Native issues and contribute to libraries as needed.
  • Ability to create and maintain continuous integration and delivery of React Native applications.
  • A positive mindset and can-do attitude.
  • Forensic attention to detail.
  • You’re passionate about software development...it’s not just your career, it’s your hobby. You’re constantly striving to learn new things and improve. You follow industry news, regularly tinker with new technologies, and read books and blogs to keep your skills current.
  • You work well within a team environment and enjoy working in the office with your colleagues.
  • Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.
  • Ability to be productive working remotely ()
What You'll Be Doing:
  • Work as part of a small team to build React Native IOS / Android applications for FullStack's clients.
  • Architect, build and maintain excellent quality React Native applications with clean code.
  • Implement pixel perfect UI's that match designs.
  • Implement clean, modern, smooth animations and transitions that provide an excellent user experience.
  • Integrate with third-party API's.
  • Write unit and integration tests.
  • Release applications to IOS and Google Play stores.
  • Work with native modules when required.
  • Work as part of small team, which will include other React Native developers, a project manager, a QA professional, and a designer.
  • Complete two week sprints and participate in sprint retrospectives and daily standups.
  • Assist with building estimates.
  • Interface with clients via Slack, Zoom, and email.
  • Track your time throughout the day using Toggle.
  • Work with modern tools including Jira, Slack, GitHub, Google Docs, etc.
  • Be part of a community of React Native developers that share knowledge and help each other as problems arise.
  • Follow FullStack's detailed development process.
Benefits
  • All Locations
  • Competitive Salary
  • Overtime pay
  • 100% remote work, now and post COVID.
  • The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies in the USA.
  • USA Benefits
  • Health, dental, vision insurance
  • 401k w/ 4% match
  • PTO banking
  • Profit-Sharing Bonus
  • Colombia Benefits
  • Prepaid Medical
  • English Classes
  • All standard government-required benefits
  • $250,000 / month Sodexo Food Card
Wrapping it All Up

Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for developers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on client’s businesses.

You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software developer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world.

So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and consulting, please apply.

item.title: PINTOR DE MOTOS
item.content:encoded:
Detalle de la oferta Pintor de motos - VELOCI MOTORS

Salario Neto Mensual

$6,000.00

Ubicación

Jalisco, Zapopan -

Tipo De Contrato

Contrato por tiempo indeterminado

Vigencia De La Oferta

7 de marzo de 2021

Días Laborales

L Ma Mi J V

Horario De Trabajo

8:00 a 18:00 hrs.

Rolar Turnos

No

Requisitos

Estudios Solicitados

Secundaria/sec. técnica en Ninguna

Experiencia

6m - 1 año

Competencias Transversales

Trabajo en equipo, Planeación y organización, Responsabilidad

Idiomas

No es requisito

La empresa ofrece

Prestaciones

Prestaciones de ley

Número De Plazas

10

Funciones y actividades a realizar

Reparador de motocicletas y activacion de motos, pintor y retocador de las mismas. conocimientos en pintura automotriz, detallado y retocador de las motocicletas, habilidad manual.

Observaciones

    • Ubicación

     Regresar

    Para poder postularte debes proporcionar una cuenta de correo electrónico
    Actualizar tu perfil laboral

    Actualizar tu perfil laboral

    Al postularte, el Portal del Empleo enviará información de tu perfil a la
    empresa que realiza la oferta. La empresa te notificará vía correo
    electrónico si eres candidato(a) para la oferta de empleo seleccionada.

    ¿Deseas continuar con el proceso de postulación?

    Se detectó que no ha realizado el proceso de canalización, favor de acudir a la oficina del SNE más cercana para realizar este trámite.

    Se detectó que está canalizado a otro programa, favor de acudir a la oficina del SNE más cercana para verificar proceso de canalización.

    Número De Plazas

    10

    Funciones y actividades a realizar

    Reparador de motocicletas y activacion de motos, pintor y retocador de las mismas. conocimientos en pintura automotriz, detallado y retocador de las motocicletas, habilidad manual.

    Observaciones

    • Ubicación

     Regresar

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - Nationwide Opportunities
item.content:encoded:
Description

Want to help the largest global enterprises derive business value through the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)? Excited by using massive amounts of disparate data to develop ML models? Eager to learn to apply ML to a diverse array of enterprise use cases? Thrilled to be a part of Amazon who has been pioneering and shaping the world’s AI/ML technology for decades?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML models on the AWS Cloud. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. AWS Professional Services works together with AWS customers to address their business needs using AI solutions.

AWS Professional Services is a unique consulting team. We pride ourselves on being customer obsessed and highly focused on the AI enablement of our customers. If you have experience with AI, including building ML models, we’d like to have you join our team. You will get to work with an innovative company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun helping our customers. A successful candidate will be a person who enjoys diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions.

This is a customer-facing role and you will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed.

Major Responsibilities Include
  • Assist customers by being able to deliver a ML project from beginning to end, including understanding the business need, aggregating data, exploring data, building & validating predictive models, and deploying completed models with concept-drift monitoring and retraining to deliver business impact to the organization
  • Use AWS AI services (e.g., Personalize), ML platforms (SageMaker), and frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build ML models
  • Research and implement novel ML approaches, including hardware optimizations on platforms such as AWS Inferentia
  • Work with our other Professional Services consultants (Big Data, IoT, HPC) to analyze, extract, normalize, and label relevant data, and with our Professional Services engineers to operationalize customers’ models after they are prototyped

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent professional or military experience
  • Experience with ML fields, e.g., natural language processing, computer vision, statistical learning theory
  • 6+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science, and analysis
  • Experience in an ML engineer or data scientist role building and deploying ML models or hands on experience developing deep learning models
  • Experience writing code in Python, R, Scala, Java, C++ with documentation for reproducibility
  • Experience handling terabyte size datasets, diving into data to discover hidden patterns, using data visualization tools, writing SQL, and working with GPUs to develop models
  • Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s degree of PhD in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
  • Ability to develop strategic, baselined, data modeling processes; ability to accurately determine cause-and-effect relationships.
  • Publications or presentations in recognized ML journals or conferences
  • Deep technical skills, consulting experience, and business savvy to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customers’ organization
  • Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $116,200 per year. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.


Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.
Job ID: A1273920

item.title: Supervisor Mecánico Automotriz
item.content:encoded:
KAVAK es el e-commerce N°1 para la compra y venta de vehículos en América Latina, proyectada como una de las empresas más grandes de la región.
Hemos sido seleccionados como "Emprendimiento del año 2018" por la Revista Expansión, también por el ranking #LinkedInTopStartup 2019 y 2020 como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en México y nos convertimos en la primera startup en alcanzar el estatus de unicornio (valorado en $ 1 billón de dólares) en México.

Nuestra misión es transformar el mercado de compra y venta de segunda mano brindando la mejor experiencia, transparencia y seguridad a nuestros clientes.

Como contexto, KAVAK opera en México desde hace poco más de 4 años y ha ido creciendo exponencialmente. Actualmente somos más de 1,800 kavakos en el equipo, incluyendo operaciones en Brasil y Argentina. Como parte de este crecimiento acelerado queremos garantizar que nos rodeemos del mejor talento para fortalecer nuestros equipos y así seguir construyendo la tecnología, procesos y productos que nos permitan transformar el mercado automotriz.

¿Estás motivado para ser parte de esta misión y ayudarnos a construir el resto de la historia?

¡Únete a nosotros como supervisor de mecánicos!

Al aplicar a este cargo tendrás las siguientes funciones:

  • Supervisar la reparación de autos y servicios
  • Asegurar el correcto diagnóstico de autos (multimarca), incluyendo parte mecánica y eléctrica
  • Conocimiento del mercado de autopartes para diferentes marca



¿Qué buscamos?

  • Experiencia en reparación de autos, incluyendo parte mecánica y eléctrica (Preferente en agencia)
  • Manejo de equipo
  • Dominio técnico en los diagnósticos y reparaciones de sistemas automotrices haciendo uso de herramienta especializada
  • Responsabilidad
  • Honestidad
  • Pro-actividad
  • Trabajo en equipo
  • Gestión del tiempo



¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Sueldo base entre $14,000 y $16,000 MXN netos mensuales
  • Bono mensual con base en resultados
  • Prestaciones de ley y superiores
  • Tarjeta de asistencia CAE (tarjeta con servicios y descuentos como médicos, nutriólogos, psicólogos, asistencia legal, funeraria, seguro por reembolso de gastos médicos por accidente cubre hasta $20,000.00, entre muchos otros servicios)
  • Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores
  • ¡La mejor cultura laboral!


Este rol es primordial para el crecimiento de KAVAK en esta etapa de innovación, consolidación y expansión.

item.title: Millwright
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

Millwright or Millwright-Electrician

This role will encompass maintenance responsibilities on your shift including:
  • Overhaul/installation of mechanical and electrical equipment on a predictive/preventative and breakdown basis
  • Troubleshooting mechanical, and to the extent qualified, electrical systems
  • Proficiency with burning and non-pressure welding is essential to be effective on your shift.
  • As we modernize our plant in stages (on-going), a greater proportion of the workload will focus on AC Vector drives, trouble-shooting of PLC controlled mechanical equipment, etc.

The successful applicant will be a certified maintenance Millwright (preferred candidates will be dual-ticketed Millwright/Electricians).

, As Per The Below

We operate the Maintenance Department on 12-hour shifts at a classified rate of $35.10/hr. (rate currently under review with change effective Apr. 1, 2021) which maximizes an individual’s days off (7 regular days off in a 2-week pay period). However, the effective wage rate due to the various add-ons provided is significantly over $40/hr.
  • Overtime is paid at double time, which is voluntary and commonly available during normal operations and annual maintenance shutdown
  • We also offer a Group RRSP not requiring employee contributions with 8% company funding on ALL cash earnings
  • Full medical package including health, dental, life and disability with 100% company paid premiums
  • We offer dual-ticketed journeymen (combination of mechanical and electrical) an additional $2.00/hr. premium
  • Lastly, our employees participate in two separate bonus systems that generate significant additional compensation over the year based upon achieving realistic operational targets

Should you be interested in applying for this position, please submit your resume via the link provided.

We would like to express our appreciation to all applicants but note that only those of interest will be contacted for interviewing.

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

item.title: Data Center Regional Electrical Engineer (Field Engineering)
item.content:encoded:
Description

The Data Center Field Engineering Team is the engineering owner for the lifecycle of our data centers. This includes supporting new designs/innovations through data center end-of-life, with a focus on root cause analysis of failures, capacity and availability improvement, and optimization of the existing fleet. Amazon’s data centers are industry-leading examples of innovation in the areas of space utilization, energy efficiency, high availability, and cost effectiveness. AWS sets the bar for speed to market and reliability.

Amazon Data Services India Private Limited (ADSIPL) is seeking a Field Engineer with an Electrical Engineering background to become part of a global engineering team responsible for existing site project design and continuous innovation of our rapidly expanding fleet. As one of our Field Engineers, you will work directly with our Construction, Operations, and Commissioning teams at the data centers and partner directly with our Design Engineering group who own new-builds. Projects are typically within your assigned region and you will own analysis of problems and subsequent solutions. You will be the engineering representative for an issue where our internal customers will look to you for engineering-based solutions and guidance. AWS has worked hard to develop a large-scale fleet of data centers and drives continuous improvements within our designs. We will look for you to continue that trend by providing suggestions to improve the cost /performance/simplicity of existing designs and systems. This will include reviewing current designs and contributing your field experience to work with the Design Engineering team to develop new systems and equipment.
In addition, Field Engineers act as Resident Engineers during new construction projects – especially in new regions. You will directly support construction as an extension of Design Engineering, and be a part of the process from site selection review through commissioning and site turnover. Amazon has a global presence and domestic and international travel may be necessary up to 25% of your time. Team work is an absolute must for us to accomplish our goals. You must be able to work within a team while both depending on and driving others to accomplish the end goal for our customers. Field Engineers work with internal groups as well as external suppliers and consultants including utilities, manufacturers, vendors, and contractors.

Responsibilities

The Field Engineer will be responsible for the following:
  • Learn and Understand the design and functionality of the data centers within your region in ADSIPL.
  • Troubleshoot problems and conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and Corrective Action (CA) for design and equipment related failures. Field Engineers are expected to become stewards of Availability and directly support our Operations Team.
  • Direct Support to Operations technicians/staff including ad-hoc trainings and complex operating procedure review.
  • Own the design for existing data center upgrades and design-solutions including projects that add capacity, improve availability, and increase personnel or equipment safety.
  • Provide direct influence over all designs for construction of new data centers, including engineering support during the construction and commissioning phases of electrical/mechanical/structural systems.
  • Interface with internal data center design engineering team, server hardware team, environmental health and safety team to promote standards that maintain consistency and reliability in services delivered.
  • Travel to your local site to support your workload, and up to 25% travel to other regions.
  • Work on concurrent projects, sometimes in multiple geographical regions.
  • Be a leader within the group as well as within other teams.
  • Be positive and offer creative out of the box solutions.
  • Provide immediate technical guidance to operations during critical events.
  • Have fun and work hard!

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience.

6+ cumulative years of experience with industrial or commercial engineering in Mission Critical facilities. (Experienced Engineer)

Preferred Qualifications
  • Coursework in commercial/industrial power systems and/or mechanical systems
  • Organized and have the ability to set priorities and meet deadlines and budget
  • Possess leadership and problem-solving skills
  • Direct experience with the design, construction, operation, or maintenance of mission critical facilities, especially data centers.
  • Experience as resident engineer or hands-on (in the field) design consultant.
  • Knowledge of building codes and regulations for your region.
  • Experience reading, interpreting, and creating construction drawings, specifications, and submittal documents.
  • Ability to carry design concepts through exploration, development, and into deployment/mass production
  • Possess excellent communication and writing skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
  • Basic understanding of both mechanical and electrical equipment/design related to data centers (Including but not limited to: uninterruptable power sources , diesel generators, electrical switchgear, power distribution units, variable frequency drives, automatic/static transfer switches, chillers [air-cooled and water-cooled], pumps, cooling towers, heat exchangers, CRAHs, air economizers, etc...)
  • EPMS/SCADA/BMS Controls system experience (software and/or hardware)
  • Registered Professional Engineer
  • Advanced degree in engineering, business, or related field.
  • Have fluent knowledge of continuous operating redundant electrical systems, cooling systems, air flow containment systems and building management systems. (Including but not limited to: uninterruptable power sources, AC/DC conversion, P&ID loops, diesel generators systems and complex arrangements, direct evaporative cooling systems, etc...)
  • Ability to develop solutions and execute plans on complex projects
  • Experience with fast track design/build projects and or multiple significant upgrade projects

Company - ADSIPL - Telangana
Job ID: A1279413

You must be able to work within a team while both depending on and driving others to accomplish the end goal for our customers. Field Engineers work with internal groups as well as external suppliers and consultants including utilities, manufacturers, vendors, and contractors.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EResponsibilities\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EThe Field Engineer will be responsible for the following:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Learn and Understand the design and functionality of the data centers within your region in ADSIPL.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Troubleshoot problems and conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and Corrective Action (CA) for design and equipment related failures. Field Engineers are expected to become stewards of Availability and directly support our Operations Team.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Direct Support to Operations technicians/staff including ad-hoc trainings and complex operating procedure review.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Own the design for existing data center upgrades and design-solutions including projects that add capacity, improve availability, and increase personnel or equipment safety.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Provide direct influence over all designs for construction of new data centers, including engineering support during the construction and commissioning phases of electrical/mechanical/structural systems.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Interface with internal data center design engineering team, server hardware team, environmental health and safety team to promote standards that maintain consistency and reliability in services delivered.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Travel to your local site to support your workload, and up to 25% travel to other regions.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Work on concurrent projects, sometimes in multiple geographical regions.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Be a leader within the group as well as within other teams.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Be positive and offer creative out of the box solutions.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Provide immediate technical guidance to operations during critical events.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Have fun and work hard!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EBasic Qualifications\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EBachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E6+ cumulative years of experience with industrial or commercial engineering in Mission Critical facilities. (Experienced Engineer)\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EPreferred Qualifications\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECoursework in commercial/industrial power systems and/or mechanical systems\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EOrganized and have the ability to set priorities and meet deadlines and budget\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPossess leadership and problem-solving skills\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EDirect experience with the design, construction, operation, or maintenance of mission critical facilities, especially data centers.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EExperience as resident engineer or hands-on (in the field) design consultant.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EKnowledge of building codes and regulations for your region.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EExperience reading, interpreting, and creating construction drawings, specifications, and submittal documents.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAbility to carry design concepts through exploration, development, and into deployment/mass production\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPossess excellent communication and writing skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EBasic understanding of both mechanical and electrical equipment/design related to data centers (Including but not limited to: uninterruptable power sources , diesel generators, electrical switchgear, power distribution units, variable frequency drives, automatic/static transfer switches, chillers [air-cooled and water-cooled], pumps, cooling towers, heat exchangers, CRAHs, air economizers, etc...)\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EEPMS/SCADA/BMS Controls system experience (software and/or hardware)\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ERegistered Professional Engineer\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAdvanced degree in engineering, business, or related field.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EHave fluent knowledge of continuous operating redundant electrical systems, cooling systems, air flow containment systems and building management systems. (Including but not limited to: uninterruptable power sources, AC/DC conversion, P&ID loops, diesel generators systems and complex arrangements, direct evaporative cooling systems, etc...)\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAbility to develop solutions and execute plans on complex projects\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EExperience with fast track design/build projects and or multiple significant upgrade projects\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany\u003C/strong\u003E - ADSIPL - Telangana\u003Cbr\u003EJob ID: A1279413","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Not Applicable","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Amazon","sameAs":"https://www.linkedin.com/company/amazon","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHTvZwCx4p2Qg/company-logo_200_200/0/1612205615891?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=WfYR37G08TkVa7lN5a3vt-3hjaPFkkq_WURo-HMa1a4"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Amazon","value":"1279413"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHTvZwCx4p2Qg/company-logo_100_100/0/1612205615891?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=yvrUvyQ56ohO0TWzcoTwQF7GCRTKM6yOmjExx8jIhk0","industry":"Computer Software,Information Technology and Services,Internet","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Hyderabad","addressRegion":null,"postalCode":"500001","addressCountry":"IN"}},"skills":"","title":"Data Center Regional Electrical Engineer (Field Engineering)","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:59:09.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Full Stack Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Familiarity with common stacks and a very strong basics in JavaScript, AngularJS React.JS, MongoDB/Firebase, C#/Java/Python with an eye for creativity and knowledge about UI/UX is a big turn.


If you have an experience of developing mobile and desktop application and if you can write clean readable code, you already have our thumbs up.


You must be a team player with good communication skill and ready to learn attitude.

item.title: Senior Project Executive
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Project Executive is representative of the Company responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of simultaneous complex construction-management projects; as well as mentoring multiple Project Executives.

Responsibilities
  • Direct and supervise work of project administration, project superintendents, and engineers to establish operational priorities and maintain satisfactory relationships with owners, subcontractors, unions, etc.
  • Enforce project reporting requirements
  • Manage critical issues
  • Assume overall accountability for jobsite safety and quality
  • Mentor Project Executives
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 10-15 years in the lead role on projects valued at $150 million or larger
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong technical and communication skills are critical
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Leadership and management skills
  • Knowledge of Prolog, Microsoft Office (preferred)
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Manager - DLS
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon’s Disability and Leave Services (DLS) team in the Employee Services (ES) organization is building a best-in-class case management program to deliver leave of absence, disability and accommodation services to Amazon employees globally. To support this growth globally, DLS is driving to redesign our processes and tools for service globalization and infinite scalability, requiring strong operational leadership to help us achieve this.
While some in our organization will work on new service designs and specifications, we need expert operational / service delivery manager, with strong leadership skills, service operations in line with our leadership principle of customer obsession. The DLS Manager will pride themselves and have a track record of flawless execution, continuous improvement of service operations using people, tools and processes, demonstrating ownership and a bias for action. The ideal candidate must possess energized and challenged bias in a role where they lead and develop people organizations whose focus is on exceptional service delivery. The DLS Manager will lead successfully through a well-developed, cohesive leadership team that amplifies the vision and commitments they declare. The DLS Manager will work across multiple business groups and locations delivering DLS services to employees, managers and HR colleagues, earning trust of stakeholders.

The DLS Manager role consists also in providing exceptional customer service, partnership and coordination with business teams, senior leadership, managers and HR. The ideal candidate require exceptional operational knowledge, execution, data understanding and leadership skills to take on a highly impactful specialist role while managing a team of 12-15 DLS members regarding leaves and accommodations. The successful candidate will assist in fostering the growth of the program and development of the process changes and opportunities to improve efficiency and the customer experience.

This role will need to see things through to completion, have the ability to manage and coordinate complex processes, possess exceptional communication skills with all levels of employees and management, superior attention to detail, ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment, strong critical thinking and fact-finding skills, and exceptional customer service focus. Additionally, the ideal candidate must possess a bias for action to develop and improve processes, take ownership and show initiative. This individual will need deep subject matter knowledge, strong communication and interpersonal skills and an ability to provide phenomenal customer service.

Position Responsibilities

Project Management And Communication
  • Developing team capabilities: This position will work at an individual and team level to develop HR and leadership skills, provide stretch opportunities to advance the team and provide career development opportunities for team members.
  • Identifies customer impacting issues and implement solutions and process improvements to increase customer satisfaction. Participates in cross-functional process improvement initiatives influencing site and country procedures with little or no guidance.
  • Knows how to deal with ambiguity taking calculated risks at the moment of making decisions that are impactful to the operation.
  • Assists in developing and implementing training programs to improve the quality and productivity of the teams.
  • Drives continuous improvement processes/initiatives to enhance the operational efficiency of the site. Understands and effectively utilizes resources provided by internal systems, departments, policies, and procedures. Executes business goals.
  • Creates business cases and manages enhancements. Presents high quality data findings.
  • Responds to escalations, providing root cause analysis and recommendations. Develops remediation plan and drives to resolution with minimal guidance from Manager.
  • Subject matter expert in contact center environment involving Work Flow, training, finance, among other support teams.
  • Possess high capacity and planning knowledge. Forecast and recruiting skills.
People Management
  • Leads and develops work teams; responsible for the overall direction, performance management, coordination and evaluation of the teams. Manages and ensures high service delivery and execution.
  • Achieves performance goals and objectives in line with the network wide vision and goals. Has the ability of dealing with conflict despite personal comfort.
  • Communicates policies to the team and become the primary information source for staff; following-up to ensure compliance and consistency; taking corrective action as necessary and documenting the issue and actions taken.
  • Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Amazon’s policies and procedures; additional responsibilities include interviewing, training and motivating employees; planning, assigning and directing work; and effective conflict resolution.
  • Creates a safe, trusting environment for communication based on open dialogue; encourage team members to express views.
  • Represents Amazon’s Leadership Principles at all times.
Subject Matter Expertise
  • Acts as a Subject Matter Expert for customers, team and vendors. General understanding of ES workload and priorities.
  • Knows and works with outside sources to develop interpretations and solutions for complex issues.
  • Performs audits of team’s work, providing coaching and feedback to support ongoing performance improvement. Assists in developing and approving performance guidelines
  • Advocates for ES.
Basic Eligibility

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Overall 8-10 years of experience.
  • Minimum 5 years of managerial experience with client facing roles on US geography.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a field such as Business Administration, B. Com Human Resources or equivalent graduation degree.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Strong People & operational leadership skills.
  • Strong Analytical Ability
  • Ability to manage large & complex projects
  • Experience of managing diversified portfolios /processes ( Voice / back-office)
Preferred/Essential Skill Requirement

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Ability to handle projects using the Project Management principles and methodology.
  • Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma.
  • Fluent in English and third language proficiency is an added advantage.
  • Basic US legislation Leave of Absence and Accommodations knowledge.
  • Preferred 2 years of Leave and/or Accommodations experience., Knowledge of federal and state leave and disability laws
  • Experience in providing consultation and guidance on leave of absence, human resources, benefits, or complex employee matters
Note: Only Permanent L5 with minimum 1 year at current role candidates will be considered for this role


Company - ADCI PNQ 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1277929

Com Human Resources or equivalent graduation degree.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong People & operational leadership skills.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong Analytical Ability\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Ability to manage large & complex projects\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience of managing diversified portfolios /processes ( Voice / back-office)\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EPreferred/Essential Skill Requirement\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Ability to handle projects using the Project Management principles and methodology.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Fluent in English and third language proficiency is an added advantage.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Basic US legislation Leave of Absence and Accommodations knowledge.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Preferred 2 years of Leave and/or Accommodations experience., Knowledge of federal and state leave and disability laws\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience in providing consultation and guidance on leave of absence, human resources, benefits, or complex employee matters\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003ENote: Only Permanent L5 with minimum 1 year at current role candidates will be considered for this role\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany\u003C/strong\u003E - item.title: IT Support Engineer I
item.content:encoded:
About OpsTech IT

DESCRIPTION

Operations is at the heart of Amazon’s business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. OpsTech IT provides nonstop global IT support to Amazon Operations as a vital piece to the puzzle. We are looking for self-motivated individuals to take on new challenges and motivate teams in fostering solutions to the hurdles we face. Together, we take ownership for what we do — whether supporting IT infrastructure, developing new technology in-house, launching a new Amazon Operations facility, or delighting our customers by delivering packages directly to them.

About The Role

As an IT Support Engineer I, you will use your knowledge and specialized skills to implement technical solutions and provide high quality support for computer hardware, operating systems, or enterprise application software. You are able to determine when it is appropriate to deviate from a standard practice to accomplish the desired result. You can troubleshoot and solve straightforward problems that do not have defined SOPs.
What Do We Offer?
Amazon offers competitive compensation packages including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1, matching 401(k) program, and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. But wait there’s more: we don’t wear suits and ties! Come as you are because jeans, t-shirts, sneakers and sometimes a neon safety vest will be your daily outfit.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to
  • Network engineering and troubleshooting, data cabling and systems administration in a variety of software and hardware environments.
  • Ensure infrastructure networking and computing systems remain available during production hours.
  • Interact with management and staff to provide analytical and technical assistance for continuous improvement of IT solutions.
  • Manage local technical projects.
  • Maintain or create policies, procedures, and processes.
  • Identify root-causes of operational issues and process inefficiencies.
  • Ability to move up to 49lbs as well as stand and walk for 10-12 hours at a time with or without reasonable accommodation

Basic Qualifications
  • High School diploma or GED equivalent
  • 2+ Years of experience in one or more of the following: Microsoft Administration, Linux Administration, or Cisco IOS (CLI)
  • 2+ years of experience of troubleshooting in a multi-user high availability environment
  • 2+ years or experience with networking concepts such as DNS, DHCP, SSL, OSI Model, and TCP/IP
  • 2+ years of experience in PC repair, troubleshooting, deployment, and liquidation
  • 1+ years IT experience with client, server, and network service delivery
Preferred Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or IT related field.
  • Microsoft MCSE, MCITP Systems Administrator (Active Directory)
  • Cisco CCENT certification
  • Data center infrastructure and facilities experience
  • Ability to explain complex IT concepts in simple terms
  • Ability to manage high priority projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proven ability to work successfully with limited supervision
  • Ability to travel up to 25%
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1273882
