item.title: Senior Estimator
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Estimator will support and work with preconstruction/BD staff in the review of project plans, requirements and specifications and will organize and supervise a team of estimators to perform pricing, and bidding of projects.

Responsibilities
  • Review and understand all project plans, requirements and specifications
  • Coordinate and supervise a team of estimators to develop large, multi-disciplinary estimates.
  • Determine labor and equipment costs
  • Review and understand all bid documents and assess project risks
  • Understand project logistics and project schedule
  • Prepare bid packages and compare and analyze competitive subcontract and supplier bids
  • Review quotes and estimates with Project Team and prepare recommendations
  • Interface with clients, ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Accurately develop cost models
  • Track and report on current material and labor prices, including escalation
  • Develop meaningful VE contributions to reduce price
  • Reconcile quantity surveys with consultants and design team
  • Identify escalation factors in marketplace for specific materials and labor rates
  • Responsible for sound conceptual pricing assumptions with sound documentation for the basis of the estimate
  • Ability to substantiate all aspects of final estimates
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • Bachelor in Engineering
  • 5-10 years relevant experience
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Able to estimate all types of building projects, including residential high rise, healthcare, interiors and institutional
  • Knowledge of suitable electrical contractors and suppliers for all types of projects
  • Familiar with both union and merit shop electrical contractors preferred
  • Knowledge of typical electrical pricing for project types above; for both union and merit shop projects preferred
  • Able to take concept and schematic drawings and develop a meaningful estimate with detail
  • Familiar with the use of On-Screen Take-off software program preferred
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Banking Associate
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Multiple positions, Multiple locations across Canada! Please provide resume & detailed cover-letter outlining interest in program.
Transcripts will be required for all candidates selected for interviews.

CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

We’re on a mission to become a powerful force in Canadian banking. Our target clients are small and medium-sized business owners, and they expect a clear alternative. They deserve a proactive partner who helps them succeed. We’re caring. We’re forward-thinking. We’re specialized. And we’re redefining a proactive client experience in a constantly evolving climate. We have real relationships with our clients. We genuinely care about them & their success. We don’t sit back passively. We respond with urgency & speed, anticipate our clients’ needs, come to them with valuable ideas, and advise. That’s how we become the best full-service bank for business owners in Canada. It's how we deliver on our brand promise of being obsessed with your success™.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. LGBTQ2S+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this program, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.
Difference makers. Life-long learners. Proactive achievers. Change advocates. Game changers. Self-starters. The passionately committed.We hire with intention. The mildly interested need not apply. Decided on a career in Business Banking?
Learn what it takes to be a commercial banker in our Banking Associate Program. You’ll be part of an exclusive cohort gaining real work experience while learning sought after industry skills. Through hands-on mentorship and coaching, you’ll dive deep into commercial banking and become a critical member of our team dedicated to serving our clients. Hiring in all four programs: General Commercial, Equipment Financing, Real Estate & Specialty Lending and Cash Management, we will align you to the ideal accelerator program based on your expertise and interests.

Put your education to work and ignite your career with a proud Canadian owned company. While we may have grown up in the Prairies, we are excited to continue to build on our growth strategy as we rapidly expand our national footprint coast-to-coast. Mobility is an asset and often rewards you with fast-tracked developmental opportunities and greater exposure.
The program specifics
Banking Associates are part of a developmental program designed to equip new graduates with a foundation for a commercial banking career. This role focuses on developing core-banking skills and provides credit structuring, credit underwriting, risk management and delivering client solutions with increasing autonomy and complexity over the course of a 12-month accelerator program. Partnering with experienced professionals in the branches, including account specialists, relationship managers, credit analysts, and business development managers, to support the day to day operations of the business.

What Makes You a Fit
  • You’re completing your undergraduate degree and can begin work in the spring of 2021.
  • Building relationships and networking with people from a diverse group of backgrounds is in your DNA.
  • You have an analytical mind, are naturally curious, and love diving into data to inform your decisions.
  • You’re fascinated by financial services and understanding business operations of today and tomorrow.
  • You're prepared to be brand ambassador and sell client-based solutions with confidence, negotiating impactful outcomes for all.
  • You are results driven with a bias for action. You push yourself to achieve goals, welcoming challenges and pursuing objectives with energy, drive and the need to finish, and finish well.
  • You take ownership of your own learning and development, actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged.
  • You’re agile in the face of change and can operate effectively even when the way forward is unclear.
  • The word inclusion has deep meaning to you. It’s more than a concept, it’s a way of thinking, behaving and holding yourself accountable.
  • You collaborate and contribute to optimize every interaction.
Why work with us? Benefits to benefit you.
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup. We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

 Learn more about the Banking Associate Program.

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"JobPosting","datePosted":"2021-02-06T05:57:33.000Z","description":"CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMultiple positions, Multiple locations across Canada!\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/em\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E \u003Cem\u003EPlease provide resume & detailed cover-lette\u003C/em\u003Er\u003Cem\u003E outlining interest in program.\u003C/em\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E \u003Cem\u003ETranscripts will be required for all candidates selected for interviews.\u003C/em\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EAt CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put \u003Cstrong\u003Epeople first\u003C/strong\u003E and \u003Cstrong\u003Ebuild relationships with intention\u003C/strong\u003E. We seek out and \u003Cstrong\u003Eembrace new \u003C/strong\u003Eideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that \u003Cstrong\u003Ehow we do things\u003C/strong\u003E is as important as what we do. And we harness \u003Cstrong\u003Ethe power of inclusion\u003C/strong\u003E. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe’re on a mission to become a powerful force in Canadian banking. Our target clients are small and medium-sized business owners, and they expect a clear alternative. They deserve a proactive partner who helps them succeed. We’re caring. We’re forward-thinking. We’re specialized. And we’re redefining a proactive client experience in a constantly evolving climate. We have real relationships with our clients. We genuinely care about them & their success. We don’t sit back passively. We respond with urgency & speed, anticipate our clients’ needs, come to them with valuable ideas, and advise. That’s how we become the best full-service bank for business owners in Canada. It's how we deliver on our brand promise of \u003Cem\u003Ebeing obsessed with your success™.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/em\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. LGBTQ2S+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EAll applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this program, because at CWB we believe that \u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cem\u003Einclusion has power\u003C/em\u003E, \u003C/strong\u003Eand we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDifference makers. Life-long learners. Proactive achievers. Change advocates. Game changers. Self-starters. The passionately committed.\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWe hire with intention. The mildly interested need not apply.\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Decided on a career in Business Banking? \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ELearn what it takes to be a commercial banker in our\u003Cstrong\u003E Banking Associate Program\u003C/strong\u003E. You’ll be part of an exclusive cohort gaining real work experience while learning sought after industry skills. Through hands-on mentorship and coaching, you’ll dive deep into commercial banking and become a critical member of our team dedicated to serving our clients. Hiring in all four programs: \u003Cstrong\u003EGeneral Commercial, Equipment Financing, Real Estate & Specialty Lending and Cash Management\u003C/strong\u003E, we will align you to the ideal accelerator program based on your expertise and interests.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EPut your education to work and ignite your career with a proud Canadian owned company. While we may have grown up in the Prairies, we are excited to continue to build on our growth strategy as we rapidly expand our national footprint coast-to-coast. Mobility is an asset and often rewards you with fast-tracked developmental opportunities and greater exposure.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E The program specifics \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EBanking Associates are part of a developmental program designed to equip new graduates with a foundation for a commercial banking career. This role focuses on developing core-banking skills and provides credit structuring, credit underwriting, risk management and delivering client solutions with increasing autonomy and complexity over the course of a 12-month accelerator program. Partnering with experienced professionals in the branches, including account specialists, relationship managers, credit analysts, and business development managers, to support the day to day operations of the business.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EWhat Makes You a Fit\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou’re completing your undergraduate degree and can begin work in the spring of 2021.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EBuilding relationships and networking with people from a diverse group of backgrounds is in your DNA.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou have an analytical mind, are naturally curious, and love diving into data to inform your decisions.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou’re fascinated by financial services and understanding business operations of today and tomorrow.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou're prepared to be brand ambassador and sell client-based solutions with confidence, negotiating impactful outcomes for all.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou are results driven with a bias for action. You push yourself to achieve goals, welcoming challenges and pursuing objectives with energy, drive and the need to finish, and finish well.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou take ownership of your own learning and development, actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou’re agile in the face of change and can operate effectively even when the way forward is unclear.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EThe word inclusion has deep meaning to you. It’s more than a concept, it’s a way of thinking, behaving and holding yourself accountable.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYou collaborate and contribute to optimize every interaction.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Why work with us? Benefits to benefit you. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWinners of \u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020 \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Your voice matters. \u003C/strong\u003E Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E The opportunity to make a difference \u003C/strong\u003E . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Physical health and mental fitness are priorities \u003C/strong\u003E . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Community giving. \u003C/strong\u003E Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Bring your whole self to work. \u003C/strong\u003E Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Innovation. \u003C/strong\u003E Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Connection. \u003C/strong\u003E Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Organization wide coaching services \u003C/strong\u003E . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Recognition. \u003C/strong\u003E Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Financial rewards \u003C/strong\u003E . Yup. We pay you too. Base \u003Cstrong\u003Eplus \u003C/strong\u003Eperformance incentives!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Retirement investment strategy. \u003C/strong\u003E You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Company ownership. \u003C/strong\u003E The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Great Places To Work. \u003C/strong\u003E CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Discover CWB. item.title: WHS Specialist
item.content:encoded:
Description

WHS Specialist

Overview

Amazon Fulfillment is seeking a full-time WHS Specialist (WHSS) to serve as a designated for their assigned fulfillment center (FC), coordinating and implementing all areas of the Amazon Global Program as directed by the leadership. The WHSS promotes a positive culture while complying with Amazon standards and maintaining a safe work environment. This includes conducting trainings and coaching associates on observed work habits.

The WHSS is required to maintain accurate , weekly, and monthly metrics to report to onsite management teams and corporate based reporting systems. The WHSS supports management’s efforts to ensure compliance with all corporate Program expectations and applicable federal & state laws. The WHSS also conducts assessments related to jobs performed (Job Hazard Analysis) and new equipment introductions. In addition, the WHSS is responsible for recommending appropriate mitigation measures to management, including ergonomics.
*Relocation assistance is not provided*

WHS Specialist Responsibilities
  • Identify and inform management of compliance issues, risks, and improvement opportunities through the conduct of , weekly, and monthly audits
  • Facilitate investigation process
  • Maintain required paperwork to comply with Amazon and regulations
  • Enter Information in internal database in a timely manner
  • Perform observations & audits
  • Train and assist others (Area Managers, team members, etc.) to complete their responsibilities (Audits, Follow Rules, etc.)
  • Perform specific training as required by the Manager
  • May have additional responsibility for fire prevention, hazardous waste management, or other related activities depending on the business unit and location
  • Participate in process improvement activities and manage actions to completion
Essential Skills, Knowledge And Experience
  • Ability to communicate and needs to all levels of the organization
  • Calm demeanor in situations

Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Minimum of 1 years in an Environmental & (EHS) related field or bachelor’s degree in related field
  • Knowledge of regulations specifically 29 CFR 1910
  • Experience using Microsoft Word and Excel in a professional capacity
  • Experience maintaining confidentiality in matters involving security and/or personnel issues in the work place
  • Available to work flexible shifts including days, nights and/or weekends

    • Preferred Qualifications

    PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
    • Bachelor's degree or higher, preferably in a related field
    • Strong communication, teamwork, analysis, judgment, and customer focus skills
    • Experience leading and managing a team Ability to analyze accident data, new processes, and machinery for potential concerns and conduct job hazard and job analyses
    • Experienced in response and currently holds and certificates Experience in Worker’s case management
    • Passion for
    Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


    Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
    Job ID: A1274254

item.title: IB Process Assistant
item.content:encoded:
Key Job Elements

DESCRIPTION
  • Support and work in the department as required
  • Helping support daily management of department duties, including allocating labor, leading meetings, assigning job duties, and communicating with internal and external suppliers
  • Providing vacation coverage for Area Managers
  • Providing policy follow-up, attendance tracking (duties do not extend to discipline)
  • Tracking and reporting of ATS/labor hours
  • Assisting the floor as an associate resource, training associates and verifying SOP compliance
  • Ensuring successful area performance, through tracking, reporting and feedback of associate performance
  • Participating in Operational Excellence initiatives in some capacity
  • Filling in as needed with production duties
  • Fully understanding workflow and daily production goals
  • Reviewing and updating SOP as required
  • Assisting in keeping work area clean and organized
  • Identifying and addressing safety hazards within the work area
  • Coaching associates to work safely at all times
  • Participating in safety initiatives
  • Referring all job injuries immediately to area manager

Basic Qualifications
  • A high school diploma or equivalent
  • Are at least 18 years old, and authorized to work in the United States
  • Able to work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
  • Able to lift up to 49 pounds, stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours, and be able to frequently push, pull, squat, bend and reach, all with or without reasonable accommodation
  • 2+ years of work experience or a completed Associate’s Degree
  • 1+ year of experience working with computers and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)
Preferred Qualifications
  • 1+ year of leadership experience directly managing others
  • 1+ year working in a like environment (manufacturing/distribution/warehousing/large retail)
  • Experience with performance metrics and lean process improvemen
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills to coach, train and assist team members

Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon M
Job ID: A1252325

item.title: Senior Technical Program Manager
item.content:encoded:
Description

If you are a TPM who is interested in solving core ML problems and using those solutions to improve WW Transportation network planning, we may just have a role for you. We are looking for a highly motivated TPM who loves dealing with ambiguity. This role will require you to work on a PE scoped problem, act as an entrepreneur and build partnerships with WW Retail, Fulfillment and Transportation Tech teams.

What is iAudit?
Transportation of packages in Amazon has significantly evolved over the past several years. We employ a mix of transportation modes (AMZL, 3P, AMZL+3P) to deliver packages to customers efficiently, and on time. Transportation planning activities are heavily dependent on the quality of source data (e.g. package weight, package dimensions, postal code, rate-card entries, etc.) and an error in any of these inputs can lead to sub-optimal planning decisions (e.g. greater cost, missed customer promises, etc.).
We are embarking on an ambitious vision to leverage performance signals from Transportation businesses to improve the quality of upstream source data used by the planning systems (such as ATROPS). These signals include, off-manifest charges (discrepancies between Amazon estimated shipping costs and carrier invoiced shipping costs), missed customer promises, etc. Improvements in quality of upstream data will help improve Transportation planning and thus result in generating cost savings and delighting our customers through a pleasant delivery experience.

What engineering challenges you would solve?
You will work on areas that are highly exploratory in nature. You will work closely with Principal Engineer, Product Manager, SDE-3s, Applied Scientists and BIEs to solve deep engineering problems.
  • You will deep dive into architecture of upstream teams and map their business logic to disambiguate the authoritative source of planning datasets through Decision Trees.
  • You will work with Scientists to enhance ML algorithms to detect precise upstream issues with high confidence and suggest corrections.
  • Using results from these models, you will initiate pilot studies to correct upstream data.
  • You will leverage learnings from the pilot studies to disambiguate and design a comprehensive solution for providing feedback to upstream teams. The feedback systems will be bi-directional and multi-tiered. iAudit will generate feedback to upstream teams, which could generate secondary feedback to other upstream systems or back to iAudit, which may further trigger tertiary feedbacks. You will define these solution pathways.
Who we are?
Amazon’s transportation systems get millions of packages to customers worldwide faster and cheaper while providing world-class customer experience – from checkout to shipment tracking to delivery. Transportation Financial Systems (TFS) is responsible for building technologies that support financial aspects for Amazon transportation. Our software systems include services that handle thousands or requests per second and make decisions to pay billions of dollars a year and ensure that transportation's liabilities and revenues are correctly accounted for. With rapid expansion into new geographies, innovations in supply chain, delivery models and customer experience, increasingly complex transportation network, ever-expanding selection of products and growing number of shipments worldwide, we have an opportunity to build software that scales not only with volume but also with the business models. We leverage cutting-edge technologies in big data, machine learning, real time analytics and high volume, low latency, high availability services.
TFS is 100+ tech team across 8 different platforms. We deal with problems of scale. Billions of dollars of spend is automated through our platforms and pipelines. We are a very fast growing org and we aggressively ramping up our team across all engineering roles. The tech team is completely based out of India.


Basic Qualifications
  • Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules
  • 7+ years of experience working directly with engineering teams
  • 5+ years of technical program management experience
Preferred Qualifications
  • Deeply entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to the cause
  • Strong dealing with ambiguity and independent operation
  • Exceptional deep dive and attention to detail
  • Strong ability to formulate strategic direction from low level data
  • Ability to engage multiple teams and align expectations towards a shared goal
  • Possess strong business judgment and communication skills

Company - ADCI HYD 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1280931

item.title: Product Specialist
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

JOB TITLE: Product Specialist – Canadian Electrical & Plumbing, and North American Fittings

REPORTS TO: Director of Product Management and Development

Summary

Leader in developing the strategy, tactics, and deliverables for the Canadian Electrical and Plumbing market segments while stewarding the execution of these through effective product management and marketing of the product portfolio and business group resources.
  • Engage the full channel to understand market needs and drivers to improve efficiency and effectiveness of new and innovative products and services, targeting ‘Industry Firsts.’
  • Access key tools, internal and external relationships, and resources to understand markets, market share, competitive landscape & benchmarking; engage functional partners (e.g., Sales, Technical, Marketing, Supply Chain and Operations) to drive optimal results.
  • Develop key execution tools to track KPI performance, product line performance and effectiveness of functional engagement with key partners as listed above.
  • Drive product development projects in support of new business development activities for NAPCO across defined channels.
  • Drive accountability and manage the overall success of existing and new product lines, as well as defining and tracking sales results for new product launches.

Duties And Responsibilities

May include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Customer visits – North America and international as warranted to evaluate market needs and opportunities
  • Facilitate specifier, ‘owner,’ distributor and contractor ‘Voice of the Customer’ activities
  • Full product management responsibility for all SKU’s in multiple product lines in both the Plumbing and Electrical segments in Canada:
    • Monitor competitive product developments and drive competitive benchmarking activities
    • Make decisions on product line rationalization and provide suggested disposition on slow-moving inventory
    • Product specification review and approval
    • Assure Agency certifications achieved
    • Manage and approve all product design changes
    • Support investigation of field failures and other customer complaints
  • Lead new product development projects working with Technical and Operations
    • Investigate and manage new product development opportunities
    • Prioritize projects based on strategic importance, ROI and payback
    • Lead New Product Development Teams, align launch timing with key sales milestones, using detailed project management scheduling to meet dates
    • Provide detailed financial analyses on all new product and capital procurement decisions
    • Utilize NAPCO Stage-Gate development process; conduct post launch audits as scheduled
  • Plan, evaluate and define marketing tactics to achieve strategic goals in product, price, promotion and distribution while providing direction to Marketing personnel.
  • Develop, maintain and regularly refresh the annual business plan for Electrical & Plumbing segments including market size, market share, macro-economic drivers and trends, competitive analysis, customer/channel strategy, product portfolio strategy, pull-through/demand generation activities, customer value proposition and overall strategic goals and objectives for channel market share, sales and profitability.
  • Partner with Marketing to support development of annual marketing plan with goal of building affinity and generating leads
  • Support the Director of Product Management, Marketing and Development in the exploration of new technologies, new market segments and possible partnership/Joint Venture opportunities
  • Work in conjunction with NAPCO sales team to ensure sales objectives are met, marketing programs implemented and strategic goals obtained. Educate sales team on new product features and benefits, sales programs and tools, as well as results of competitive benchmarking activities
  • Direct market research to execute needed testing and analysis and prepare business analysis as required to support decision making
  • Support the heads of Marketing, Technical and Operations in developing annual budgets

Education, Experience And Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Business; MBA preferred.
  • Engineering and/or technical background a plus.
  • 5 - 7 years of progressive marketing and product management experience.
  • Demonstrated capability in planning, organizing, integrating and measuring programs and projects; strong problem solving, analytical and computer skills (Windows Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
  • Must have the ability to work effectively and positively with all organizational levels, be proactive and an innovator
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; flexible, able to handle multiple projects at the same time
  • Ability to travel - approximately 35 - 40%

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; stand; walk; use hands to touch, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate as normally based in an office. Some of the work may be required in the operating units which can require usage of required PPE including safety glasses, hearing protection, etc. May also result in exposure to outside elements and may require usage of stairs and elevators.

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the \"Careers\" worklet and view \"Westlake Career \u003C/strong\u003EOpportunities\u003Cstrong\u003E\".\u003C/strong\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Associate","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"North American Pipe Co, a Westlake Company","sameAs":"https://www.linkedin.com/company/northamericanpipe","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHGg4_6SGuJeA/company-logo_200_200/0/1546972903577?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=wHdDqRCvPqVRsdtUDm6p-Z9ZzRCFjtlWpvVXxF_HCCs"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"North American Pipe Co, a Westlake Company","value":"R13679"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHGg4_6SGuJeA/company-logo_100_100/0/1546972903577?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=MupvcZiixG3leZEZcxy6h0bHTz4HqAkT42ydAO51b9k","industry":"Construction,Machinery,Consumer Goods","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Woodbridge","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"95258","addressCountry":"US"}},"skills":"","title":"Product Specialist","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:58:12.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Banking Associate
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Multiple positions, Multiple locations across Canada! Please provide resume & detailed cover-letter outlining interest in program.
Transcripts will be required for all candidates selected for interviews.

CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

We’re on a mission to become a powerful force in Canadian banking. Our target clients are small and medium-sized business owners, and they expect a clear alternative. They deserve a proactive partner who helps them succeed. We’re caring. We’re forward-thinking. We’re specialized. And we’re redefining a proactive client experience in a constantly evolving climate. We have real relationships with our clients. We genuinely care about them & their success. We don’t sit back passively. We respond with urgency & speed, anticipate our clients’ needs, come to them with valuable ideas, and advise. That’s how we become the best full-service bank for business owners in Canada. It's how we deliver on our brand promise of being obsessed with your success™.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. LGBTQ2S+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this program, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.
Difference makers. Life-long learners. Proactive achievers. Change advocates. Game changers. Self-starters. The passionately committed.We hire with intention. The mildly interested need not apply. Decided on a career in Business Banking?
Learn what it takes to be a commercial banker in our Banking Associate Program. You’ll be part of an exclusive cohort gaining real work experience while learning sought after industry skills. Through hands-on mentorship and coaching, you’ll dive deep into commercial banking and become a critical member of our team dedicated to serving our clients. Hiring in all four programs: General Commercial, Equipment Financing, Real Estate & Specialty Lending and Cash Management, we will align you to the ideal accelerator program based on your expertise and interests.

Put your education to work and ignite your career with a proud Canadian owned company. While we may have grown up in the Prairies, we are excited to continue to build on our growth strategy as we rapidly expand our national footprint coast-to-coast. Mobility is an asset and often rewards you with fast-tracked developmental opportunities and greater exposure.
The program specifics
Banking Associates are part of a developmental program designed to equip new graduates with a foundation for a commercial banking career. This role focuses on developing core-banking skills and provides credit structuring, credit underwriting, risk management and delivering client solutions with increasing autonomy and complexity over the course of a 12-month accelerator program. Partnering with experienced professionals in the branches, including account specialists, relationship managers, credit analysts, and business development managers, to support the day to day operations of the business.

What Makes You a Fit
  • You’re completing your undergraduate degree and can begin work in the spring of 2021.
  • Building relationships and networking with people from a diverse group of backgrounds is in your DNA.
  • You have an analytical mind, are naturally curious, and love diving into data to inform your decisions.
  • You’re fascinated by financial services and understanding business operations of today and tomorrow.
  • You're prepared to be brand ambassador and sell client-based solutions with confidence, negotiating impactful outcomes for all.
  • You are results driven with a bias for action. You push yourself to achieve goals, welcoming challenges and pursuing objectives with energy, drive and the need to finish, and finish well.
  • You take ownership of your own learning and development, actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged.
  • You’re agile in the face of change and can operate effectively even when the way forward is unclear.
  • The word inclusion has deep meaning to you. It’s more than a concept, it’s a way of thinking, behaving and holding yourself accountable.
  • You collaborate and contribute to optimize every interaction.
Why work with us? Benefits to benefit you.
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup. We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

 Learn more about the Banking Associate Program.

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Data engineer
item.content:encoded:
Description

The Amazon IN third-party marketplace team is looking for a highly driven, customer-obsessed Data Engineers who will be responsible for developing data architecture for CRM and BI platforms, data pipelines and reporting architecture to scale/support for decision making process across the group. You’ll analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems, help build metrics and business cases around key projects and, most of all, be an integral part of creating a better customer and seller experience.

Are you customer obsessed, flexible, smart and analytical, strategic yet execution focused, hungry and passionate about e-commerce, experienced, and entrepreneurial leader with a strong work ethic? If yes, this opportunity will appeal to you. Help the largest third-party marketplace in IN to make data driven decisions. In this role, you have to be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail and passion for data, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. It's a big ask, and we're excited to talk to those up to the challenge!


Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and 7+ years industry experience
  • Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, SQL and data warehousing.
  • Data Warehousing Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Pig, Spark, etc.) and/or Oracle, Redshift, MS SQL server DBs/related DBs
  • Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc)
  • Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets
  • Query performance tuning skills using SQL and Unix profiling tools
  • Strong project management skills, including work prioritization, planning, and task delegation
  • Ability to effectively communicate (both written and verbally) technical information and the results of engineering design at all levels of the organization

Preferred Qualifications

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related specialty (e.g., Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, Data Scientist) with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.
  • Strong business acumen
  • Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS technologies – Redshift, S3, EC2, Data-pipeline and other big data technologies
  • Experience providing technical leadership and mentor other engineers for the best practices on the data engineering space
  • Linux/UNIX including to process large data sets.
  • Experience with AWS

Company - ASSPL - Karnataka
Job ID: A1280838

item.title: Hoofd Strategie & Externe betrekkingen
item.content:encoded:
Wat ga je doen?
Den Haag, je kan er niet omheen! Letterlijk niet, want we liggen heerlijk aan de kust en hebben geen ringweg en dat heeft z’n consequenties. Figuurlijk niet, omdat we als regeringsstad en stad van vrede en recht in binnen- en buitenland naam hebben gemaakt. Als hoofd Strategie & Externe Betrekkingen stuur je rechtstreeks op de processen en inzet om dit qua stedelijke ontwikkeling te borgen. Je hebt daarvoor ook een directe verantwoordingslijn richting de algemeen directeur. Onder jouw verantwoording stippel je niet alleen de lijn uit om ook in de toekomst de ruimtelijk-economische kwaliteit van de stad Den Haag te zekeren, maar ook om onze belangen in en met de omgeving eenduidig en duidelijk voor het voetlicht te brengen en partners aan onze doelen te binden. Bovendien ontwikkel je ook de organisatiestrategie voor DSO. En daarnaast ben je plaatsvervangend afdelingsmanager van PSO, dat zich als afdeling ontwikkelt richting SEPO (Strategie, Externe betrekkingen, Portfoliomanagement & Onderzoek).

Wat vragen wij?
Je bent een ervaren rot in het vak en weet mensen te motiveren en in beweging te zetten! Je bent een teambuilder, die mensen kan enthousiasmeren. Je kunt op inhoud, proces en relatie verbinden en coachen, zonder daarbij je onafhankelijkheid te verliezen. Je stuurt op resultaten en hebt tegelijkertijd oog voor de relatie. Daarbij weet je DSO in contact te brengen met stakeholders zoals Ministeries, andere overheden en partners in stedelijke ontwikkeling en weet je ook hoe je invloed kunt uitoefen op Kabinet en Tweede Kamer. Je hebt een duidelijke visie en weet op inspirerende wijze de organisatiedoelen te realiseren, zeker die op strategisch niveau en gericht op onze belangenbehartiging.

Je hebt de dagelijkse leiding over een klein team strategen en adviseurs externe betrekkingen waarvoor je ook een inspirerend voorbeeld kunt zijn.

De nieuwe collega die onze afdeling komt versterken, brengt daarvoor het volgende mee

  • ruime ervaring in het optreden als strategisch externe adviseur, lobbyist, als ontwikkelaar, aanspreekpunt en spil ten aanzien van bestuurlijke relatienetwerken
  • minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als leidinggevende in een overheidsorganisatie of vergelijkbare omgeving
  • aantoonbare affiniteit, ervaring met en visie op integrale strategie- & organisatieontwikkeling
  • inzicht in internationale bestuurlijke verhoudingen en cultuurverschillen daarbinnen
  • ruime kennis van de beleidsterreinen binnen stedelijke ontwikkeling, bestuurlijke verhoudingen en inrichting van de gemeentelijke organisatie. En daarbij is gemeentelijke ervaring een pré.



Wat bieden wij?
Je krijgt volop de ruimte voor eigen initiatieven waarbij jij invloed kunt uitoefenen op de vernieuwing en doorontwikkeling van onze organisatie en verdere professionalisering van ons werk binnen stedelijke ontwikkeling. Als eindverantwoordelijke voor de vormgeving van externe betrekkingen en beleidsbeïnvloeding en als speler binnen de dienstbrede strategie- en organisatieontwikkeling bouw je hier stevig aan mee.

Daarbij kun je rekenen op

  • een arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd voor de duur van 12 maanden met eventueel een proeftijd. Bij goed functioneren zetten we dat vervolgens graag om in een overeenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd
  • een mooi salaris dat afhankelijk is van opleiding en ervaring, te weten minimaal € 5.075,- en maximaal € 6.994,- bruto per maand (schaal 14) op fulltime basis
  • een 36-urige werkweek, met ruimte om compensatieverlof op te bouwen.



Ook kun je rekenen op een uitgebreid arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, zoals

  • diverse opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden
  • opname in het ABP-pensioenfonds
  • een maandelijkse bijdrage aan de ziektekostenverzekering
  • een individueel Keuzebudget (IKB) ter waarde van 17,05% bovenop jouw salaris wat je naar keuze kunt inzetten voor bijvoorbeeld extra verlof, salaris of lidmaatschap van de sportschool gevestigd in het stadhuis.



Wie zijn wij?
De stafafdeling Programmamanagement, Strategie & Onderzoek (PSO) binnen de dienst Stedelijke Ontwikkeling zit in een transitiefase waarbij externe betrekkingen & lobby aan de afdeling wordt toegevoegd, strategie wordt versterkt en programmasturing wordt omgebouwd tot portfoliomanagement (van PSO naar SEPO). We zitten daar middenin. En met we bedoelen we dan in eerste instantie de ca. 25 collega’s in de afdeling, maar natuurlijk ook de ongeveer 900 collega’s binnen DSO. We vormen als afdeling namelijk de adviesgroep voor directie, management en collega’s voor wat betreft

  • de te kiezen strategie voor het Den Haag van morgen
  • de eenduidige (externe) belangenbehartiging en lobby van onze stad naar buiten toe
  • het via portfoliomanagement sturen en bijsturen van al ons werk binnen DSO
  • onderzoek en evaluatie gelieerd aan ons werk (zowel vooraf, tijdens en achteraf).



PSO ondersteunt en ontzorgt daarmee leidinggevenden en medewerkers van DSO in het ontwikkelen, volgen en verbeteren van de kwaliteit van de (beleids)uitvoering en dienstverlening.

Meer weten?
Voor meer informatie over de functie en de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact opnemen met

René Teule, afdelingsmanager PSO, op telefoonnummer +31 6 52485090.

Extra informatie
  • Een assessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure.
  • Het aanleveren van een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) maakt deel uitmaken van de procedure.
  • Wij nemen alleen sollicitaties in behandeling die binnen komen via het platform www.werkenvoordenhaag.nl.
  • Meer over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden vind je op www.werkenvoordenhaag.nl/arbeidsvoorwaarden.
  • Indien we niet fysiek met sollicitanten in gesprek kunnen i.v.m. de ontwikkelingen rond het Coronavirus, zullen de sollicitatiegesprekken online met de applicatie Microsoft Teams plaatsvinden.

item.title: T/O STANDARD
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

We are seeking enthusiastic, positive candidates who wish to contribute to a successful operation. Machine Operators will be trained to monitor and operate their production line in our 10-line operation. Over time, you will be trained on additional lines to improve operational flexibility.

All applicants must be able to work any shift in our 7/24 facility. We operate the plant under a 12-hour shift system (8:00 to 8:00) which has the benefit of only requiring seven work days in a 2-week pay period. This shift schedule offers the benefit of additional earnings compared to a standard forty-hour per week schedule. We are also seeking applicants who understand that employees make key contributions to developing a pro-safe work environment.

Candidates must be grade 12 graduates, at minimum. Additional consideration will be given to applicants offering completed post-secondary studies relevant to manufacturing. Other qualifications of interest would include Level II first aid, current forklift certifications, etc.

Abbotsford Pipe offers an hourly rate of $20.43/hr. ($19.43/hr. in probation) plus night shift premium ($0.50) and Continuous Shift Premium ($0.20/hr). Regular hours of work are assured. Within approximately one and one half years, the guaranteed rate of pay will escalate in two steps to at least $25.72/hr. Full company-paid medical, dental and group insurance plans plus an 8.0% Group RRSP are offered. In addition, our hourly team are eligible for two separate bonus plans that have paid consistently.

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

item.title: Trust Services, Senior Officer
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

12 Month Fixed Term
Canadian Western Trust – A service you can trust.

Since 1987, we have been providing trustee, custodial and administrative solutions for financial advisors, corporations and individuals. We are proud to be part of CWB Financial Group, which offers trust, banking and wealth management solutions. CWT is a fast-growing company; we continue to gain business due to our service and expertise in the industry. We are seeking a Trust Services, Senior Officer who is accountable for the day-to-day workflow and who will ensure all payments and SWP transactions are concluded in an accurate and synchronized manner. They work closely with the Manager, Trust Services and the Trust Services Officers in an exciting and team driven environment.

We are looking for someone who is very passionate about growing their career in the Trust industry. Come join a company who has a similar vision and wants to give you the support to develop your skills so you can hit new personal and professional achievements, all while tackling new challenges and taking on career development opportunities to reach your career dreams.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us.
What we ideally need from you:

  • 3+ years of administrative experience the financial industry with significant exposure to self-directed registered products.
  • Shown client service experience in financial services or a related industry
  • Strong understanding of RRSP, RRIF and TFSA rules
  • Some supervisory experience is an asset
Have that? Flawless, we are also seeking the following:

Forming relationships. You are all about clients and will be the first point of call for client issues.

An excellent support. You are an outstanding teammate and thrive working in a collaborative environment. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality.

Technologically proficient. You are adept at learning new software that you will use on a day-to-day basis.

You are hardworking: Working towards results and supporting your team by offering support and accountability.

What Your Day Would Look Like
  • Ensure all payments and SWP transactions are carried out in a synchronized and accurate manner.
  • Constant communication with different partners to support an outstanding service.
  • Maintain the integrity of various RRIF spreadsheets by ensuring accuracy of data input
  • Review and investigate any accounts reflecting negative balances and carrying applicable procedures to quickly resolve
  • Support the Client Services Team through the investigation and resolution of assigned footprints.
  • Continuously seek and offer suggestions for operational improvement and efficiencies
  • Work proactively and cohesively within a tight knit team culture.
  • Acting as an active teammate by working collaboratively with department colleagues and ensure that all tasks and projects are completed in a timely manner.
  • Ensure the confidentiality of the Trust and is customers is maintained by routinely securing all documentation during non-business hours and is aware of and adheres to employees code of conduct.
Benefits to benefit you.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

#discoverCWB

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/8/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Software Development Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Description

If you are SDE-2 and looking for an opportunity to solve deep technical problems and build a new innovative solution (grounds-up) in a fast-paced environment with senior and seasoned engineers, this might be the role for you.

About Simple Invoicing Platform

Transportation Financial Systems (TFS) owns and maintains a set of services - Simple Invoicing Platform (SIP) - that allows Amazon Businesses to generate different kinds of financial invoices on behalf of their own service partners, both for cases where payments, need to be made (Payables) to or collected from those partners (Receivables). Amazon businesses can onboard all their service partners as Billers with complete configuration of their invoicing and payment/collection preferences. SIP collects the list of transactions that eventually need to be invoiced and at scheduled intervals generates invoices and either processes them for payments or schedules them for collections, with different financial payables and receivables platforms within Amazon. We currently handle the needs for Transportation platforms like Flex, Relay, Ship with Amazon, Amazon Freight Exchange and are constantly expanding to serve needs for more Amazon businesses. Annually, across all the markets we operate in, we generate upwards of 8Mil invoices and initiate about USD 15Bil payments and track about USD 50Mil receivables.
What is the one line vision or “North Star” of this product?
Our North Star is to combine the TFS Manifesting, Accounting, Invoicing and Payment solutions used by self-invoicing clients and make them available as a single unified platform that any Amazon Business can onboard to. We will also simplify the process of client onboarding that will allow businesses to self-serve their onboarding and will maintain best of breed services that leverage the latest Amazon standards.
What engineering challenges will you solve as part of SIP?
Unification of the Payables and Receivables stacks: Payables and Receivables business flows have many common behaviors but are handled in 2 different stacks across TFS services, leading to duplication and inefficiencies. We are creating a new ‘best of breed’ unified platform that will merge both stacks, optimize the services involved and improve on existing functionality. This multi-year project has multiple deep engineering problems and is aimed at simplifying the invoicing and payments for multiple transportation organizations inside Amazon.
Automated invoice generation: clients today have to provide financial data twice to TFS, once to manifest a shipment and open related liabilities and another time to invoice the shipment, process it for payments and close related liabilities. SIP is working to connect manifesting to invoicing so that all planned shipments are automatically invoiced and processed for payments, as and when the shipments are executed.
Onboard to Amazon standard tools: our platform today includes certain services like invoice number generation and document publishing that we have developed in-house and now need to switch to Amazon standard solutions for doing the same.
Expansion to Support additional financial documents: we are also introducing support for other financial documents such as credit memos and debit memos which allow for a wider range of financial actions, so that documents needed for recovering money is also generated and applied through Amazon financial platforms.
Enhance the Template Helper suite: which allows our clients to test all changes to the invoice templates before deploying them into Beta and later stages.
Improve our engineering to work at scale and speed: SIP operates at great scale and with good latency but as we expand to onboard more customers, our systems will need to be reengineered in pieces and we need to automate client and biller onboarding, enhance business processes that use AWS resources like RDS, to use Amazon Standard tools OR just advanced DB tech, improve on our workflow management and evaluate use of Step Functions, enhance our use of Elastic Search to make our data available to partners, automate our error handling and reduce turn around on tickets etc. From an Amazon architecture perspective, we will be moving to NAWS for all our services and reengineering to better use the native stack.
Whom will you work with?
You will be working with SDE3s and SDE2s who will be reviewing your body of work on this program on an ongoing basis. This program will also have a Principal Engineer oversight. You will also work with Amazon businesses that aggressively push the boundary on customer obsession on invoice generation and payments.
What else will you get to do?
We are a platform team and have 100% ownership of all the services we work on. If you are a seasoned SDE, we will give you an opportunity to become the service owner of a large Tier-2 service and you will become the gatekeeper for all architectural changes for that large service. As part of ownership, we will give you opportunity to improve SLA of the service you own, make the services NAWS enabled, drive IMR improvement within that service and build a self-serve UAT platform for that service.

What other initiatives is this team working on?
The SIP team will also be working on other interesting problems that you could be interested in contributing to
Standardization of payment flows: currently self-invoicing payments are handled in a special flow with non-standard accounting process and SIP will be involved in standardizing the payment flow which will automatically give us standard accounting treatment.
DW re-architecture: We are re-architecting our data pipelines to get improved SLA and greater stability of the pieplines. This project will give you exposure to newer AWS DW technologies
Improvisations to Credit Note generation: we will be involved in adapting the auditing flow which normally handles outwards payments, to handle cases where we need to reduce the amounts paid out because of different kind of discrepancies


Basic Qualifications
  • 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
  • B.Tech in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 3+ years overall technical/product development experience.
  • Proven ability to troubleshoot and identify the root cause of issues.
  • Strong object oriented development knowledge in Java.
  • Demonstrates skill and passion for operational excellence.
  • Knowledge of the UNIX/Linux operating system.
  • Expertise in scripting
  • Documentation skills
Preferred Qualifications
  • Knowledge on distributed computing technologies
  • Knowledge on relational and no-sql database technologies
  • Expertise in Java frameworks
  • Debugging and troubleshooting skills, with an enthusiastic attitude to support and resolve customer problems

Company - ADCI HYD 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1273012

item.title: IB Process Assistant
item.content:encoded:
Key Job Elements

DESCRIPTION
  • Support and work in the department as required
  • Helping support daily management of department duties, including allocating labor, leading meetings, assigning job duties, and communicating with internal and external suppliers
  • Providing vacation coverage for Area Managers
  • Providing policy follow-up, attendance tracking (duties do not extend to discipline)
  • Tracking and reporting of ATS/labor hours
  • Assisting the floor as an associate resource, training associates and verifying SOP compliance
  • Ensuring successful area performance, through tracking, reporting and feedback of associate performance
  • Participating in Operational Excellence initiatives in some capacity
  • Filling in as needed with production duties
  • Fully understanding workflow and daily production goals
  • Reviewing and updating SOP as required
  • Assisting in keeping work area clean and organized
  • Identifying and addressing safety hazards within the work area
  • Coaching associates to work safely at all times
  • Participating in safety initiatives
  • Referring all job injuries immediately to area manager

Basic Qualifications
  • A high school diploma or equivalent
  • Are at least 18 years old, and authorized to work in the United States
  • Able to work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
  • Able to lift up to 49 pounds, stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours, and be able to frequently push, pull, squat, bend and reach, all with or without reasonable accommodation
  • 2+ years of work experience or a completed Associate’s Degree
  • 1+ year of experience working with computers and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)
Preferred Qualifications
  • 1+ year of leadership experience directly managing others
  • 1+ year working in a like environment (manufacturing/distribution/warehousing/large retail)
  • Experience with performance metrics and lean process improvemen
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills to coach, train and assist team members

Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon M
Job ID: A1252327
