item.title: Data Quality Specialist
item.content:encoded:
Imagine…

that you work in a challenging, international environment with the mission to increase and facilitate the use of data and to support the bank’s data driven business opportunities. Being data driven includes the recognition that data must be managed efficiently and with professional discipline. Insufficient data quality impacts business decisions, customer information, efficiency and compliance to law and regulations.

Imagine you are responsible for the effective implementation of data quality across the bank. And image that you can be a key success factor in meeting this ambition.

Making a difference

A Data Quality Specialist is responsible for effective implementation of data quality processes across the bank and to improve the overall data quality. Key activities are:

  • to define and communicate data quality strategies, procedures and metrics across Rabobank Group in order to set a structural base to improve the quality of data and to analyse the effectiveness of the measures taken.
  • Supporting the different departments across the bank with the implementation of the groupwide data quality processes (norms and forms): i.e. data quality monitoring, data quality issue management, data definitions, data governance, reference data
  • Specifically, to implement the data quality track as part of the KYC program and to meet the data quality milestones and KPIs
  • Furthermore we expect the Data Quality Specialist to initiate, track and oversee the delivery of data quality projects and services and to understand and promote the value of data assets. This means, among other things, that data requirements are implemented from the start in new projects and you focus on continuous improvement of data quality.

With Each Other

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. You become part of a relatively new department with highly educated, motivated professionals. The joint mission: the authority in the field of data management, and leading the way to a data-driven bank.

Within the Data Management Office you will work with talented people who have a passion for data. With you as data quality specialist, the department will consist of diverse colleagues in a variety of data roles.

Robbert, Data Quality Specialist: “What I enjoy most in working at the Data Management Office, is the diversity of data topics where we lead the bank to better and reliable data. We are involved with various impactful programs across the bank, such as KYC (know your customer), data4food, BCBS#239. A dynamic role with a lot of room for a self-starter and entrepreneurial individual to shape our ambition to become a data driven bank”

With you

Strong communication skills, result driven, analytic skills and cooperation are clearly essential for the role of data quality specialist. In addition, it's important that you recognise yourself in the checklist below:

  • Academic degree
  • At least 5 year experience in the banking sector;
  • Affinity with both communication and IT is a plus
  • Good command of English and Dutch (business level)
  • Knowledge of data management techniques and tools

Growing a better world together
You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.

  • As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
  • Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.


Interested?

Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, you can expect:

  • A gross monthly salary on scale 9 or 10 (depending on your experience and seniority);
  • A thirteenth month and holiday pay;
  • An Employee Benefit Budget. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out;
  • A personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;
  • Flexible working times and location-independent working;
  • Compensation for your commute if you travel by public transport or car.
  • Personal contributions to a pension scheme of only 3,5%.

Let's meet.
Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as Data quality Specialist and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.

Good to know:

  • Apply via the button “Apply now”. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy
  • Hila Leupen-Turabaz, Senior Recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via Hila.Leupen-Turabaz@rabobank.nl
  • The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.
  • Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link;
  • We want to use your talent in the broadest sense and would like to look at your response more broadly than this vacancy. Your profile will be included in the Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. If you object to this, you can indicate this by e-mail at data.analytics@rabobank.nl
  • Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

This means, among other things, that data requirements are implemented from the start in new projects and you focus on continuous improvement of data quality.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWith Each Other\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECollaboration is at the heart of everything we do. You become part of a relatively new department with highly educated, motivated professionals. The joint mission: the authority in the field of data management, and leading the way to a data-driven bank.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWithin the Data Management Office you will work with talented people who have a passion for data. With you as data quality specialist, the department will consist of diverse colleagues in a variety of data roles.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003ERobbert, Data Quality Specialist: \u003Cem\u003E“What I enjoy most in working at the Data Management Office, is the diversity of data topics where we lead the bank to better and reliable data. \u003C/em\u003E\u003Cem\u003EWe are involved with various impactful programs across the bank, such as KYC (know your customer), data4food, BCBS#239. A dynamic role with a lot of room for a self-starter and entrepreneurial individual to shape our ambition to become a data driven bank”\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/em\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWith you \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EStrong communication skills, result driven, analytic skills and cooperation are clearly essential for the role of data quality specialist. In addition, it's important that you recognise yourself in the checklist below:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAcademic degree\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAt least 5 year experience in the banking sector;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAffinity with both communication and IT is a plus\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EGood command of English and Dutch (business level)\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EKnowledge of data management techniques and tools\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGrowing a better world together\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EYou'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EA third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAs part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ETogether with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EInterested?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EDo you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, you can expect:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EA gross monthly salary on scale 9 or 10 (depending on your experience and seniority);\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EA thirteenth month and holiday pay;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAn Employee Benefit Budget. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EA personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EFlexible working times and location-independent working;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECompensation for your commute if you travel by public transport or car.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPersonal contributions to a pension scheme of only 3,5%.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELet's meet. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EAre you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as Data quality Specialist and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EGood to know:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EApply via the button “Apply now”. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EHila Leupen-Turabaz, Senior Recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via Hila.Leupen-Turabaz@rabobank.nl\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EThe application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYour privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link;\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EWe want to use your talent in the broadest sense and would like to look at your response more broadly than this vacancy. Your profile will be included in the Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. If you object to this, you can indicate this by e-mail at data.analytics@rabobank.nl\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EEveryone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Niet van toepassing","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Rabobank","sameAs":"https://nl.linkedin.com/company/rabobank","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH2kxVJT-AFXw/company-logo_200_200/0/1519855859284?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=y4OLBf0AVlNdRJFIQkUdVbGX2DZryCml6QwKHcUI90M"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Rabobank","value":"JR_00035648"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH2kxVJT-AFXw/company-logo_100_100/0/1519855859284?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=ir4_cTyAsvEcLYIFAR3lPs8vCtKGnunBMyv3zkixe30","industry":"Bankwezen","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Binnenstad","addressRegion":null,"postalCode":"3512","addressCountry":"NL"}},"skills":"","title":"Data Quality Specialist","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:25.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Banking Associate
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Multiple positions, Multiple locations across Canada! Please provide resume & detailed cover-letter outlining interest in program.
Transcripts will be required for all candidates selected for interviews.

CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

We’re on a mission to become a powerful force in Canadian banking. Our target clients are small and medium-sized business owners, and they expect a clear alternative. They deserve a proactive partner who helps them succeed. We’re caring. We’re forward-thinking. We’re specialized. And we’re redefining a proactive client experience in a constantly evolving climate. We have real relationships with our clients. We genuinely care about them & their success. We don’t sit back passively. We respond with urgency & speed, anticipate our clients’ needs, come to them with valuable ideas, and advise. That’s how we become the best full-service bank for business owners in Canada. It's how we deliver on our brand promise of being obsessed with your success™.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. LGBTQ2S+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this program, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.
Difference makers. Life-long learners. Proactive achievers. Change advocates. Game changers. Self-starters. The passionately committed.We hire with intention. The mildly interested need not apply. Decided on a career in Business Banking?
Learn what it takes to be a commercial banker in our Banking Associate Program. You’ll be part of an exclusive cohort gaining real work experience while learning sought after industry skills. Through hands-on mentorship and coaching, you’ll dive deep into commercial banking and become a critical member of our team dedicated to serving our clients. Hiring in all four programs: General Commercial, Equipment Financing, Real Estate & Specialty Lending and Cash Management, we will align you to the ideal accelerator program based on your expertise and interests.

Put your education to work and ignite your career with a proud Canadian owned company. While we may have grown up in the Prairies, we are excited to continue to build on our growth strategy as we rapidly expand our national footprint coast-to-coast. Mobility is an asset and often rewards you with fast-tracked developmental opportunities and greater exposure.
The program specifics
Banking Associates are part of a developmental program designed to equip new graduates with a foundation for a commercial banking career. This role focuses on developing core-banking skills and provides credit structuring, credit underwriting, risk management and delivering client solutions with increasing autonomy and complexity over the course of a 12-month accelerator program. Partnering with experienced professionals in the branches, including account specialists, relationship managers, credit analysts, and business development managers, to support the day to day operations of the business.

What Makes You a Fit
  • You’re completing your undergraduate degree and can begin work in the spring of 2021.
  • Building relationships and networking with people from a diverse group of backgrounds is in your DNA.
  • You have an analytical mind, are naturally curious, and love diving into data to inform your decisions.
  • You’re fascinated by financial services and understanding business operations of today and tomorrow.
  • You're prepared to be brand ambassador and sell client-based solutions with confidence, negotiating impactful outcomes for all.
  • You are results driven with a bias for action. You push yourself to achieve goals, welcoming challenges and pursuing objectives with energy, drive and the need to finish, and finish well.
  • You take ownership of your own learning and development, actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged.
  • You’re agile in the face of change and can operate effectively even when the way forward is unclear.
  • The word inclusion has deep meaning to you. It’s more than a concept, it’s a way of thinking, behaving and holding yourself accountable.
  • You collaborate and contribute to optimize every interaction.
Why work with us? Benefits to benefit you.
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup. We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

 Learn more about the Banking Associate Program.

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Entry level","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Canadian Western Bank","sameAs":"https://ca.linkedin.com/company/canadian-western-bank","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE06Sg0zJHr_Q/company-logo_200_200/0/1594241574876?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=HDD6Iwv8gKUznw1qDrT7_FJnMn8c08uUVErctxIcBhM"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Canadian Western Bank","value":"R2967"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE06Sg0zJHr_Q/company-logo_100_100/0/1594241574876?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=Pu3QSyBOxtlubfCL5_yGc4rkYeXKGkyIltbnADzKlkE","industry":"Banking,Financial Services,Commercial Real Estate","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Endako","addressRegion":"BC","postalCode":"V0J1L0","addressCountry":"CA"}},"skills":"","title":"Banking Associate","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:46.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Cloud Support Eng. II (DMS)
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Web Services is the global market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team in Amazon Internet Services Private Limited (AISPL), you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products, arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.

Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications, servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team in India helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?

If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT Amazon?

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
  • Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.
  • Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.
  • Interact with leading engineers around the world.
  • Partner with Amazon teams in India to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.
  • Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal Amazon teams in India on how to improve our services.
  • Drive customer communication during critical events.
  • Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.
  • Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.
  • Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.
WHY AWS PREMIUM SUPPORT?
  • First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.
  • On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.
  • Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives to ensure better CX and compliance with global AWS standards, practices and policies.
  • Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.
  • Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.
We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AISPL, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.
  • Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.
  • As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GC3bWcFFZTo&t=24s

Basic Qualification

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
  • Requires minimum of 3+ yrs experience in relevant technical position
  • Administrator skills on Linux (or flavor of Linux/UNIX system), Networking; IPsec, VPN, Load Balancing, Iperf, DNS, DHCP, Routing Protocols, SSH, Network Monitoring.
  • Knowledge of some Developer & Mobile language/Services- Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, .NET, JavaScript, iOS/Objective-C/Swift, Rest API, inter-application messaging & queueing, develop mobile apps, version control systems, virtualization. Experience with web-based applications and HTTP
  • Knowledge of client/server and distributed systems architectures (WebServers)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Customer service experience / strong customer focus.
  • Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experience
  • Motivated and excited to be learning about new technologies every day
Preferred Qualification

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience developing against and working with REST API based services
  • Prior working experience with AWS services
  • Experience with Cloud architecture patterns and distributed computing concepts
  • Exposure to Mobile application development (iOS / Android)
  • Exposure to mobile and web application security best practices
  • Messaging and Queueing experience
  • Detailed knowledge of networking protocols: DNS, HTTP, SSL, SMTP, TCP
  • Exposure to security concepts / methodologies
  • Experience with iperf, MTR, traceroute, dig
  • Experience handling full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications
  • Experience working with identity providers (i.e. Login with Amazon, Facebook Connect, OpenID, etc.) / OAuth
  • Experience with push notifications, APNS and GCM
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.


Company - AISPL - Karnataka
Job ID: A1273801

item.title: Teamlead Production
item.content:encoded:
Morgen kan alles anders zijn: we groeien alleen als we blijven innoveren. Dankzij strakke processen, een optimale bezetting en hoge kwaliteit producten maken we het onze klanten nog makkelijker. Wil jij hier impact op maken? Met jouw scherpe geest, resultaatgerichte instelling en organisatorische kwaliteiten ga jij samen met ons voor de perfecte bestelling. Keer op keer.

Realiseren van een optimaal productieproces: dit ga je doen als Teamlead Production

In deze rol heb je aardig wat verantwoordelijkheid: je geeft leiding aan een team van zo’n 10 tot 15 man en stuurt indirect ook circa 40 man aan. Samen is het jullie doel om elke bestelling compleet, correct en op tijd bij klanten te bezorgen. Je voert controles uit op bestellingen, optimaliseert het werkproces en zet op basis van de cijfers acties uit.

Elke bestelling moet een perfecte bestelling zijn. Dat realiseer je door duidelijke kaders te scheppen, doelen te stellen en je team te stimuleren en motiveren, zodat zij hun werk goed en met plezier kunnen doen. Je stemt de productie en bezetting af met de Teamlead Flex, Flex Coördinator en inhousebezetting van het uitzendbureau.

Je Aanvullende Werkzaamheden
  • Leiden van het werkoverleg over de resultaten omtrent efficiëntie en kwaliteit.
  • Regelen van een optimale bezetting, in samenwerking met je manager en inhousevestigingen van uitzendbureaus waarmee we samenwerken.
  • Maken van een planning van onze interne logistiek allrounders en hen coachen door feedback te geven en beoordelingsgesprekken te voeren.
  • Zorg dragen voor een goede overdracht tussen de shifts.


Scherp, organisatorisch sterk en écht resultaatgericht: dat ben jij

Groeien kan alleen door verandering. Daarom zoeken we iemand die zich thuis voelt in een dynamische en hectische omgeving. Iemand met leidinggevende kwaliteiten die snel reageert op knelpunten en begrijpt dat de inzet en ontwikkeling van je team ontzettend belangrijk zijn.

Je persoonlijkheid vinden we net zo belangrijk als je ervaring:
  • Achtergrond: je hebt een afgeronde hbo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in een logistieke richting.
  • Overtuigend: je motiveert, stimuleert en brengt anderen in beweging zodat iedereen doet wat hij of zij moet doen.
  • Communicatief sterk: leidinggeven is een vak apart, maar jij weet hoe je met mensen moet omgaan (zowel in het Nederlands als het Engels).
  • Werken in shifts: je bent bereid om zowel in dag- als avonddiensten te werken, en in het weekend.


Werken bij AH: hoe lekker is dat?

Morgen kan alles anders zijn. Daarom blijven we innoveren. Elke dag opnieuw. Dat zie je ook terug in onze samenwerking met jou. We geven je als Teamlead Production de tools om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen: zo kun je opleidingen volgen en plannen we regelmatig een toekomstgesprek met je in. Uiteindelijk kun je doorgroeien naar een rol als Proces Lead of een andere rol binnen onze organisatie.

We hebben graag impact op onze klanten, maar ook op onze medewerkers. Dat doen we met:
  • Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder winstuitkering, toeslagen en vakantiegeld
  • 24 vakantiedagen en 19,5 adv-dagen die je kunt laten uitbetalen, reiskostenvergoeding en korting op verzekeringen
  • Een zeer goede pensioenregeling met een eigen bijdrage van 5,3%
  • Albert Heijn Deals: superdeals van grote merken, bekende pretparken, sport en gaming
  • Onze Gouden Bonus: 10% korting op je boodschappen in onze winkels, tot € 300,- per jaar


Dit zijn wij: AH e-Commerce

Als een van de grootste en snelst groeiende e-Commerce bedrijven van Nederland hebben we samen met de winkels van Albert Heijn behoorlijk wat impact op ons land: elke dag vullen we zo’n 5 miljoen borden. Dit doen we vanuit onze Home Shop Centers in Rotterdam, Amsterdam, De Meern, Eindhoven, Bleiswijk, Oosterhout en Almere, het National Fulfilment Center in Nieuwegein en alle daarbij horende HUB- en PUP-locaties. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat Nederland elke dag lekker en gezond kan eten. Samen maken we het leven van alledag net een stukje makkelijker.

Weet jij anderen succesvol aan te sturen en zo je doelen te realiseren? Solliciteer direct door jouw gegevens inclusief CV en motivatiebrief bij ons achter te laten via de sollicitatiebutton.

Lees meer

Dit doen we vanuit onze Home Shop Centers in Rotterdam, Amsterdam, De Meern, Eindhoven, Bleiswijk, Oosterhout en Almere, het National Fulfilment Center in Nieuwegein en alle daarbij horende HUB- en PUP-locaties. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat Nederland elke dag lekker en gezond kan eten. Samen maken we het leven van alledag net een stukje makkelijker.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWeet jij anderen succesvol aan te sturen en zo je doelen te realiseren? Solliciteer direct door jouw gegevens inclusief CV en motivatiebrief bij ons achter te laten via de sollicitatiebutton.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003ELees meer","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Medewerker","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Albert Heijn","sameAs":"https://nl.linkedin.com/company/albert-heijn","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE_asn6DhgWeg/company-logo_200_200/0/1549381485173?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=vlzLN8bX_HhyE521JhEOtQuUdeqvkR8S6gXP7oso1M8"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Albert Heijn","value":"e78c4cbe893e45e1ac295c98dcbdcff5"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE_asn6DhgWeg/company-logo_100_100/0/1549381485173?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=ZPM7xBdubqEgGxLOvsTJt86WO0Aj-knGTdShS_A0sn0","industry":"Detailhandel","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Rotterdam","addressRegion":null,"postalCode":"3099","addressCountry":"NL"}},"skills":"","title":"Teamlead Production","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:06:30.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Machine Operator
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

Wage $17.63 per hour

$1.00 Shift Premium

Shift
Continental

Job Requirements
  • Identify material by colour
  • Properly mix material
  • Distinguish between types of material
  • Load and unload raw material bins/hoppers (i.e. maintain raw material levels to ensure line operation)
  • Report any deficiencies in systems, facilities, machinery, equipment and/or tools immediately to your supervisor.
  • Record and/or report product damage/nonconformities to your supervisor as required.
  • Comply with Quality Assurance policies and procedures.
  • Participate and contribute to effective production efficiency.
  • Construct packaging
  • Prepare and apply label to package
  • Package product as per specification
  • Keep work area clean
  • Participate in the PVC Recovery program, ensure recycling of:
  • Place raw material in proper storage location
  • Place finished goods in proper storage location
  • Inspect product for proper surface finish
  • Inspect product for straightness
  • Inspect product for squareness
  • Compare product to sample (colour)
  • Record results
  • Use caliper to ensure product meets specifications
  • Perform Flex test on product
  • Use square to ensure product meets specifications
  • Use measuring tape to ensure product meets specifications
  • Compare product to production drawing
  • Perform “Go” “No-go” Gauges/Assembly Parts tests
  • Record results
  • Check oil levels
  • Check guarding
  • Check/change filters
  • Maintain the machine during a “blip”
  • Maintain the machine during “more than a blip”

Skills And Abilities Required
  • Ability to read, write, understand and communicate effectively in English.
  • Ability to perform basic mathematical functions (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division).
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds/23 kilograms.
  • Ability to work rotating shifts

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

item.title: Account Specialist
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Account Specialist, CommercialRole SpecificationsCompensation Range $53,000-$79,500For additional information, please contact the recruiter for a complete job descriptionCWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

Our Commercial team includes a diverse group of financial professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated commercial bankers knows the value of relationship building and brings that perfect combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table. No day is ever the same in commercial banking. Whether it’s providing proactive client solutions, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.

What Your Day Will Look Like

Credit underwriting. Risk management. Creative problem solving. Learning. Collaboration & partnership.

The primary focus of the Account Specialist, Commercial is to prepare credit structuring, credit underwriting, risk management and client facing support for clients within a specified geographic market, for a portfolio of clients with average loan volumes under $2MM. This individual contributor role represents the day-to-day contact for clients. This role also collaborates with the team, supporting them with the analysis and development of general economic overviews, industry profiles and the evaluation of past and present fiscal viability of loan prospects.

Skills That Will Take You Further
  • Financially savvy. You are experienced in the analysis of financial statements and detailed evaluation of the loan prospects. You will prepare credit submissions (new loan requests, renewals, annual reviews, amendments and credit memos) for new and existing clients to support the achievement of branch financial objectives through effective and timely credit underwriting, while balancing risk and reward to CWB’s risk appetite.
  • Client focused. You have the right tools implement stewardship strategies and provide advice to exceed client expectations while maintaining positive relationships.
  • Sale lens. You will seek and find opportunities to actively refer to other business partners across CWB.
  • A strategic planner. You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and a great one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allows you effectively multitask and meet expected targets.
  • A great support. You are a trusted teammate and love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality.
  • Think big and beyond. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems, it is your knack for strategy and solutions that sets you apart from your peers. You will support the development of creative, competitive client solutions, maximizing internal partnerships and specialists where appropriate.
  • Technologically & operationally proficient. You are adept at learning new software that you will use on a day-to-day basis and have a keen eye for improving and perfecting processes.
Foundational knowledge and experience to grow from
A Business Administration or related diploma and a have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in banking, or business lending, inclusive of direct commercial credit underwriting. You are comfortable with financial statement analysis and possess a proven understanding of Moody’s Financial Analyst. Your hard work ethic and high energy are the main attributes to your success and it’s your competitive advantage to rise above that makes you stand out amongst your colleagues.
Why work with us? People first benefits.
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Compressed work weeks and more.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, or lead an employee-regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/20/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

Base \u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cem\u003Eplus \u003C/em\u003E\u003C/strong\u003Eperformance incentives.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ERetirement investment strategy. \u003C/strong\u003EYou can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany ownership.\u003C/strong\u003E The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGreat Places To Work. \u003C/strong\u003ECWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiscover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EClosing Date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cli\u003E P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E02/20/2021\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Inclusion & \u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiversity\u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. item.title: Sales Representative - Selling on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Marketplace is seeking a dynamic and motivated executive to acquire and manage key accounts. The Account Executive will develop a sales pipeline mix of high value and transactional accounts, recruit and launch businesses to sell their products in www.amazon.com.mx and manage the portfolio to grow their sales.

Specifically, this individual will be responsible for identifying and building relationships with key influencers and decision-makers within the executive teams of prospective accounts, along with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to create and present compelling Amazon solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements. After the acquisition, the account manager will build the success of those accounts by providing business insights, training, support and seller education.

Core Responsibilities
  • Identify, qualify, acquire and grow seller commitment to the Selling on Amazon program through FBA
  • Implement and track metrics for recording the success and quality of the sellers in your territory. Use these metrics to guide your work and uncover hidden areas of opportunity.
  • Develop a clear understanding of the Selling on Amazon products along with the features and functionalities.
  • Develop a thorough understanding of the e-commerce industry and competitive environment including knowledge of competitive product offerings
  • Engage with merchants to understand their needs and gauge fit with the Amazon Services product set.
  • Create and articulate compelling value propositions around the Selling on Amazon product.
  • Manage numerous opportunities concurrently and strategically.
  • Analyze customer data and make recommendations in order to maximize the potential of the assigned territory. Execute successfully on the plan recommended
  • Prepare and deliver business reviews regarding progress and state of health for the respective territory.
  • Manage complex contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal team.
  • Meet or exceed quarterly revenue targets and operational metrics.
We are a business development organization; we drive growth for over 2MM Amazon Sellers through business intelligence, cross-selling efforts and integrated Account Management. We are successful by focusing on aggressive growth for our Sellers’ businesses. If you would like to be part of a team that is changing the way Mexican companies sell provide English language resume.

Amazon Services’ Business Development organization connects the technology powering Amazon.com to businesses worldwide. We are responsible for establishing new business partnerships with sellers who wish to utilize Amazon’s suite of e-commerce solutions. For more information, please visit http://www.amazonservices.com


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree or certificate of completion of studies
  • English and Spanish written and verbal skills
  • 5+ years of experience in roles such as Account Management, Sales, Retail Buyer/Associate buyer, In-stock planner/allocator, Finance/analyst roles, Marketing/merchandising roles, Product management roles or Project management roles

    • Preferred Qualifications

    Master’s Degree preferred
  • Experience selling nascent products/services into new markets
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Work experience preferably in the eCommerce, on-line advertising, retail technology, or IT industries
  • History of exceeding targets using a consultative, solutions-focused approach


    Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon M
    Job ID: A1240640

item.title: Senior Project Safety Manager
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Project Safety Manager administers the safety program and serves as safety advisor, ensuring safety compliance by the project team and all employees and subcontractors working at the site.

Responsibilities
  • Support all safety efforts on the project and promote our Gilbane Cares safety culture
  • Make recommendations concerning the modification, improvement, or removal of any company equipment, facilities, or machinery that is hazardous to employee safety or health
  • Ensure contractor activities are preplanned for safety through scope review, preconstruction meetings, JHA review, etc.
  • Ensure contractors meet Gilbane Safety submittal requirements
  • Ensure contractor compliance to Gilbane safety plan including but not limited to, safety submittals, training and equipment inspection and other documentation (i.e., Substance abuse testing records, etc.)
  • Ensure project teams perform Safety net inspections per company policy
  • Administer safety Motivational programs
  • Provide safety training to project teams on Gilbane, client and OSHA requirements
  • Investigate all accidents and complete all paperwork required by Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) or state regulations
  • Maintain all safety related documentation
  • Supervise, coach, mentor and assistant Project Safety Manager
  • Ensure contractors meet Gilbane safety expectations
  • Alert managers and employees to the hazards of working with toxic fumes, dangerous chemicals, and any other hazardous substances in the company workplace
  • Coach project teams in effective hazard identification and correction of issues
  • Serve as company liaison with OSHA, Insurance carriers and other regulatory agencies
  • Responsible for staffing, development and supervision of project safety managers
  • Analyze and provide trending reports and actions for project team in SafetyNet
  • Develop and administer safety training plan for staff
  • Manage all correspondence to insurance, OSHA and regulatory bodies
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • Construction Health and Safety Technician credential and advanced safety training, or BS in Occupational Safety Management
  • 5 years of construction safety management experience
  • Certified as an OSHA 500 Trainer
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Sound knowledge of construction safety principles, techniques and methods
  • Sound knowledge of OSHA laws, regulations and policies
  • Capable of identifying known potential exposures and recommending corrective action
  • Strong computer skills and familiarity the Microsoft Office suite
  • Management, leadership and interpersonal skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Senior Project Manager
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of a construction-management project; as well as mentoring multiple Project Managers and Engineers.

Responsibilities
  • Direct and supervise work of project administration, project superintendents, and engineers to establish operational priorities
  • Produce all elements of project execution plan and implement
  • Provide jobsite leadership in the area of safety and quality
  • Maintain satisfactory relationships with owners, subcontractors, unions, etc.

Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 10-15 years in the lead role on projects valued at $50-100 million or larger
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong technical and communication skills are critical
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Knowledge of Procore, Microsoft Office (preferred)
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Compliance Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineer’s high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?

The Role

The Hardware Compliance Engineering team is looking for a Compliance Engineer to drive certification and market access for Amazon Lab126 products. You will have deep knowledge of the compliance process and be responsible for managing wireless, safety and energy efficiency compliance with the regulatory agencies, the certification bodies and testing lab to ensure Amazon Lab126 products comply with all compliance requirements. You will have deep experience with IFETEL and NOM and the approval processes of consumer electronics and will develop robust processes to effectively engage with Engineering, Operations, Legal and other Amazon Lab126 teams to drive efficient and timely certification of our products. You must be responsive, flexible, process driven and be able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment.

Key Responsibilities
  • Establish and maintain lines of communications with regulatory agencies in Mexico.
  • Negotiate and influence effectively in regulatory matters with authorities, test labs and certification agencies.
  • Standardize and simplify the Mexico compliance process by developing regulatory strategies and implementing process to achieve certification.
  • Maintain internal certification documents.
  • Create and maintain processes for managing existing product certifications and renewals.
  • Proactively provide clear regulatory guidelines regarding local regulatory environment.
  • Provide responses to regulatory agencies inquiries regarding product information or issues.
  • Review all regulatory agency submission materials to ensure timeliness, accuracy, comprehensiveness, and compliance with regulatory standards.
  • Work with regional teams to ensure efficient and timely approval of new products; and continued Regulatory support of marketed products.
  • Collaborate with internal and external functional partners to identify and resolve information/process gaps in product development and global expansion compliance processes

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree preferable in engineering or related technical discipline.
  • 5+ years of regulatory affairs experience, preferable in consumer electronics.
  • Experience in submission of products for certification.
  • Proven effective experience in regulatory work and interacting with regulatory authorities and agencies and Trade Associations.
  • Familiar with and able to identify, interpret and define regulations, requirements, guidelines, and other pertinent information issued by applicable regulatory bodies.
  • Ability to read and synthesize technical material and to prepare clear and concise written documents.
  • Proficiency in English (written and spoken).
  • Experience working with Asia-based manufacturing partners.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s degree.
  • Proven track record of role modeling a collaborative teamwork environment.
  • Ability to move quickly and multitask in an ambiguous and fast pace environment.
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with people in a variety of disciplines though all levels of an organization.
  • Ability to solve problems and drive efficiencies using metrics and information.
Lab126 is part of the Amazon.com, Inc. group of companies and is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon M
Job ID: A1253993

item.title: Cloud Support Engineer II - Deployment
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Web Services is the global market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team in Amazon Internet Services Private Limited (AISPL), you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products, arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.

Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications, servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team in India helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?

If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT Amazon?

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
  • Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.
  • Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.
  • Interact with leading engineers around the world.
  • Partner with Amazon teams in India to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.
  • Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal Amazon teams in India on how to improve our services.
  • Drive customer communication during critical events.
  • Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.
  • Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.
  • Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.
WHY AWS PREMIUM SUPPORT?
  • First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.
  • On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.
  • Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives to ensure better CX and compliance with global AWS standards, practices and policies.
  • Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.
  • Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.
We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AISPL, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.
  • Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.
  • As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GC3bWcFFZTo&t=24s


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
  • Requires minimum of 3+ yrs experience in relevant technical position
  • Advanced experience in administration and troubleshooting for two (2) or more of the following:
  • DevOps/Deployment
  • Orchestration Management
  • Configuration Management
  • Continuous Integration technology (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, Ansible Chef, Puppet, or related tools)
  • Advanced experience with System Administration with Linux (Ubuntu, CentOS, RedHat) and/or Microsoft Windows Server and associated technologies (Active Directory, Exchange)
  • Advanced experience with Networking and troubleshooting (TCP/IP, DNS, routing, switching, firewalls, LAN/WAN, traceroute, iperf, dig, cURL or related)
Preferred Qualifications
  • One or more Web and Application Server technologies (e.g. Apache HTTPD, Apache Tomcat, Nginx, Glassfish, JBoss, Puma, Passenger, IIS)
  • One or more scripting language (e.g. Bash, PowerShell, Ruby, Python, extensions)
  • One or more version control platform (e.g. Git, Perforce, SVN, TFVC)
  • Experience managing full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications
  • Programming language experience (e.g. Java, node.js, Javascript, .NET, PHP)
  • Exposure to Virtualization (Hypervisors, VMware, Xen)
  • Understand the complete deployment lifecycle from design, build, test, deploy
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.


Company - AISPL - Karnataka
Job ID: A1273798

item.title: Customer Service Communications Manager
item.content:encoded:
Description

Position Summary
Launched on the web in 1995, Amazon has grown to become the world's leader in e-commerce, and in customer service. Getting its start as a bookseller, the company now offers everything from books to tennis rackets to e-books and diamond rings. The evolution of Amazon has been driven by a spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA.

Our vision is to be Earth's most customer-centric company; to build a place where customers can find and discover anything they want to buy online. Our global Customer Service (CS) team is at the heart of that mission, supporting Amazon’s millions of customers on product questions, post-order inquiries, technical support, and customer account management. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. So if you thrive in a challenging, fast-paced, innovative and customer-orientated environment, Amazon is the place for you. We’re making history and the great news is that we’ve only just begun.

This role is based in Hyderabad, India and will lead a small team of communications professionals. It is responsible for the Asia Pacific (APAC) and Middle East (ME) Customer Service (CS) internal communications strategy and programs, across China, India, Japan, Malaysia, Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, and United Arab Emirates. This includes enabling CS leaders and operations teams to effectively communicate with their teams, and for key information to cascade consistently and smoothly through the organization. These messages will clarify Amazon strategy to all levels of the organization, and will “connect the dots” for CS associates in terms of how their work contributes to the larger vision and strategy.

This role supports CS APAC and ME leadership and is an advocate for the employee experience. The ability to identify issues or programs that could have a negative impact on the employee experience and/or reputation of Amazon is critical, along with the ability to counsel and support leadership on an appropriate course of action.

The position drives the consistent messaging of our unique Amazon culture and customer obsession to both internal customer service sites, and outsourced partner operations. It ensures that all messaging reinforces our culture and that we have consistent, intentional themes threaded through our communications. The role identifies appropriate communications channels (All Hands meetings, video messages, newsletters, blogs, internal social media tools, team meetings, etc.), translation, creates content and teaches others how to deliver that content. Activities also include driving Amazon associate engagement in public community activities and charity-oriented projects. This role is responsible for ensuring we have mechanisms in place for upward feedback, and a closed loop to act on that feedback. Success in the role includes performance on employee engagement scores, and ongoing improvement in employee pride.

Core Job Responsibilities
  • Align APAC and ME Customer Service communication with Global Customer Service Communication.
  • Develop and execute highly innovative internal communications strategies, messages and tactics to engage a dynamic and rapidly growing employee base in APAC and ME.
  • Proactively build and manage relationships with key internal stakeholders across a range of businesses and geographies
  • Partner with, and provide strategic counsel to APAC and ME operational leaders, particularly regarding decisions with potential impact on the business and reputation, and develop strategies to mitigate and manage.
  • Provide issues management and crisis communications support when required.
  • Provide expert internal communications counsel to diverse groups within the organization
  • Use internal communications tools including blogs, email, video, and social media tools to engage the APAC and ME customer service workforce
  • Track and report content effectiveness metrics to internal stakeholders, as well as continually monitor, analyze and tune messaging to maximize impact; and manage and support crisis communications, as needed.
  • Develop and manage internal communications (for example, intra- or cross-divisional messages, talking points, frequently asked questions (FAQs), associate-facing promotional materials, presentations, articles).
  • Develop communication plans for major change initiatives.
  • Develop and drive the execution of multiple business plans and campaigns for internal communications.
  • Identify and implement new and innovative communication ideas.
  • Train leadership teams on written, verbal, and visual communication strategies.

Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor’s degree in Communications or a related field (Journalism, Marketing Communication, Public Relations or related field and / or related work experience in the area of Communications and Change Management).
  • Excellent writing skills are a must, with the ability to formulate a clear point of view on complicated issues, and create a concise and well-written narrative.
  • Experience in providing counsel to, and working with senior executives.
  • 14+ years of communications experience including internal communications-focused experience.
  • Ability to use quantitative and qualitative data to make decisions and recommendations.
  • Experience leading communications programs in a multinational business across multiple geographies.
  • Experience leading social media employee engagement programs/campaigns.
  • English business-level language skills.

Preferred Qualifications

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Excellent track record of driving cultural change and influencing organizations through a communications plan.
  • Experience developing creative, effective approaches to difficult communications challenges.
  • Ability to exercise high judgment, particularly in narrow time-frames.
  • Willing to roll up one’s sleeves and get work done, even when it’s outside the scope of the job.
  • Ability to pay painstaking attention to important details.
  • Communications experience in media, Internet, technology, distribution, operations, automotive, retail and/or airline industries is highly preferred.
  • Additional language skills.

Company - ADCI HYD 20 SEZ
Job ID: A1278936

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"JobPosting","datePosted":"2021-02-06T05:56:50.000Z","description":"\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EDescription\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EPosition Summary\u003Cbr\u003ELaunched on the web in 1995, Amazon has grown to become the world's leader in e-commerce, and in customer service. Getting its start as a bookseller, the company now offers everything from books to tennis rackets to e-books and diamond rings. The evolution of Amazon has been driven by a spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EOur vision is to be Earth's most customer-centric company; to build a place where customers can find and discover anything they want to buy online. Our global Customer Service (CS) team is at the heart of that mission, supporting Amazon’s millions of customers on product questions, post-order inquiries, technical support, and customer account management. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. So if you thrive in a challenging, fast-paced, innovative and customer-orientated environment, Amazon is the place for you. We’re making history and the great news is that we’ve only just begun.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EThis role is based in Hyderabad, India and will lead a small team of communications professionals. It is responsible for the Asia Pacific (APAC) and Middle East (ME) Customer Service (CS) internal communications strategy and programs, across China, India, Japan, Malaysia, Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, and United Arab Emirates. This includes enabling CS leaders and operations teams to effectively communicate with their teams, and for key information to cascade consistently and smoothly through the organization. These messages will clarify Amazon strategy to all levels of the organization, and will “connect the dots” for CS associates in terms of how their work contributes to the larger vision and strategy.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EThis role supports CS APAC and ME leadership and is an advocate for the employee experience. The ability to identify issues or programs that could have a negative impact on the employee experience and/or reputation of Amazon is critical, along with the ability to counsel and support leadership on an appropriate course of action.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EThe position drives the consistent messaging of our unique Amazon culture and customer obsession to both internal customer service sites, and outsourced partner operations. It ensures that all messaging reinforces our culture and that we have consistent, intentional themes threaded through our communications. The role identifies appropriate communications channels (All Hands meetings, video messages, newsletters, blogs, internal social media tools, team meetings, etc.), translation, creates content and teaches others how to deliver that content. Activities also include driving Amazon associate engagement in public community activities and charity-oriented projects. This role is responsible for ensuring we have mechanisms in place for upward feedback, and a closed loop to act on that feedback. Success in the role includes performance on employee engagement scores, and ongoing improvement in employee pride.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003ECore Job and provide strategic counsel to APAC and ME operational leaders, particularly regarding decisions with potential impact on the business and reputation, and develop strategies to mitigate and manage.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Provide issues management and crisis communications support when required.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Provide expert internal communications counsel to diverse
