item.title: Client Service Associate - Registered
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
CWB McLean & Partners
Clients are at the heart of everything we do. Through personalized investment strategies, ongoing transparent communication and a human approach, our entire team is dedicated to going beyond the numbers to provide our clients with peace of mind.

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.
The opportunity
Relationship building. Customer service delivery. Client account management.

The Client Service Associate is responsible ensuring their customer service delivery and the management of clients’ data, administration and relationship- has the high quality touch and feel demanded by our clientele.

The ideal applicant will be responsible for encouraging high touch relationships with our clients. Your passion and focus for the client should come from a deep understanding and appreciation for the trust they have placed in us. Our clients’ investments aren't just a collection of numbers on a spreadsheet. They are children’s education, safeguards against the unexpected, years of retirement vacations – these investments are their entire lives and their future.
  • The ability, passion, and skills to proactively administer and service 100+ high net worth clients.
  • A consistent track record of successfully building relationships with clients
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work efficiently within a team and ownership culture.
  • Proactive self-starter
  • A proven understanding of the investment industry, and key client service components: documentation, compliance and trading.
  • Current registration in an IR or RR capacity with IIROC is strongly preferred.
The day to day
Client Service Delivery
  • Embrace our “exceeding expectations” philosophy in all client dealings
  • Making clients and guests feel beyond welcomed, appreciated and respected at all times.
  • Provide an exceptional service experience for our clients through on-time delivery of information related to client requests and needs, such as; tax packages, EFTs, cheques, reporting, account information, combined with a focus on building personal relationships
  • Supporting the CPM in their business development efforts
  • Work closely with the Portfolio Managers to develop, service, and maintain client relationships
Client Account Management
  • Responsible for all administrative components, acting on client requests and providing the CPM with the support to ensure high levels of client retention.
  • Driving onboarding through expedited documentation, account opening and fee setup to ensure the efficient transition from prospect to client
  • Provide administrative support in delivering client documentation including Client Portfolio Reviews, Prospect Presentations, meeting review materials and various spreadsheets for CPM analysis.
  • Provide Naviplan administrative support to CPM when producing client financial plans.
  • Proactively booking meetings and preparing portfolio reviews and documentation for client review meetings
  • Ensure documentation is maintained for accuracy, timeliness, and that all relevant information is maintained in the CRM system
  • Ensure accuracy in all trading, purchase, and redemption orders, and that all activities are settled correctly in an appropriate time frame
  • Work collaboratively with client accountants during tax time - providing tax slips, statements, and tax packages.
Foundational knowledge and experience to build on

Three plus years’ professional experience as an RR/IR registered client service associate. Trading capabilities in domestic and international marketplaces with proven trading system competencies (quotes, depth of market, bond trading).

Registration Requirements
  • Registered
  • Registered: RR – Registered Representative, or IR-Investment Representative: Securities
Skills that take you further
  • Capable. Diligent. Reliable. Organized. Efficient. Collaborative
  • Ability to perform large volumes with high attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritize and optimally manage demanding workloads
  • Ability to deal with confidential documentation
  • Work collaboratively in a team environment
Why work with us? People first benefits
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements . Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Unique schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Create your career. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/19/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: EMEA Partner Success Lead, Global Systems Integrators
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS you can requisition compute power, storage, and many other services – gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as your business demands them. AWS is the leading platform for designing and developing applications for the cloud and is growing at a staggering pace in terms of revenue, customers, people, and complexity.

Role Summary

Reporting to the EMEA Head of Partner Success, this role is responsible for the all-inclusive strategy for our Global Systems Integrator (GSI) partnerships across the region and aligning co-selling with the AWS field sales teams. They will lead dotted line teams to successful partner sales quota attainment.This role will also be a transformative unifier of teams across AWS and partners.

This individual will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders, sales teams, and partner sales and technical teams. They are able to deal with ambiguity, apply high judgment, design innovative, game-changing approaches, and lead strategic, large, and complex initiatives.

From this role, the Lead will work across multiple organizations, globally, company-wide, or with industry leaders. They will enable teams, and establish KPIs that set the EMEA GSI and Industry business up for long term success.

The execution of the role is critical, you will actively work to reduce bureaucracy and remove blockers that stifle innovation. You will decide what areas and/or technologies need investment to grow (and when they don’t). You will negotiate new boundaries around the areas you own to achieve the best outcomes. You will be a thought leader and a culture ambassador among the AWS and Partner teams.

This role can be based in London, Munich, Berlin, Paris, Milan, Amsterdam, or Madrid.

Key Responsibilities
  • Manage a partner sales target delivered through a defined set of GSIs in EMEA.
  • Work cross functionally and collaborates with sales, marketing, services, and training/enablement leadership teams to build a fully integrated GSI partner ecosystem
  • Engage a team of enterprise partner success managers as well as partner solution architects that are responsible for the overall success of the AWS partners selling with the AWS field teams.
  • Represent AWS as the Leader of GSIs in region and participate in industry and partner events to deliver thought leadership on how AWS enables customer value
  • As the voice of the AWS field, engage with AWS GSI partner management team to support the build of GSI partner capability within EMEA.
  • Manage and develop multiple senior sales and technical relationships across our GSI partners within EMEA and establish the partner success team as the single point of contact for selling with AWS.
  • Manage the GSI operational cadence of business reviews (MBR, QBR) with the sales leadership across EMEA.
  • Oversee the development of the GSI’s by establishing KPI’s and best practices.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to develop, establish, and direct GSI and Industry strategies, programs, and best practices.
  • Manage overall GSI enablement process, set appropriate metrics for partner funnel management.
  • Collaborate with senior sales leadership to identify opportunities for sales process improvement.
  • Provide input on partner training content and process based on communications with partners, industry best practices, or recommended process improvements.

Basic Qualifications
  • Significant GSI experience in sales/channel/business development
  • Experience building and leading teams and in direct and matrix operating structures
  • Demonstrated track record of success with sales/channel teams
  • Demonstrated success in shaping and executing large complex deals with partners
  • Proven verbal & written communication skills with senior leaders
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive goals to completion
  • Prior experience managing the performance metrics and channel sales best practices for team members
Preferred Qualifications
  • MBA/Technical Undergraduate/Master’s Degree
  • Experience and familiarity with the AWS platform, products, solutions and capabilities
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy/eu ) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - AWS EMEA SARL (Netherlands)
Job ID: A1274687

item.title: Banking Customer Experience (Front-line) Manager
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.
The opportunity
Our employees are more than just numbers – we are proud of the welcoming and open culture that invests in our people. Manager, Sales and Service leads the frontline customer service team whose primary goal is to help clients with their day-to-day banking needs while becoming the source of information for where clients’ money is going and what it is doing. Accountable for operations and sales, you will be responsible for acquiring new clients and enhancing our current clients’ experiences through demonstrated leadership and financial expertise.

What Your Day Will Look Like

Leadership. Client focused. Selling. Team engagement. Streamline operations.
  • Leadership. Exercising your practiced leadership side while truly connecting with your team and clients to transform their banking experience into something memorable, rewarding and financially satisfying.
  • Customer experience: Deliver outstanding experiences at every interaction and execute on plans to continuously build the customer experience, in line with CWB’s brand promise.
  • Sales. Demonstrating, coaching and mentoring your team to proactively identifying customer needs while driving sales and uncovering opportunities to be crucial to customer’s financial success by probing, product matching, problem solving and relationship building. This means also working closely with the commercial team.
  • Team engagement & development. Utilizing your mentorship abilities through formal and informal coaching to help develop skills and confidence that enhances client relationships and grows the personal banking portfolios in a way that promotes enthusiasm.
  • Process & operations. Using customer insights to drive and guide your implementations and maintenance of programs and procedures that ensure background administration, policy and regulatory requirements are running optimally and efficiently.
  • Financial & analytical understanding. Applying your financial expertise and testing your accuracy while preparing and reviewing weekly, monthly and quarterly reports that help communicate the progress, goals and strategic objectives of the branch.
Who you are
  • People first. You are all about people. Be it your clients or your colleagues – you like communicating and connecting with others to provide solutions and build real, lasting relationships.
  • Customer focused. Your keen focus allows you to anticipate customer’s need to go beyond expectations and drive sales and opportunities to genuinely help others while growing business.
  • Initiator. You’re a self-starter, independent and accountable. You are ambitious, eager to learn and have a real interest in finances and how people spend and use their money.
  • Solution oriented. You are energized when faced with ambiguity and can adjust your approach – with people and problems – to respond efficiently and effectively in changing conditions. This means juggling the many tasks, demands and competing priorities that arise in a day with a practiced ease and level head.
  • Personal banking expert. You’ve spent about four to six years in a banking environment and have had storied practice at leading, mentoring and coaching high-performing sales driven teams. You’ve had ample experience managing day-to-day cash operations in a branch.
  • Technically savvy. You’re computer proficient – MS Office Suite, as well exposure to a lending or banking system.
Why work for us? Benefits to benefit you.
Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Unique schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, this role has incentives on top of incentives!!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/6/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGreat Places To Work.\u003C/strong\u003E CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiscover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EClosing Date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cli\u003E P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E02/6/2021\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Inclusion & \u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiversity\u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. item.title: OB Process Assistant
item.content:encoded:
Key Job Elements

DESCRIPTION
  • Support and work in the department as required
  • Helping support daily management of department duties, including allocating labor, leading meetings, assigning job duties, and communicating with internal and external suppliers
  • Providing vacation coverage for Area Managers
  • Providing policy follow-up, attendance tracking (duties do not extend to discipline)
  • Tracking and reporting of ATS/labor hours
  • Assisting the floor as an associate resource, training associates and verifying SOP compliance
  • Ensuring successful area performance, through tracking, reporting and feedback of associate performance
  • Participating in Operational Excellence initiatives in some capacity
  • Filling in as needed with production duties
  • Fully understanding workflow and daily production goals
  • Reviewing and updating SOP as required
  • Assisting in keeping work area clean and organized
  • Identifying and addressing safety hazards within the work area
  • Coaching associates to work safely at all times
  • Participating in safety initiatives
  • Referring all job injuries immediately to area manager

Basic Qualifications
  • A high school diploma or equivalent
  • Are at least 18 years old, and authorized to work in the United States
  • Able to work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
  • Able to lift up to 49 pounds, stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours, and be able to frequently push, pull, squat, bend and reach, all with or without reasonable accommodation
  • 2+ years of work experience or a completed Associate’s Degree
  • 1+ year of experience working with computers and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)
Preferred Qualifications
  • 1+ year of leadership experience directly managing others
  • 1+ year working in a like environment (manufacturing/distribution/warehousing/large retail)
  • Experience with performance metrics and lean process improvemen
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills to coach, train and assist team members

Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon M
Job ID: A1252390

item.title: Project Engineer II
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Project Engineer II assists the Senior Project Engineer in obtaining, evaluating, coordinating and distributing the information and authorizations necessary to construct the project on time, within budget and to the quality specified. In the performance of this function the Project Engineer II is responsible for protecting and promoting the interests of both the business and client in all matters as well as demonstrating the personal characteristics of a developing leader.

Responsibilities
  • Ensure Contract Document Logs are established and maintained
  • Ensure status reports on RFIs, Submittals and other Documents are prepared and presented
  • Write effective scopes of work for bid packages
  • Effectively issue Request for Quotations and follow up with Trade Contractors
  • Successfully update project schedules with CPM techniques
  • Timely document field quality activities
  • Prepare change management reports, estimates and other cost report documents
  • Establish and maintain the project quality files and documentation systems
  • Continually promote organizational change initiatives, suggests new ideas, and adapt to work within new structures and processes
  • Continually seek to understand customer goals and needs and act with a sense of urgency in meeting customer needs and demonstrating value
  • Develop industry relationships and expand professional networks that have potential to generate opportunities for Gilbane
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 2 or more years with CM/General Contractor Organization
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Proven record of meeting organizational and personal goals while delivering results to a standard of excellence
  • Demonstrated understanding of success metrics and risks associated with one’s program, business unit or portfolio of projects
  • Continually seek to understand customer goals and needs and act with a sense of urgency in meeting customer needs and demonstrating value
  • Adjust effectively to work within new structures, processes, requirements and culture
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Ability to work in a team based environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office programs
  • OSHA 10-Hour Certified
  • Basic MEP Knowledge
  • Understanding of Contract Document & Specifications
  • Knowledge of CMiC helpful
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Cloud Support Eng. II (DMS)
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Web Services is the global market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team in Amazon Internet Services Private Limited (AISPL), you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products, arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.

Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications, servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team in India helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?

If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT Amazon?

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
  • Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.
  • Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.
  • Interact with leading engineers around the world.
  • Partner with Amazon teams in India to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.
  • Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal Amazon teams in India on how to improve our services.
  • Drive customer communication during critical events.
  • Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.
  • Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.
  • Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.
WHY AWS PREMIUM SUPPORT?
  • First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.
  • On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.
  • Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives to ensure better CX and compliance with global AWS standards, practices and policies.
  • Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.
  • Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.
We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AISPL, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.
  • Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.
  • As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GC3bWcFFZTo&t=24s

Basic Qualification

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
  • Requires minimum of 3+ yrs experience in relevant technical position
  • Administrator skills on Linux (or flavor of Linux/UNIX system), Networking; IPsec, VPN, Load Balancing, Iperf, DNS, DHCP, Routing Protocols, SSH, Network Monitoring.
  • Knowledge of some Developer & Mobile language/Services- Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, .NET, JavaScript, iOS/Objective-C/Swift, Rest API, inter-application messaging & queueing, develop mobile apps, version control systems, virtualization. Experience with web-based applications and HTTP
  • Knowledge of client/server and distributed systems architectures (WebServers)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Customer service experience / strong customer focus.
  • Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experience
  • Motivated and excited to be learning about new technologies every day
Preferred Qualification

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience developing against and working with REST API based services
  • Prior working experience with AWS services
  • Experience with Cloud architecture patterns and distributed computing concepts
  • Exposure to Mobile application development (iOS / Android)
  • Exposure to mobile and web application security best practices
  • Messaging and Queueing experience
  • Detailed knowledge of networking protocols: DNS, HTTP, SSL, SMTP, TCP
  • Exposure to security concepts / methodologies
  • Experience with iperf, MTR, traceroute, dig
  • Experience handling full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications
  • Experience working with identity providers (i.e. Login with Amazon, Facebook Connect, OpenID, etc.) / OAuth
  • Experience with push notifications, APNS and GCM
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.


Company - AISPL - Karnataka
Job ID: A1273800

We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT Amazon?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EEvery day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Interact with leading engineers around the world.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Partner with Amazon teams in India to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal Amazon teams in India on how to improve our services.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Drive customer communication during critical events.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003EWHY AWS PREMIUM SUPPORT?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives to ensure better CX and compliance with global AWS standards, practices and policies.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003EWe hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AISPL, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003Ehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GC3bWcFFZTo&t=24s\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EBasic Qualification\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBASIC QUALIFICATIONS\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Requires minimum of 3+ yrs experience in relevant technical position\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Administrator skills on Linux (or flavor of Linux/UNIX system), Networking; IPsec, VPN, Load Balancing, Iperf, DNS, DHCP, Routing Protocols, SSH, Network Monitoring.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Knowledge of some Developer & Mobile language/Services- Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, .NET, JavaScript, iOS/Objective-C/Swift, Rest API, inter-application messaging & queueing, develop mobile apps, version control systems, virtualization. Experience with web-based applications and HTTP\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Knowledge of client/server and distributed systems architectures (WebServers)\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Excellent verbal and written communication skills\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Customer service experience / strong customer focus.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experience\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Motivated and excited to be learning about new technologies every day\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EPreferred Qualification\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience developing against and working with REST API based services\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Prior working experience with AWS services\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience with Cloud architecture patterns and distributed computing concepts\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Exposure to Mobile application development (iOS / Android)\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Exposure to mobile and web application security best practices\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Messaging and Queueing experience\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Detailed knowledge of networking protocols: DNS, HTTP, SSL, SMTP, TCP\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Exposure to security concepts / methodologies\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience with iperf, MTR, traceroute, dig\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience handling full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience working with identity providers (i.e. Login with Amazon, Facebook Connect, OpenID, etc.) / OAuth\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience with push notifications, APNS and GCM\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003EAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany\u003C/strong\u003E - AISPL - Karnataka\u003Cbr\u003EJob ID: A1273800","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Mid-Senior level","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Amazon","sameAs":"https://www.linkedin.com/company/amazon","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHTvZwCx4p2Qg/company-logo_200_200/0/1612205615891?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=WfYR37G08TkVa7lN5a3vt-3hjaPFkkq_WURo-HMa1a4"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Amazon","value":"1273800"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHTvZwCx4p2Qg/company-logo_100_100/0/1612205615891?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=yvrUvyQ56ohO0TWzcoTwQF7GCRTKM6yOmjExx8jIhk0","industry":"Computer Software,Information Technology and Services,Internet","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Bengaluru","addressRegion":null,"postalCode":"560015","addressCountry":"IN"}},"skills":"","title":"Cloud Support Eng. II (DMS)","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:51.000Z"}</script>

item.title: Business Systems Analyst I
item.content:encoded:
Description

Do you get excited working on new challenges everyday? Do you like to problem solve, drive solutions and influence what features should be launched for customers? AWS Business Operations team is looking for a talented Business Analyst who can troubleshoot, problem-solve, arrive at solutions for Billing and Financial escalations for Global AWS customers. We work with cross-functional teams across the company such as Accounts Receivable, Accounting, Operations, Customer Service, Development teams on a daily basis. On this team you are empowered to drive the solution that is right for the customer with the development team and influence the customer-facing features that are created in the larger commerce platform organization. You are expected to assist our team to understand our business metrics using your analytical and troubleshooting skills. You will implement process improvement initiatives to reduce operational burden within the team.

This position has several key responsibilities including working with internal stakeholders to investigate and prevent customer dissatisfaction. You are responsible for converting data into actionable business insights. You will be an analysis expert who leverages a variety of data platforms and analytical tools to provide timely, meaningful, and consumable information. You build deep contextual and domain knowledge. You ensure data quality and build scalable tools. You communicate findings with the most effective and influential methods. This position also includes troubleshooting and resolving customer and CS queries, working with internal stakeholders, and use of data warehouse tools. Other projects may include creating or updating existing SOPs and reporting on key metrics.

We are part of the larger AWS Commerce Platform organization that is focused on the most interesting and challenging problems lying at the intersection of cloud computing and e-commerce. These include enabling developers and software companies to easily distribute, and make money from, their cloud-based products; enabling consumers of cloud-based software to evaluate, buy, and 1-click deploy even the most complicated cloud architectures; modeling the new ways that software is sold and consumed in a cloud environment; and interpreting and processing the very high volume stream of events (e.g. trillions per day) that underlies enabling e-commerce for the cloud. We are bringing Amazon.com's 19 years of e-commerce leadership and IP to bear on the cloud computing space, including providing the e-commerce platform on which AWS runs, and delivering the AWS Marketplace that enables third-party developers and software companies to launch cloud-based products. And, along the way, we get to tackle problems on the leading edge of security and fraud detection, distributed computing and bill computation, and low-latency/real-time analysis -- all in an environment whose scale and high-throughput is orders of magnitude beyond most other systems.


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree
  • At least 1+ years of professional working experience in related occupations of Systems Analyst, Business Operations Engineer, Business Operations Program Manager, or related.
  • At least 1+ years of SQL experience
  • At least 1+ years of experience with data warehousing and reporting
  • At least 1+ years of experience customer service experience
  • At least 1+ years of Microsoft experience (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Excel)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience involving distributed system performance analysis and optimization.
  • Experience in E-commerce payments processing
  • An MS in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, or a related field
  • Customer Service background
  • Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate technical information to internal and external customers or vendors
  • Proactive and forward-thinking attitude and creative problem-solving ability
  • A motivated self-starter who can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Women / Minority / Disability/Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.


Company - ADCI HYD 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1279991

item.title: Sr. Relationship Manager, Commercial
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

Senior Relationship Manager, Commercial Banking
Role Specifications
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy

Our Commercial team includes a diverse group of banking professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated commercial bankers knows the value of relationship building and brings that flawless combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table.

No day is ever the same in commercial banking. Whether it’s providing proactive client solutions, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.

What Your Day Will Look Like

Client focused: Deliver exceptional client experiences at every interaction and execute on plans to continuously build the client experience, in line with CWB’s brand promise. Provide full-service solutions for clients with the view to be every client’s primary financial partner.

Portfolio management: You will be responsible for growing and managing a diverse mix of client accounts with average loan and deposit volumes of between $2MM and $10MM.

Sales activation: You will undertake the gamut in sales activities including annual loan, deposit, cash management, revenue and new client objectives.

Networking: You will connect and establish networks with a variety of partners and clients to develop lasting relationships for you and the bank.

Risk management: Together with the commercial credit team, you will utilize your risk management skills to ensure appropriate measures are put into place and risk assessment protocols and structures are implemented, while balancing risk and reward within CWB's risk appetite.

Mentorship: Although no direct employees report to you, you will develop a strong leadership foundation by coaching and mentoring work with junior employees.

Learning: Although you’ve developed a strong commercial foundation, you are always identifying trends and growing your knowledge on your next client or business area to achieve ultimate success and strong results from you and your team.
Critical proficiencies for success
Financially savvy. You’ve garnered strong commercial lending experience that has allowed you to plan, execute and develop strategies that have resulted in you hitting your sales targets and business goals out of the financial institution park.

Client focused. You have the right tools to ensure proper stewardship strategies while leading and building a portfolio of medium to large commercial clients.

A strategic planner. You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and an excellent one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allow you to set winning plans that result in achievements and business successes.

An encouraging teammate. You love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality.

Think big and beyond. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems, it is your knack for strategy and solutions that sets you apart from your peers.

Foundational Knowledge And Experience

A Bachelor’s Degree in commerce, finance or accounting disciplines and a minimum of 5 years’ experience within commercial lending or related experience.
Why work with us?
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, this role has incentives on top of incentives!!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

https://www.cwbcareers.com/en/why-cwb

Closing Date
  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
02/15/2021 Inclusion &

Diversity
CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
Accessibility

CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

You’ve garnered strong commercial lending experience that has allowed you to plan, execute and develop strategies that have resulted in you hitting your sales targets and business goals out of the financial institution park.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EClient focused. You have the right tools to ensure proper stewardship strategies while leading and building a portfolio of medium to large commercial clients.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EA strategic planner. You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and an excellent one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allow you to set winning plans that result in achievements and business successes.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EAn encouraging teammate. You love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EThink big and beyond. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems, it is your knack for strategy and solutions that sets you apart from your peers.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EFoundational Knowledge And Experience\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EA Bachelor’s Degree in commerce, finance or accounting disciplines and a minimum of 5 years’ experience within commercial lending or related experience.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Why work with us? \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWinners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020 \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EYour voice matters.\u003C/strong\u003E Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe opportunity to make a difference\u003C/strong\u003E. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFlexible work arrangements\u003C/strong\u003E. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPhysical health and mental fitness \u003Cem\u003Eare \u003C/em\u003Epriorities\u003C/strong\u003E. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECommunity giving. \u003C/strong\u003EDrive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBring your whole self to work. \u003C/strong\u003EInclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EInnovation. \u003C/strong\u003ELearn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EConnection. \u003C/strong\u003EJoin, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EOrganization wide coaching services\u003C/strong\u003E. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ERecognition. \u003C/strong\u003EPeer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFinancial rewards\u003C/strong\u003E. Yup! We pay you too. Base \u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cem\u003Eplus \u003C/em\u003E\u003C/strong\u003Eperformance incentives. In fact, this role has \u003Cstrong\u003Eincentives on top of incentives!!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ERetirement investment strategy. \u003C/strong\u003EYou can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany ownership.\u003C/strong\u003E The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGreat Places To Work. \u003C/strong\u003ECWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiscover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003Ehttps://www.cwbcareers.com/en/why-cwb\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EClosing Date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E02/15/2021\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Inclusion & \u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiversity\u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. item.title: Supervisor de Servicio al Cliente
item.content:encoded:
KAVAK es el e-commerce No. 1 para la compra y venta de vehículos en América Latina, proyectada como una de las empresas más grandes de la región. Hemos sido seleccionados como "Emprendimiento del año 2018" por la Revista Expansión y por el ranking #LinkedInTopStartup 2019 y 2020 como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en México y nos convertimos en la primera start-up en alcanzar el estatus de unicornio (valorado en $ 1 billón de dólares) en México.

Nuestra misión es transformar el mercado de compra y venta de segunda mano brindando la mejor experiencia, transparencia y seguridad a nuestros clientes.

Cómo contexto, KAVAK opera en México desde hace poco más de 4 años y ha ido creciendo exponencialmente. Actualmente somos más de 1.800 kavakos en el equipo, incluyendo operaciones en Brasil y Argentina y como parte de este crecimiento acelerado queremos garantizar que nos rodeemos del mejor talento para fortalecer nuestros equipos y así seguir construyendo la tecnología, procesos y productos que nos permitan transformar el mercado automotriz.

¿Estás motivado para ser parte de esta misión y ayudarnos a construir el resto de la historia? ¡Únete a nosotros!

¡Únete a nosotros como : Supervisor de Servicio al cliente.

Tu Misión Será

Dirigir a un equipo cada vez mayor de agentes de soporte para garantizar un servicio al cliente asombroso al resolver los contactos entrantes de los clientes por teléfono y chat

Al aplicar a este cargo tendrás las siguientes funciones:
  • Monitorear la correcta ejecución de los procesos garantizando un buen servicio a nuestro clientes.
  • Análisis e implementación de estrategias para mejora continua del área.
  • Gestión de SLA de servicio al cliente
  • Colaborar con el equipo de experiencia para mejorar nuestro servicio y abordar de manera eficaz la casusa de los inconvenientes con los clientes.


¿Qué buscamos?
  • Experiencia comprobada como supervisor de atención al cliente.
  • Experiencia previa en Start Up recomendable
  • Manejo avanzado de paquetería Office
  • Resolución de problemas
  • Perfil analítico
  • Trabajo bajo presión
  • Fuertes habilidades de comunicación tanto escritas como verbales.
  • Capacidad de mejorar los proceso definidos y crear otros nuevos.


¿Qué ofrecemos?
  • Sueldo base $20,000 netos mensuales
  • Prestaciones de ley y superiores
  • Tarjeta de asistencia CAE (tarjeta con servicios y descuentos como médicos, nutriólogos, psicólogos, asistencia legal, funeraria, seguro por reembolso de gastos médicos por accidente cubre hasta $20,000.00, entre muchos otros servicios)
  • Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores


Este rol es primordial para el crecimiento de KAVAK en esta etapa de innovación, consolidación y expansión.

item.title: Software Development Engineer - AWS S3
item.content:encoded:
Description

Are you excited about the incredible opportunity that cloud computing represents? Are you passionate about delivering quality services and ready to apply your experience at massive scale? Amazon Web Services' Cloud Storage, AWS S3, is one of the largest storage in the world. We host trillions of objects and serve millions of requests per second and we're growing more than 100% year over year.

S3 Lifecycle Transitions team is an integral part of S3 Storage Management landscape. Our goal is to help our customers optimize their storage costs over the lifecycle of their stored objects. We understand that access patterns of objects change over time and exploit this to help our customers to move to different S3 storage classes optimized for specific access patterns. We are the team that manages rule based storage class transitions of the objects at internet scale by discovering and moving billions of objects each day for our customers. Going into 2020, our team objective is to continue demonstrating operational excellence, keep our services secure, optimize our services with goal to lower infrastructure cost, bring agility by automating region builds and to add new features to make S3 more usable and create value for our customers.

The S3 Lifecycle Transitions team develops software responsible for lifecycle transition workflows and unification of S3 Glacier storage class. Developers on the S3 Lifecycle team work on some of the hardest computer science problems. We build that can handle wildly varying access patterns and unprecedented load by our customers. Managing this growth auto-magically, without the need for customers to provision capacity, is what puts the SIMPLE in S3.

As a Software Engineer on this team, you will have the unique opportunity of not just designing, developing and owning entire sub- with hard system problems but also designing API's that are used by millions of applications around the world and by doing so defining S3 for customers. The work you do here is going to significantly drive growth not just in S3 but the AWS ecosystem.

Creating a reliable, scalable, and flexible web service requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale . You should be somebody who enjoys working on complex system software, is customer-centric, and feels strongly not only about building good software but about making that software achieve its goals in operational reality. Come join us and help solve a challenging set of problems in a space packed of opportunities.

Worklife Balance
Our team works together to provide work/life balance for all team members. We recognize that the circumstances of our team members vary, and we balance work across the team so that we’re all able to maintain standards on behalf of our customers, while at the same time allowing for rich and happy personal lives.

On-Call Responsibility
S3 services are highly available, but there are times when we occasionally stray away from our SLAs. In order to minimize the impact of such excursions, we do have On-Call rotations. However, we set these up so there are focused time periods when you are on-call and when you are not, you can focus on your day job :)
Mentorship & Career Growth
We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Inclusive Team Culture
We have a diverse team and drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. Our team is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Our team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. These range from groups such as the Black Employee Network, Amazon Women and Engineering and LGBTQ+


Basic Qualifications
  • 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong foundation in , structures, OO and core Computer Science concepts
  • Experience with building highly-available and scalable .
  • Understanding of networking protocols
  • Strong desire to build, sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.
  • MS/Phd Degree in Computer Science

Company - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC
Job ID: A1273706

These range from groups such as the Black Employee Network, Amazon Women and Engineering and LGBTQ+\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EBasic Qualifications\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EPreferred Qualifications\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong foundation in , structures, OO and core Computer Science concepts\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience with building highly-available and scalable .\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Understanding of networking protocols\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong desire to build, sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E MS/Phd Degree in Computer Science\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany\u003C/strong\u003E - item.title: Associate Solutions Architect
item.content:encoded:
Description

Do you have a deep passion for utilizing technology to empower businesses? Are you passionate about collaborating with technology and business leaders to deliver cloud-based solutions?
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com and a leader in Cloud Computing, is seeking early career talent to join our AWS Tech U Program. This is a unique opportunity for driven, self-starters to play a key role in a fast-growing business, and to deliver significant value to AWS customers of all sizes from nimble startups to global brands. You will learn from top AWS subject matter experts and get paid while you train for an exciting career in the tech industry.
These are some of the most challenging and exciting roles in the IT industry today. We work with cutting edge technologies supporting the largest and most innovative businesses, non-profits, and government agencies around the world. This is a an unparalleled opportunity to leapfrog your peers and take a leadership role helping AWS to transform the way the world uses technology to solve their business challenges. The skills and experiences you gain will be highly sought after throughout the industry and give you the opportunity for the career of a lifetime.
Associate Solutions Architect
Our Associate Solutions Architects are passionate technologists with technical breadth and depth coupled with strong interpersonal skills. They are passionate about helping customers build infrastructures and applications at scale. In this role, you will partner across AWS teams to help customers craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems. As a trusted customer advocate, you will help organizations understand best practices around cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help customers use AWS within their organizations ranging from new start-ups to large enterprise customers.

About Tech U

As an Associate Solutions Architect, you will be part of AWS Tech U, which is an accelerated career development program for those who want to advance both their technical and business skills. The Program will provide you with training and work experience that aligns in the fields of Solutions Architecture.
This unique program consists of a 6-month instructor lead, project-based learning curriculum , followed by a 6-month On-the-Job Training (OJT) learning assignment within Solutions Architecture.
Are you ready to embrace the challenge? Come build the future with us.

The Program will start : March 2021/September 2021


Basic Qualifications
  • Currently enrolled in or received a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related fields
  • Experience with one of the following programming languages: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C#, or C++
  • Experience with Networking fundamentals, Security, Databases (Relational and/or NoSQL), Operating Systems (Unix, Linux, and/or Windows)
  • Fluent proficiency in English
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience implementing a cloud-based technology solution in a school project or while working for a company
  • Experience with one or more of the following domains: systems administration (Linux/Window), network administration (DNS, IPsec, BGP, VPN, Load Balancing), or programming (Node.JS, Java, Ruby, C#, Python, or PHP)
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

EU Student Programs Team


Company - AWS EMEA SARL (Netherlands)
Job ID: A1273137

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - Nationwide Opportunities
item.content:encoded:
Description

Want to help the largest global enterprises derive business value through the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)? Excited by using massive amounts of disparate data to develop ML models? Eager to learn to apply ML to a diverse array of enterprise use cases? Thrilled to be a part of Amazon who has been pioneering and shaping the world’s AI/ML technology for decades?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML models on the AWS Cloud. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. AWS Professional Services works together with AWS customers to address their business needs using AI solutions.

AWS Professional Services is a unique consulting team. We pride ourselves on being customer obsessed and highly focused on the AI enablement of our customers. If you have experience with AI, including building ML models, we’d like to have you join our team. You will get to work with an innovative company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun helping our customers. A successful candidate will be a person who enjoys diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions.

This is a customer-facing role and you will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed.

Major Responsibilities Include
  • Assist customers by being able to deliver a ML project from beginning to end, including understanding the business need, aggregating data, exploring data, building & validating predictive models, and deploying completed models with concept-drift monitoring and retraining to deliver business impact to the organization
  • Use AWS AI services (e.g., Personalize), ML platforms (SageMaker), and frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build ML models
  • Research and implement novel ML approaches, including hardware optimizations on platforms such as AWS Inferentia
  • Work with our other Professional Services consultants (Big Data, IoT, HPC) to analyze, extract, normalize, and label relevant data, and with our Professional Services engineers to operationalize customers’ models after they are prototyped

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent professional or military experience
  • Experience with ML fields, e.g., natural language processing, computer vision, statistical learning theory
  • 6+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science, and analysis
  • Experience in an ML engineer or data scientist role building and deploying ML models or hands on experience developing deep learning models
  • Experience writing code in Python, R, Scala, Java, C++ with documentation for reproducibility
  • Experience handling terabyte size datasets, diving into data to discover hidden patterns, using data visualization tools, writing SQL, and working with GPUs to develop models
  • Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s degree of PhD in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
  • Ability to develop strategic, baselined, data modeling processes; ability to accurately determine cause-and-effect relationships.
  • Publications or presentations in recognized ML journals or conferences
  • Deep technical skills, consulting experience, and business savvy to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customers’ organization
  • Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $116,200 per year. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.


Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.
Job ID: A1273919
