item.title: AVP, Retail Banking
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy

Our Retail Banking team includes a diverse group of finance professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated retail banking professionals know and understand the value of relationship building and brings that perfect combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table. No day is ever the same in retail banking. Whether it’s providing proactive client solutions, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. Indigenous activist. LGBTQ+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB we know that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to bring to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.

Position Overview

People leadership. Client experience. Business growth. Risk management. Brand ambassador.

The AVP Retail Manger For The Vancouver Island District Will Lead The Retail Teams In Victoria, Nanaimo & Courtenay Branches And Minimize Risk While Increasing Business And Delivering On Strategic Objectives Expansive Of
  • People: Recruit, mentor, coach, develop and engage successful employees – investing in & empowering our greatest strategic asset.
  • Clients: Deliver a proactive, personalized, & specialized client experience that is consistent and flawless across all channels and businesses.
  • Investors: Maximize effective use of resources, opportunities and capabilities for profitable balanced growth in all industries and segments.
Expected business results.
  • Facilitate market awareness and productive relationships within the local business and professional community.
  • Strong portfolio growth in retail deposits and lending products.
  • Strong, profitable growth in full-service client relationships, inclusive of corresponding levels of banking fee income and wealth management assets under management.
  • Sound risk management and operational practices demonstrated through solid credit performance and continuous compliance with parameters of CWB’s operational and regulatory risk appetite/policies/ procedures
Skills that will take you further
Leadership. Providing leadership and mentorship to retail management and staff in the development of the Bank’s deposit base, retail-lending portfolio, and mutual funds' portfolio. Establishing meaningful & sustainable relationships. Contribute & enhance team engagement; maintain & improve trust, comradery, credibility, pride & fairness. Connect & commit to the growth, development, mentorship & active coaching of your team

Sales & sales strategy development. Developing a strategy and implementing a marketing plan to achieve retail asset growth as per agreed targets. Driving retail sales activity through your own channels

Relationship builder. Building, growing and maintaining profitable, long lasting and genuine relationships with CWB clients with highly developed client facing and relationship development skills, with the ability to optimally articulate value.

Sales focused coaching. Honed passion in supporting and executing sales and mentorship initiatives.

Risk management. Analyzing, preparing, recommending and approving credit requests within discretionary limit, ensuring applications exhibit quality risk assessment and analysis as well as appropriate pricing.

Collaboration. Seamlessly interacting with Business Banking, Wealth and other internal partners to drive and improve business referrals across CWB.

Agility. Strong and highly flexible, solid interpersonal and communication skills, that allow one to work effectively in a diverse and dynamic environment.

Foundational Knowledge And Experience To Grow From

A post-secondary degree in a related field, 9+ years of banking experience inclusive of 5 years of proven sales mentoring and leadership. Mutual Funds license is required. Small Business or Commercial Banking Relationship Management exposure would be considered an asset.
Why work with us? People first benefits.
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Compressed work weeks & more!

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, this role has incentives on top of incentives!!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Software Development Engineer (Level 5)
item.content:encoded:
Description

If you are looking for an opportunity to solve deep technical problems and build innovative solutions in a fast paced environment working with smart, passionate software developers, this might be the role for you. Amazon’s transportation systems get millions of packages to customers worldwide faster and cheaper while providing world class customer experience – from checkout to shipment tracking to delivery. Our software systems include services that handle thousands or requests per second, make business decisions impacting billions of dollars a year, integrate with a network of small and large carriers worldwide, manage business rules for millions of unique products, and improve experience for millions of online shoppers. With rapid expansion into new geographies, innovations in supply chain, delivery models and customer experience, increasingly complex transportation network, ever expanding selection of products and growing number of shipments worldwide, we have an opportunity to build software that scales the business, leads the industry through innovation and delights millions of customers worldwide.
As an SDE, you will develop a deep understanding of our business, work closely with development teams and own the architecture and end-to-end delivery of software components.

Senior Engineers provide technical leadership at Amazon. They help establish technical standards and drive Amazon’s overall technical architecture, engineering practices, and methodologies. They work on our hard problems, building high quality, architecturally sound systems that are aligned with our business needs. They think globally when building systems, ensuring Amazon builds high performing, scalable systems that work well together. Senior engineers are pragmatic visionaries who can translate business needs into workable technology solutions. Their expertise is deep and broad. They are hands on, producing both detailed technical work and high-level architectural designs.


Basic Qualifications
  • 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Programming skills in , C++ or similar
Object oriented analysis and design skills (OOA/OOD).
Strong CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms)
BS/MS in Computer Science or in a related field
Deep knowledge of distributed systems, asynchronous architectures.


Preferred Qualifications

Experience building highly scalable, high availability services
Experience in real-time analytical systems and machine learning
Experience dealing with performance, memory and I/O

The ideal candidate will be a visionary leader, builder and operator. He/she should have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts and initiatives. He/she needs to balance technical leadership with strong business judgment to make the right decisions about technology choices. He/she needs to be constantly striving for simplicity, and at the same time demonstrate significant creativity, innovation and judgment.


Company - ADCI HYD 13 SEZ
Job ID: A1282672

item.title: Shipper
item.content:encoded:
NAPCO™ invites you to further your career and participate in the cutting edge of PVC pipe and fittings products. We are looking for enthusiastic people to join our team and continue our leadership in the PVC industry.

Wage

$19.82 per hour $0.50 shift premium

Shift

Afternoons

Job Requirements
  • Review shipping orders as distributed by shipping supervisor.
  • Process orders accordingly (i.e. picking orders)
  • Ensure that yard and warehouse are organized in a manner that maximizes efficiency, safety and customer order turnaround.
  • Put away all finished product from Fabrication and Assembly area (stock stored inside and outside) in the designated warehouse spaces.
  • Construct packaging i.e Skids/Gaylords
  • Inspect packaging.
  • Repack damaged products.
  • Apply labels as required (i.e. barcodes).
  • Keep work area clean (i.e. yard, bundle area)
  • Place scrap material in designated material bins (i.e. wood, strapping, cardboard)
  • Participate in the PVC Recovery program, ensure recycling of: broken pipe scrap pipe
  • Perform other duties as assigned by Senior Management.

Skills And Abilities Required
  • Lift truck certification.( Counterbalance, order picker and reach truck) required
  • Ability to read, write, understand and communicate effectively in English.
  • Ability to perform basic mathematical functions (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division).
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds/23 kilograms.

NAPCO™, a Westlake Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable legislation.

If you are an active Westlake Chemical employee (or an employee of any Westlake Chemical affiliates), please do not apply here. Please go to your Workday homepage and click on the "Careers" worklet and view "Westlake Career Opportunities".

category.nicename: North American Pipe Co, a Westlake Company

item.title: Construction Project Intern
item.content:encoded:
Overview

 Project Management Assistant – Level I TEMPORARY Internship Local Candidates only

Term: Position of a limited term, commencing on or about May 10, 2021 and ending on or about August 20, 2021. We can be flexible around your class schedule.

Reports To : Construction Manager and Superintendent

Responsibilities

This Project Management Assistant internship will provide you with hands-on experience and the opportunity to work on a world-class housing complex. You will provide on-site support to the Gilbane Development Company (GDCo) management team on the construction of “The York” student housing project (305 York Rd, Towson, MD 21204). You will provide support both through various administrative/documentation responsibilities as well as on-site verification of various project/occupancy-related tasks. Project a professional, ethical, business-friendly manner to other project team members and exhibit a positive attitude and spirit of teamwork and cooperation.
  • Assist in the development and updating of documents required to track the completion of construction, punch list and Owner acceptance of each individual space within the facility. An on-site tablet/laptop will be made available for this or any other such task which requires a tablet/laptop. This check list will identify not only punch list correction, but also verification that various building systems (i.e. plumbing, lighting, etc.) is operational in each individual space.
  • Assist in the development and updating of documents required to track the delivery, installation and punch list/Owner acceptance of furniture, fixtures & equipment (FF&E).
  • Verify the completion of all work and correction of construction punch list items for select assigned spaces. Training and guidance will be provided to the PM Assistant from the Construction Manager/ Development Manager regarding quality expectations and documentation requirements for this punch list process.
  • Assist GDCo team with the direct supervision of multiple FF&E vendors during the delivery and installation of various FF&E. During this process, collect/secure or otherwise track any items that will later be turned over to the property management team (i.e. television remote controls, equipment manuals, etc.).
  • Verify the installation of FF&E (in terms of quantity and specified items having been received) and develop a punch list for any FF&E discrepancies that require correction.
  • Verify the completion/correction of any identified FF&E punch list items.
  • Assist GDCo team with the receipt and placement of any incidental FF&E items which are being directly purchased by GDCo (i.e. waste receptacles, closet curtains, etc.)

    • Qualifications
    • Competence/experience in the use of Microsoft Word and Excel.
    • Excellent command of the English language, written and oral.
    • Strong interpersonal skills (while collaborating with a diverse group of individuals).
    • Willingness to assist in all areas of specific responsibilities as noted herein.
    • Superior attention to detail and organizational abilities.
    • Self-motivation and ability to work at times without direct supervision.
    • While not a requirement, those candidates who are able to work continuously during the period of May 10, 2021 to August 20, 2021 (in keeping with the typical work week described herein, without a need for extensive days off and/or unavailability due to interruption in candidate’s housing) may be considered as a stronger candidate.
    • While not a guarantee, the position offers some opportunity for a total of 40 hours within some weeks (which may be comprised of some evening/weekend hours as needed to accommodate the employer’s requirements which accommodating the PM assistant’s class schedule).
    • While the typical work hours fall within Monday – Friday from approximately 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., this may vary on a daily basis (and the overall work week may be a combination of weekdays/evenings and weekends).
    Anticipated Work Hours – The position requires some flexibility on the part of the PM Assistant as to specific work hours on a daily basis, including weekends. Should the position overlap with the candidate’s school year, Gilbane is willing to cooperate with the PM Assistant to develop a work schedule which fulfills the employer’s requirements, while accommodating the PM Assistant’s class schedule.

    Minimum Qualifications : A high school graduate and currently enrolled (or recently graduated) college student with experience through academic achievements, work experience or a combination thereof which demonstrates the ability to successfully perform the duties of this position.

    Work Environment : The work environment for this position will be 2 multi-story buildings still under construction. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to walk and or stand for extended periods of time and is required to frequently climb stairs throughout the work day. The position also requires occasional lifting and transporting of light to moderate objects. The project site is an OSHA complaint project and all team members are required to wear appropriate PPE. PPE equipment and supplies will be provided by the employer to the employee.

    Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

    Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Event Organizer
item.content:encoded:
JD FOR JOB POST


This is a collaboration model for project-based payments only, for highly independent individuals, ambitious in nature.


1.Must be willing to make a career and settle in event management and eager to learn and adapt.


2.Will be responsible for planning, organizing, managing, and coordinating weddings with a knack for event management negotiations.


3.Each one of them should have their own computers or laptop machines with good internet connectivity for effective work and communication purposes.


4.Should be able to give 3.33 hours on daily basis without fail for the next 45 days to ensure you would be maintaining TIMING + PUNCTUALITY + DEDICATION.


5.Looking for long-term goal-oriented people only for about 18 months at least, to work on our events in a similar format.


Note: Remuneration would be discussed only with the people who are making into the company only.

Send your resumes to-

subhamgupta.mangalyam@gmail.com

item.title: Talent Acquisition Advisor (6 month term)
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

And we need a proactive full-cycle recruiter to help make it happen.

We hire with intention. Do you?

If you are a practiced recruiter driven by collaboration, partnership, service and fundamental guiding principles read on, and reach out! We are a dispersed team working remotely and united by our love for recruitment. Due to growth and internal promotions, our 6 month transition plan needs an extra set of hands.

Recruiter. Talent Acquisition Advisor. Head Hunter. Sourcer. Scout. Talent Agent.

Whatever Your Title, The Calling Is In The Same.

You use a people first approach to support and facilitate talent acquisition strategy and processes. Primarily, you will act as a partner to recruiters & people leaders in attracting, sourcing, assessing and selecting, and acquiring top talent to meet the needs of the organizations’ strategic direction. This will include recruitment portfolio coordination & management, participating in virtual campus recruitment, diversity recruitment initiatives & CWB sponsorship activities.

You need to be, to have, to create, to demonstrate:

Passion for recruitment. Driving the end-to-end recruitment process including job postings process, strategic placement on external websites, participating in intake meetings, shortlisting qualified and diverse applications, conducting assessments and interviews, administers assessments, completing background checks and offer recommendations.

Relationship Focus. Establishing meaningful and sustainable relationships with employees and leaders, through collaboration on initiatives that promote the objectives and directives of the organization.

Candidate Centric. Creating and promoting a “candidate centric” recruitment experience, working to develop a pipeline of qualified and diverse applicants for strategic business requirements.

Active Networking & Interpersonal Skills. The ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels of the organization and with all external contacts. Facilitating partnerships with suitable educational institutions, staffing firms and specialty groups/associations and diverse community partners. Coordinating and participating in internal and external recruiting events for CWB!

Sales. Engaging conversationalist, story-teller, relationship builder, brand advocate. Connecting and engaging with others in-person, over the phone, via virtual connections and social media platforms.

Operational Efficiency. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, access to wifi & a phone to support remote work, solid organizational skills, ability to prioritize and effectively communicate with others.

Remote Team Player. Ability and willingness to work remotely both independently and collaboratively as part of a dispersed team.

Bring you. All of you. Feminist. First Nations band member. Gay rights activist. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.

All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love you to apply.

Closing Date
  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
02/11/2021 Inclusion &

Diversity
CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
Accessibility

CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Software Dev Engineer
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, Lab126 has produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, Amazon Echo, and Dash Button. The Fire OS team is a big part of creating these innovative devices at Lab126. The Fire OS team is responsible for the board bring up, low level software, operating system, core framework feature development, and end-to-end system functions, such as power/performance, that bring the devices to life. For many devices, the Fire OS team takes the open source Android distribution and productizes the software on Amazon hardware.
What will you help us create?

The Role

In the Device OS group, we are inventing the future for consumer electronics and are looking for a software engineer to help us bring the vision into reality and solve real world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. If you love to be hands on designing and implementing quality platform for our consumer electronic devices while working with a world class, highly accomplished team, we would love to talk with you.
As a Software Dev Engineer, you will lead the technical aspects of core Device customer experience and engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to design implement and bring to market innovative consumer products. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment.
As a Software Dev Engineer on Device OS team, you are expected to take part in the implementation of features across the framework, provide technical consultation across different organization, find innovative ways to solve customer needs and take up interesting technical problems that are unique to devices. You will work closely with Platform and application teams to ensure the highest level of quality for the Device OS deliverable.


Basic Qualifications
  • 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or related field
  • 5+ years of experience doing hands-on software development
  • Having strong communication and document writing skills
  • Understanding of embedded development constraints
  • Experience working on high-volume consumer products
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s degree preferred
  • Linux device driver and Linux Kernel experience

Company - ADCI - Tamil Nadu
Job ID: A1277998

item.title: Senior Project Executive
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Senior Project Executive is representative of the Company responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of simultaneous complex construction-management projects; as well as mentoring multiple Project Executives.

Responsibilities
  • Direct and supervise work of project administration, project superintendents, and engineers to establish operational priorities and maintain satisfactory relationships with owners, subcontractors, unions, etc.
  • Enforce project reporting requirements
  • Manage critical issues
  • Assume overall accountability for jobsite safety and quality
  • Mentor Project Executives
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 10-15 years in the lead role on projects valued at $150 million or larger
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong technical and communication skills are critical
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Leadership and management skills
  • Knowledge of Prolog, Microsoft Office (preferred)
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: VP Finance & Chief Accountant
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
CWB Financial Group is not your typical employer.
We are steadfast in proactively finding ways to help you succeed. By listening intently and asking the right questions, we uncover your dreams and goals and provide learning opportunities to put you in the driver's seat of your career. Most importantly, we’re here, because we genuinely care. You might even say that we’re obsessed with your success.™

At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

And we need a leader to make it happen.
Bring you. All of you. Feminist. Indigenous activist. LGBTQ+ champion. Sign language speaker. Labels don’t matter here, but your perspective does.
All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous peoples (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB, we know that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. Our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to bring to the conversation, we’d love for you to apply.
The opportunity
Leadership. Financial execution. Operational expertise.

Success of the Finance team will be evaluated against execution of foundational requirements; value-add nature of the solutions we provide; and effectiveness and value-add of the connections we sustain.

Primary responsibilities include providing leadership & continued development for CWB Financial Group’s (the Group) financial operations, accounting, accounting policy, internal controls over financial reporting, & corporate tax requirements. The role will take leadership responsibility for managing the finance related execution of key business & strategic projects, including the modernization of Finance’s systems, software, and key processes. The role requires an individual who has the acuity to influence across various levels of the organization, including the communication of significant developments that impact accounting & financial reporting for CWB leaders, & our Board of Directors. This role holds an active membership with several Committees of the Group & will engage with third party regulators (OSFI, CDIC, Bank of Canada) & external auditors as required.

Fundamental Knowledge & Experiences To Grow From

The incumbent holds a university degree in Accounting, Business, or Finance and is a designated Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) who actively demonstrates participation in continuing professional development.
  • Executive or senior level financial and/or accounting officer background with experience in publicly traded and complex service oriented organizations, including with corporate tax.
  • Experience implementing financial and accounting systems.
  • Previous banking or financial services experience is a definite asset.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and sound understanding of risk management
  • Knowledge of and experience in organizing employees around a dynamic strategy in an entrepreneurial environment.
Skills that will take you further
  • Leadership. A proven ability to provide strong leadership for the financial concerns of an organization similar to CWB required. A leadership style that is open, collaborative yet results-oriented, and respects the capabilities and independence of employees, while providing them with a clear sense of direction and supported by a strong focus on mentoring and motivating professional employees.
  • Critical thinking & strategy execution. Propensity to think strategically and plan effectively for an organization working in a diverse and sophisticated environment. Validated ability to lead and implement a technology improvement/accounting system replacement plan; adept at managing organizational change and seizing opportunities for growth.
  • Relationship building. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop positive relationships both externally and internally within a multifaceted organization while relating well to people of all backgrounds and at all levels.
  • Committed to inclusion. A deep commitment to promoting and supporting a diverse organization, and an emphasis on diversity in all operations.
  • Analytical & articulately balanced. Strong analytical capability and the adeptness to comprehend and articulate intricate business and regulatory situations.
  • Communication skills. Excellent written and oral communications skills and an ability to articulate the value of CWB to potential customers, shareholders, investors, communities and to the public at large.
  • Agility & equanimity. Proficient in processing a multitude of tasks simultaneously and to perform under pressure with a temperament that is constantly seeking new opportunities while thriving in a changing environment.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit. Possesses an innovative bent with well-honed business instincts.
Why work with us?
Winners of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference . Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements . Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Compressed work weeks & more.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities . Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Improve. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, or lead an employee-regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards . Yup. We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to put your money to work for you.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada
Find your purpose. Make your mark. Go further with CWB. Apply today.
CWB is proud to partner exclusively with Caldwell Partners on our search. All applications will be reviewed and assessed upon receipt - only individuals selected for interview will be contacted. All responses to Caldwell Partners are confidential. Please indicate your interest in Project 210136 caldwell.thriveapp.ly/job/954

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/28/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Superintendent II
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The Superintendent II supports the Project Manager, General Superintendent or Senior General Superintendent to ensure that company policies and procedures are followed in the field in regard to safety, scheduling, budget, quality and customer satisfaction. The Superintendent II may be the lead superintendent on small projects or be responsible for a specific area of a larger project.

Responsibilities
  • Supervise the work of trade contractors in several areas of a project
  • Enforce high safety standards including a clean job site
  • Manage and perform weekly safety inspections
  • Inspect the quality of work for compliance with design standard and ensure corrective action occurs if/when necessary
  • Work collaboratively on the schedule for individual trade contractors or areas of a project to ensure milestone dates are met
  • Coordinate and manage general conditions work and project logistics
  • Review vendor drawings and submittal
  • Review details with A/E and subcontractors to ensure work is in compliance with document plan
  • Review contractors Quality Plan
  • Prepare and distribute daily reports
  • Resolve jurisdictional disputes
  • Establish credibility among Owners, trade contractors, unions etc. by maintaining a fair and trustworthy environment
Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS or MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 2-5 years of experience on $5-15 million commercial/industrial construction projects in a superintendent role on construction projects
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong technical and communication skills
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to adapt to changing needs
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Prolog
  • Construction-document and drawing literate, with knowledge of all phases of construction
  • Experience and proficiency in all divisions of work, methods, materials, scheduling and cost control
  • OSHA 30 hour certified
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Software Developer
item.content:encoded:
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 18 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

Who You Are

You are a motivated Information Technology professional who is passionate about custom application development. You excel at software development and have experience with C#, .NET, SQL Server, and Azure development. You are a driven, logical, and innovative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can create custom applications from scratch.

What You'll Do
    • Modify software to test financial services applications & to identify errors & improve performance.
    • Analyze user needs & software requirements to determine feasibility of design & tests within time & cost constraint using knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, C#, .net framework, SQL, API Testing, JAVA script, Git, Gitlab, Azure & DevOps.
    • Confer with systems analysts, engineers, programmers & others to design test systems & to obtain information on project limitations & capabilities, performance requirements & interfaces.
    • Store, retrieve, & manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities & requirements using SQL.
    • Validate financial software systems using mathematical models to predict & measure outcome & consequences of design.
    • Work closely with development teams to ensure the effectiveness & quality of the components & systems developed using Agile methodologies.
    • Test for a range of projects from & enhancements to strategic initiatives.
    • Develop, maintain & execute test cases, ensuring the quality & stability of the system throughout the project using Selenium WebDriver.
    • Generate testing completion metrics & analysis, as well as status read-outs.
    • Develop, implement, maintain, & enhance test plans, test scripts, traceability matrices, & test methodologies that ensure exhaustive testing of all assigned financial software systems to ensure compliance with financial software/system specifications.
    • Create, maintain & modify test plans for new & existing financial software applications/releases that ensure comprehensive testing according to the software specifications.
    • Anticipate potential software problems by creating test scenarios.
    • Identify & analyze defects/test results & be able to deduct the chain of events leading to a failure.
    • Recommend & implement event tracking &/or defect management tools using Azure & Jira.
    • Test projects in accordance with written business & functional design documentation following established standards.
    • Coordinate the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with the Business Owners & their UAT-responsible personnel.

What You'll Need
    • REQUIREMENTS: Must have Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or foreign equivalent plus two years of experience in the job duties.
    • SALARY: $115,000
    • HOURS: 40 hours per week (Monday-Friday, 9:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.)
    • CONTACT PERSON: Apply within - Interested applicants contact Gaby Serrano, Bankers Healthcare Group LLC, 10234 W. State Road 84, Davie, FL, 33324. Telephone 800-990-8401 ext. 2397

Life at BHG

At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG

Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include

We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified.

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program

    • If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

    Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Bankers Healthcare Group is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

item.title: Sr Credit Analyst
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Work from any CWB Office or Branch Location in CanadaCWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

Our Commercial team includes a diverse group of banking professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated commercial bankers knows the value of relationship building and brings that perfect combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table. No day is ever the same in commercial banking. Whether it’s providing proactive client solutions, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.

Opportunity Overview

The Senior Credit Analyst, utilizes advanced skills in credit writing, financial statement analysis, loan structuring, risk management and communications to provide exceptional service and responsiveness within business line functions of credit underwriting, loan applications and recurring credit review.

The underwriting focus of the Senior Credit Analyst is primarily directed toward more complex and higher value credits that require in-depth knowledge and experience to appropriately assess and mitigate all attributes of risk in alignment with CWB’s defined risk appetite. This position provides direct functional mentorship and guidance to newer credit analysts, as well as support for effective risk-based loan pricing and profitability management as required.

What Your Day Will Look Like
  • Credit Underwriting. As a skilled credit underwriter, you will: process applications, analyze, collaborate, write, structure, recommend and approve terms and conditions of credit within related delegated limits. Review, report, defer,
  • Risk management. You will utilize your risk management skills to ensure appropriate measures are put into place and risk assessment protocols and structures are implemented, while balancing risk and reward in line with CWB’s risk appetite. You will be responsible for ensuring data integrity and portfolio quality.
  • Creative problem solving. Acting as a go-to resource to provide solutions & functional support with complex credit applications or when faced with negative results or performance trends
  • Coaching. You are a great teammate and love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality. You become a trusted partner and coach to those on your team that need and crave feedback and support. You will assist in elevating their growth & development.
  • Partnership development. As a key resource for many business divisions, you will create relationships with different CWB groups.
Who you are & what you bring
Credit knowledge. Mentor. Collaborator. Financial savvy. Coach. Compliance strategist. Trusted partner.
Knowledgeable. In all things banking, lending, collateral security, leasing documentation requirements & equipment financing.

Client focused. You have the right tools implement stewardship strategies and provide advice to exceed client expectations while maintaining positive relationships.

Excellent communicator. You are confident in your written, verbal and presentation skills. You take pride in your ability to influence and negotiate win-wins.

A strategic planner. You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and a great one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allows you effectively multitask and meet deadlines.

Think big and beyond. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems. You have a knack for strategy and solutions.

Technologically proficient. You are adept at learning new software that you will use on a day-to-day basis.

Foundational Knowledge & Experience

A Bachelors Degree in business or related discipline and a have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in banking or business lending inclusive of 3 years credit adjudication. You already have or are working towards an accounting or financial designation. You have a real passion for credit structuring, credit underwriting and risk management that runs through your veins. Your hard work ethic, in-depth financial knowledge and decision making skills are the main attributes to your success and it’s your competitive advantage to rise above that makes you stand out amongst your colleagues.

Why work for us? Benefits to benefit you.

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, this role has incentives on top of incentives!!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/13/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWork from any CWB Office or Branch Location in Canada\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EAt CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put\u003Cstrong\u003E people first\u003C/strong\u003E and \u003Cstrong\u003Ebuild relationships\u003C/strong\u003E with intention. We seek out and \u003Cstrong\u003Eembrace new ideas,\u003C/strong\u003E knowing that better is always possible. We believe that \u003Cstrong\u003Ehow we do things\u003C/strong\u003E is as important as what we do. And we harness the \u003Cstrong\u003Epower of inclusion\u003C/strong\u003E. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EOur Commercial team includes a diverse group of banking professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated \u003Cstrong\u003Ecommercial bankers\u003C/strong\u003E knows the value of \u003Cstrong\u003Erelationship building \u003C/strong\u003Eand brings that perfect combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table. No day is ever the same in commercial banking. Whether it’s providing \u003Cstrong\u003Eproactive client solutions\u003C/strong\u003E, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EOpportunity Overview\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EThe \u003Cstrong\u003ESenior Credit Analyst, \u003C/strong\u003Eutilizes advanced skills in credit writing, financial statement analysis, loan structuring, risk management and communications to provide exceptional service and responsiveness within business line functions of credit underwriting, loan applications and recurring credit review.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EThe \u003Cstrong\u003Eunderwriting focus\u003C/strong\u003E of the Senior Credit Analyst is primarily directed toward more \u003Cstrong\u003Ecomplex and higher value credits\u003C/strong\u003E that require in-depth knowledge and experience to appropriately assess and mitigate all attributes of risk in alignment with CWB’s defined risk appetite. This position provides direct functional mentorship and guidance to newer credit analysts, as well as support for effective risk-based loan pricing and profitability management as required.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EWhat Your Day Will Look Like\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECredit Underwriting. As a skilled credit underwriter, you will: process applications, analyze, collaborate, write, structure, recommend and approve terms and conditions of credit within related delegated limits. Review, report, defer,\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ERisk management. You will utilize your risk management skills to ensure appropriate measures are put into place and risk assessment protocols and structures are implemented, while balancing risk and reward in line with CWB’s risk appetite. You will be responsible for ensuring data integrity and portfolio quality.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECreative problem solving. Acting as a go-to resource to provide solutions & functional support with complex credit applications or when faced with negative results or performance trends\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECoaching. You are a great teammate and love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality. You become a trusted partner and coach to those on your team that need and crave feedback and support. You will assist in elevating their growth & development.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPartnership development. As a key resource for many business divisions, you will create relationships with different CWB groups.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho you are & what you bring\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECredit knowledge. Mentor. Collaborator. Financial savvy. Coach. Compliance strategist. Trusted partner.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EKnowledgeable.\u003C/strong\u003E In all things banking, lending, collateral security, leasing documentation requirements & equipment financing.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EClient focused.\u003C/strong\u003E You have the right tools implement stewardship strategies and provide advice to exceed client expectations while maintaining positive relationships.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EExcellent communicator\u003C/strong\u003E. You are confident in your written, verbal and presentation skills. You take pride in your ability to influence and negotiate win-wins.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EA strategic planner.\u003C/strong\u003E You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and a great one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allows you effectively multitask and meet deadlines.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThink big and beyond\u003C/strong\u003E. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems. You have a knack for strategy and solutions.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ETechnologically proficient.\u003C/strong\u003E You are adept at learning new software that you will use on a day-to-day basis.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EFoundational Knowledge & Experience\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003EA Bachelors Degree in business or related discipline and a have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in banking or business lending inclusive of 3 years credit adjudication. You already have or are working towards an accounting or financial designation. You have a real passion for credit structuring, credit underwriting and risk management that runs through your veins. Your hard work ethic, in-depth financial knowledge and decision making skills are the main attributes to your success and it’s your competitive advantage to rise above that makes you stand out amongst your colleagues.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhy work for us? Benefits to benefit you.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EYour voice matters.\u003C/strong\u003E Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe opportunity to make a difference\u003C/strong\u003E. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFlexible work arrangements\u003C/strong\u003E. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPhysical health and mental fitness \u003Cem\u003Eare \u003C/em\u003Epriorities\u003C/strong\u003E. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECommunity giving. \u003C/strong\u003EDrive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBring your whole self to work. \u003C/strong\u003EInclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EInnovation. \u003C/strong\u003ELearn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EConnection. \u003C/strong\u003EJoin, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EOrganization wide coaching services\u003C/strong\u003E. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ERecognition. \u003C/strong\u003EPeer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFinancial rewards\u003C/strong\u003E. Yup! We pay you too. Base \u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cem\u003Eplus \u003C/em\u003E\u003C/strong\u003Eperformance incentives. In fact, this role has \u003Cstrong\u003Eincentives on top of incentives!!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ERetirement investment strategy. \u003C/strong\u003EYou can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECompany ownership.\u003C/strong\u003E The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGreat Places To Work. \u003C/strong\u003ECWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECanada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020 \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiscover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EClosing Date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cli\u003E P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E02/13/2021\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Inclusion & \u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiversity\u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. item.title: Process Assistant
item.content:encoded:
Key Job Elements

DESCRIPTION
  • Support and work in the department as required
  • Helping support daily management of department duties, including allocating labor, leading meetings, assigning job duties, and communicating with internal and external suppliers
  • Providing vacation coverage for Area Managers
  • Providing policy follow-up, attendance tracking (duties do not extend to discipline)
  • Tracking and reporting of ATS/labor hours
  • Assisting the floor as an associate resource, training associates and verifying SOP compliance
  • Ensuring successful area performance, through tracking, reporting and feedback of associate performance
  • Participating in Operational Excellence initiatives in some capacity
  • Filling in as needed with production duties
  • Fully understanding workflow and daily production goals
  • Reviewing and updating SOP as required
  • Assisting in keeping work area clean and organized
  • Identifying and addressing safety hazards within the work area
  • Coaching associates to work safely at all times
  • Participating in safety initiatives
  • Referring all job injuries immediately to area manager

Basic Qualifications
  • A high school diploma or equivalent
  • Are at least 18 years old, and authorized to work in the United States
  • Able to work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
  • Able to lift up to 49 pounds, stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours, and be able to frequently push, pull, squat, bend and reach, all with or without reasonable accommodation
  • 2+ years of work experience or a completed Associate’s Degree
  • 1+ year of experience working with computers and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)
Preferred Qualifications
  • 1+ year of leadership experience directly managing others
  • 1+ year working in a like environment (manufacturing/distribution/warehousing/large retail)
  • Experience with performance metrics and lean process improvemen
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills to coach, train and assist team members

Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon M
Job ID: A1241745
