item.title: Mortgage Underwriter (Alt-A)
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

The primary focus of the Mortgage Underwriter is to adjudicate broker originated ALT-A credit applications. The successful candidate will weigh risks using established criteria and current legislation guidelines while operating in a fast paced, sales-focused and customer service oriented environment.

Who You Are
  • Underwriting . Provide strong credit decisions on sophisticated mortgage applications.
  • Sales Oriented . Establishing parameters for loans, pricing, terms and conditions when underwriting mortgage loans.
  • Risk Appetite . Maintain strong risk appetite while adhering to CWBFG policies.
  • Compliance . Ability to analyze and evaluate supporting documentation provided by clients and brokers while adhering to industry compliance obligations including Privacy, Anti-Money Laundering/Anti-Terrorist financing, Internal Fraud Policies and KYC.
  • Creative Solutions . Go beyond and think outside of the box to find a flexible solution for clients.
  • Mentor . Provide mentorship to support to Mortgage Document Officers.
Factors Impacting Results
 Collaborator. Technologically savvy. Team builder. Outstanding Communicator. Respected negotiator.
  • Post secondary degree in commerce, finance or business fields
  • At least two years of Alt A & B underwriting experience
  • AMP Mortgage industry accreditations program an asset.
  • Understanding of Insurer (CMHC and Genworth) guidelines an asset
  • Solid computer savvy and application skills (Word, Excel etc.)
  • Outstanding and effective communication skills. Proven communication via email and telephone.
  • Proven ability to thrive within a sophisticated and diverse organizational environment - balancing multiple tasks simultaneously with patience and humour, under pressure.
  • Ability to provide timely and efficient turnaround time with a strong attention to detail, ensuring brokers are receiving same day service.
Why work for us?

Benefits To Benefit You.

 Your voice matters . Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Establish a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous Time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving . Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work . Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation . Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection . Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services . Strategic coaching is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition . Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, This role has incentives on top of incentives.

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so We have an RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

#discoverCWB

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/15/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EThe primary focus of the Mortgage Underwriter is to adjudicate broker originated ALT-A credit applications. The successful candidate will weigh risks using established criteria and current legislation guidelines while operating in a fast paced, sales-focused and customer service oriented environment.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EWho You Are\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Underwriting \u003C/strong\u003E . Provide strong credit decisions on sophisticated mortgage applications. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Sales Oriented \u003C/strong\u003E . Establishing parameters for loans, pricing, terms and conditions when underwriting mortgage loans. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Risk Appetite \u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E . \u003C/strong\u003E Maintain strong risk appetite while adhering to CWBFG policies. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Compliance \u003C/strong\u003E . Ability to analyze and evaluate supporting documentation provided by clients and brokers while adhering to industry compliance obligations including Privacy, Anti-Money Laundering/Anti-Terrorist financing, Internal Fraud Policies and KYC. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Creative Solutions \u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E . \u003C/strong\u003E Go beyond and think outside of the box to find a flexible solution for clients. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Mentor \u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E . \u003C/strong\u003E Provide mentorship to support to Mortgage Document Officers. \u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFactors Impacting Results\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Collaborator. Technologically savvy. Team builder. Outstanding Communicator. Respected negotiator. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Post secondary degree in commerce, finance or business fields \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E At least two years of Alt A & B underwriting experience \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E AMP Mortgage industry accreditations program an asset. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Understanding of Insurer (CMHC and Genworth) guidelines an asset \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Solid computer savvy and application skills (Word, Excel etc.) \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Outstanding and effective communication skills. Proven communication via email and telephone. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Proven ability to thrive within a sophisticated and diverse organizational environment - balancing multiple tasks simultaneously with patience and humour, under pressure. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Ability to provide timely and efficient turnaround time with a strong attention to detail, ensuring brokers are receiving same day service. \u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhy work for us?\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EBenefits To Benefit You.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Your voice matters \u003C/strong\u003E . Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E The opportunity to make a difference. \u003C/strong\u003E Establish a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Flexible work arrangements. \u003C/strong\u003E Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPhysical health and mental fitness are priorities\u003C/strong\u003E. Generous Time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Community giving \u003C/strong\u003E . Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Bring your whole self to work \u003C/strong\u003E . Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Innovation \u003C/strong\u003E . Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB, we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Connection \u003C/strong\u003E . Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Organization wide coaching services \u003C/strong\u003E . Strategic coaching is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Recognition \u003C/strong\u003E . Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Financial rewards. \u003C/strong\u003E Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, This role has incentives on top of incentives.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Retirement investment strategy. \u003C/strong\u003E You can’t work forever, so We have an RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Company ownership. \u003C/strong\u003E The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E#discoverCWB\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EClosing Date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cli\u003E P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E02/15/2021\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E Inclusion & \u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiversity\u003C/strong\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EWe're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAccessibility\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/strong\u003ECWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Associate","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Canadian Western Bank","sameAs":"https://ca.linkedin.com/company/canadian-western-bank","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE06Sg0zJHr_Q/company-logo_200_200/0/1594241574876?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=HDD6Iwv8gKUznw1qDrT7_FJnMn8c08uUVErctxIcBhM"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Canadian Western Bank","value":"R2984"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE06Sg0zJHr_Q/company-logo_100_100/0/1594241574876?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=Pu3QSyBOxtlubfCL5_yGc4rkYeXKGkyIltbnADzKlkE","industry":"Banking,Financial Services,Commercial Real Estate","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Edmonton","addressRegion":"AB","postalCode":"T5J2C1","addressCountry":"CA"}},"skills":"","title":"Mortgage Underwriter (Alt-A)","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:42.000Z","baseSalary":{"@type":"MonetaryAmount","currency":"CAD","value":{"@type":"QuantitativeValue","minValue":43200,"maxValue":92300,"unitText":"YEAR"}}}</script>

item.title: Data Analist
item.content:encoded:
Stel je eens voor…

dat jij het datagedreven werken binnen Sales & Customer Services (S&CS) en haar partners radicaal verbetert en daarmee een boost geeft aan onze resultaten. Met de relevante fact based inzichten kunnen we de klantwaarde verder helpen verhogen, onze omnichannel klantreizen nog doelgerichter inrichten, kanaalsturing (vooral naar online) optimaliseren en business case driven projecten en programma’s verbeteren. Ook zal er betere besluitvorming plaatsvinden waardoor kosten dalen en sales, kwaliteit en klanttevredenheid stijgen.

Als Data Analist maak je het verschil door de impact van klantreizen op de kanalen van S&CS samen met de tribes en Data & Analytics inzichtelijk te maken. Tevens maak je de datakwaliteit meetbaar, valideer je deze en zorg je voor verbetering, zodat processen beheersbaar gemaakt worden. Kortom, als datagedreven analist, die proactief meedenkt om business resultaten te verbeteren, voel je je in deze functie als een vis in het water!

Impact creëren

  • Gevraagd en ongevraagd analyses uitvoeren, vertalen van inzicht naar handelingsperspectief voor S&CS en/of partners
  • Inzichtelijk maken van effecten van omnichannel klantreizen op resultaten van S&CS en daarbij het identificeren van verbanden, oorzaken en mogelijke verbeteringen;
  • Analyseren en duiden van (de ontwikkeling van) de KPI’s van S&CS en de business partijen met een raakvlak met S&CS, waarmee kan worden teruggekeken, gestuurd en verbeterd;
  • Expliciet maken van de meet- en volgbaarheid van klantreizen over kanalen heen;
  • Leveren van inhoudelijke en analytische expertise om ontwikkelingen op commercie, klantbeleving en kosten binnen S&CS te meten, te testen, te analyseren en te verklaren;
  • Valideren en inzichtelijk maken van beschikbare data en toepassen van de juiste analysemethode om de stuur- en informatiebehoefte te kunnen opleveren;
  • Zorgdragen voor een correcte interpretatie van factbased inzichten in de besluitvormingsprocessen om S&CS en haar partners in staat te stellen (pro)actief te acteren;
  • Adviseren over inrichten van business cases en benefit tracking;
  • Meetbaar maken en valideren van datakwaliteit, waarbij je de ontwikkeling van KPI’s voor datakwaliteit onderbouwt en adviseert over verbetering hiervan;
  • Ontwikkelen en continu verbeteren van de instrumenten voor en informatievoorziening over datakwaliteit;
  • Ondersteunen in ontwikkeling van generieke informatieproducten (waaronder selfservice omgevingen) vanuit je unieke domeinexpertise binnen S&CS m.b.t. de relatie tussen besturing - processen - systemen - data.

Met elkaar
Samenwerken is de manier waarop we werken. Als onderdeel van S&CS vervult Data Interpretation and Translation (DI&T) een brugfunctie als domeinexpert en neemt een leidende rol in het gebruik van data van en voor S&CS. DI&T is hierbij verantwoordelijk voor:

Vertalen van vraag naar businessdata, rapporten en analyse in requirements; Verschaffen van inzicht in Sales, Digital Convenience en Bereikbaarheid, signaleren van knelpunten en voorleggen van verbeteringen; Monitoren, bijsturen en prioriteren richting tribes.

Het team DI&T bundelt de krachten om proactief sturingsdata, rapportages en analyses te leveren waarmee de business, bestaande uit S&CS en haar partners zoals de product tribes, de klantwaarde verder kan verhogen, zowel aan de opbrengsten- als aan de kostenkant. Dit doen we in nauwe samenwerking met Data & Analytics. De afdeling Data Interpretation & Translation bestaat uit 6 collega’s.

Met jouw talenten

Dat factbased werken, onafhankelijk en onderbouwd oordelen, sterk analytisch en conceptueel vermogen en outside-in denken onmisbaar zijn voor de functie Data Analist is logisch.

Daarbij is het belangrijk dat je alles op onderstaande checklist herkent:

  • Een HBO/WO studie achtergrond;
  • Ervaring met het organiseren van business analyses en het monitoren (terug- en vooruitkijken);
  • Ervaring met het omzetten van data requirements naar factbased en actionable inzichten;
  • Ervaring met meetbaarheid en verbetering van datakwaliteit;
  • Kennis van en aantoonbare ervaring met tooling als SQL en Power BI;
  • Bekend met concepten als process mining, text mining en speech analytics;
  • Kunnen toepassen van de eisen rondom data privacy;
  • Benaderbaar en verbindend;
  • Hands-on;
  • Verantwoordelijk en daadkrachtig.

Wil jij dit ook?
De beste versie van jezelf worden? Wij helpen je er graag bij door jouw ontwikkeling centraal te stellen en te investeren in een omgeving waarin je blijft leren. We geven je de ruimte om te innoveren en ondernemen. Zo bieden we je volop groeikansen en helpen je verwachtingen te overtreffen en het goede buitengewoon goed te doen, zodat je kan groeien als professional.

Daarbovenop kan je bij ons (o.b.v. een 36-urige werkweek) ook rekenen op:

  • een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 3.720,- en € 5.300,-;
  • een dertiende maand en vakantiegeld;
  • een Employee Benefit Budget (10% van je maandinkomen). Hoe jij dit budget inzet, is aan jou. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het kopen van extra vakantiedagen, een extra storting in je pensioen of zelfs het maandelijks laten uitbetalen van dit budget;
  • een persoonlijk budget, dat je kunt besteden aan activiteiten gericht op jouw ontwikkeling en loopbaan;
  • flexibiliteit in werktijden en locatieonafhankelijk werken;
  • een pensioenregeling waar je zelf maar 3,5% aan bijdraagt.

Laten we kennismaken
Ben jij hem/haar? Onze nieuwe collega die onze afdeling wil versterken als Data Analist? En zo het verschil wil maken voor jezelf, onze klanten én de maatschappij? We ontvangen graag jouw sollicitatie op deze vacature in Utrecht.

Let op: vanwege de restricties in verband met Covid-19, zullen alle gesprekken virtueel (via Teams) plaatsvinden.

Handig om te weten:

  • Solliciteren kan tot en met 19 februari 2021. Reageer via de “Solliciteer nu” button.
  • Als je vragen hebt over de inhoud van de vacature, kan je die stellen aan Joris Beckers, Lead Data Interpretation & Translation, via joris.beckers@rabobank.nl.
  • Laura Dijkerman, Recruiter, beantwoordt met plezier vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure via laura.dijkerman@rabobank.nl.
  • Voor deze vacature kan een individueel assessment deel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure.
  • Jouw privacy is belangrijk voor ons. Mocht je hier meer over willen weten, klik dan op deze link.
  • Iedereen is anders, en juist de verschillen in mensen helpen ons om een nog betere bank te zijn. Daarom zijn we zijn benieuwd naar wie jíj bent!

Reageer via de “Solliciteer nu” button.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAls je vragen hebt over de inhoud van de vacature, kan je die stellen aan Joris Beckers, Lead Data Interpretation & Translation, via joris.beckers@rabobank.nl.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ELaura Dijkerman, Recruiter, beantwoordt met plezier vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure via laura.dijkerman@rabobank.nl.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EVoor deze vacature kan een individueel assessment deel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EJouw privacy is belangrijk voor ons. Mocht je hier meer over willen weten, klik dan op deze link. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EIedereen is anders, en juist de verschillen in mensen helpen ons om een nog betere bank te zijn. Daarom zijn we zijn benieuwd naar wie jíj bent!\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","experienceRequirements":"Niet van toepassing","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Rabobank","sameAs":"https://nl.linkedin.com/company/rabobank","logo":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH2kxVJT-AFXw/company-logo_200_200/0/1519855859284?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=y4OLBf0AVlNdRJFIQkUdVbGX2DZryCml6QwKHcUI90M"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"Rabobank","value":"JR_00038548"},"image":"https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH2kxVJT-AFXw/company-logo_100_100/0/1519855859284?e=1620864000&v=beta&t=ir4_cTyAsvEcLYIFAR3lPs8vCtKGnunBMyv3zkixe30","industry":"Bankwezen","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","streetAddress":null,"addressLocality":"Binnenstad","addressRegion":null,"postalCode":"3512","addressCountry":"NL"}},"skills":"","title":"Data Analist","validThrough":"2021-03-08T05:57:25.000Z"}</script>

item.title: General Superintendent
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Gilbane is seeking a General Superintendent with experience building corrections facilities to lead the build of a large facility in Columbus. The General Superintendent is responsible for the overall field on this large project, leading a team of superintendents to ensure that company policies and procedures are met in regard to safety, scheduling, budget, quality and customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities
  • Ensure that the day-to-day coordination of Gilbane’s trade contractors and their sub-contractors turn out high-quality work that meets the approved project schedule
  • Manage the project budget for general conditions and site services
  • Develop, document and communicate the work plan regarding changes made in the field
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of contract documents to be able to plan ahead and anticipate potential problems before they arise
  • Obtain or verify that the subcontractors obtain all necessary permits for construction purposes
  • Verify safety compliance with all trades; act as primary safety representative in the field and enforce quality control policies
  • Conduct maintenance and planning of “work-arounds,” shutdowns and tie-ins
  • Establish credibility among owners, trade contractors, unions etc. by maintaining a fair and trustworthy environment
  • Lead contractor meetings on a regular basis
  • Oversee daily reports and documentation using iBuild
  • Create, manage and update the project schedule, create and implement contingency plans when necessary
  • Communicate schedule status, updates and changes to Project Team and Trade Contractors
  • Plan, coordinate and manage jobsite logistics
  • Oversee project quality plan and implement necessary changes
  • Resolve jurisdictional disputes
  • Aid in the development of project team

Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS or MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
  • Corrections faciltiy building experience
  • 10-15 years experience on a $15-50+ million commercial/industrial construction project or multiple projects in a superintendent role
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Strong technical and communication skills
  • Excellent organizational and problem solving skills and ability to adapt to changing needs
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Procore
  • Must be construction-document and drawing literate, with knowledge of all phases of construction
  • Must have experience and proficiency in all divisions of work, methods, materials, scheduling, and cost control
  • Must have strong knowledge and appreciation of construction safety processes and ability to enforce the project safety plan
  • Must be able to create an environment where “safety first” is the culture and all trades people work with an incident and injury free attitude
  • Must have experience supervising a project team
  • OSHA 30 hour certified
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Support Engineer IV
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon Go is a store with no lines and no checkout—you just grab and go! Customers use the Amazon Go app to enter the store, take what they want from our selection of fresh, delicious meals and grocery essentials, and go! Check it out at amazon.com/go.

Our approach to problems is entrepreneurial. You will be challenged to invent, create and solve challenging problems as well as wear many hats and collaborate in an environment that’s more startup than big company. You will need a strong ability to troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues.

As a Support Engineer, you seek resolution to problems and mitigate risk, always ensuring a Customer Obsessed experience has occurred. You will be working on services with a direct impact on the customer experience. If you are excited about the opportunity to learn and work on distributed systems, enjoy trouble shooting and solving complex problems, consider the opportunities to work with Amazon Go.

You will help solve a variety of challenges and offer your expertise in growing the knowledge of your peers via team collaboration. We consistently whiteboard so be comfortable writing and supporting your ideas on the team board. You will play an active role in defining the support processes for technologies in partnership with other technology leaders within and possibly outside the team. You should be comfortable with a level of ambiguity that’s higher than most projects and relish the idea of solving big challenges. You will also mentor other engineers in your area of expertise. Along the way, we guarantee that you’ll work hard, have fun and impact many customers!

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Basic Qualifications
  • BS/MS in Computer Science/Engineering or related disciplines
  • 5 to 8 years of experience in development/network systems/infrastructure/Production Support
  • Knowledge of the UNIX/Linux operating system
  • Scripting knowledge in one or more of Shell, Ruby, Perl, Python
  • Strong debugging/troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills
  • Strong understanding of support processes – handling tickets, monitoring, processes and metrics
  • Ability to solve complex problems independently.
  • Strong as an individual contributor creating and managing standard operating procedures and internal processes
Preferred Qualifications
  • Hands on experience with distributed and/or enterprise applications
  • Proven track record of service improvement and optimization in production
  • Exposure to processes improvement techniques. Operational Excellence is definitely an added advantage
  • Experience with any programming languages
  • Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills for technical and business audiences.

    • Company - ADCI - Karnataka
    Job ID: A1279028

item.title: Senior Manager of Business Development
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Gilbane is seeking a results-driven and highly motivated Senior Business Development Manager to join our team . This person is the representative of the Company responsible for contacting, meeting and establishing new business relationships in various markets for the purpose of securing profitable relationships.

Responsibilities

Who are we?

As a Top-10 ENR Contractor, Gilbane is a family-owned business with 45 offices that has been shaping communities since 1870. Consistently ranked as one of the top builders in the state, the Chicago business unit is the standard for team excellence and quality projects. With a focus in corporate, pharmaceutical/life sciences, and industrial projects, this person will have a wide range of market sectors to represent.

What’s in it for you?

As a Business Development representative, you will have endless opportunity to generate business and assist in winning projects for the team. Gilbane offers employees multi-dimensional training opportunities through a number of resources for all employees. While managing your responsibilities to build business, you will be able to enroll in trainings through our award-winning Gilbane University to build leadership and technical skills. In addition, you will work under the direction of our Vice President and Senior Director of Business Development which provides you with opportunity to learn our history and ways to succeed in this role. You will protect and promote the interests of both Gilbane and the client in all matters as well as demonstrating the personal characteristics of a developing leader. Working with Gilbane’s core values at the forefront of your mind (Integrity, Teamwork, Toughmindedness, Dedication to Excellence, Discipline, Loyalty, Caring, Entrepreneurship), you will have endless opportunity to advance your career internally.

Typical Duties/Responsibilities
  • Consistently manage prospective clients and prospects in various stages of the sales process
  • Report on planned and executed sales activities to appropriate levels of management
  • Generate a specified volume of business within an established time frame
  • Keep management apprised of current and anticipated market conditions
  • Build and maintain a strong network
  • Maintain memberships and participate in organizations and events
  • Maintain ongoing client relationships after project start-up
  • Consistently manage a full spectrum of clients and prospects in various stages of development
  • Develop targeted new clients in pre-prospect stage
  • Develop and execute effective capture strategies for focus prospects
  • Engage operations personnel and subject matter experts in sales process early and often
  • Develop understanding of issues affecting target markets
  • Engage in articulate dialogue with client on issues pertinent to their market geography and/or sector
  • Target client and prospect development in those portions of the market where Gilbane is well-positioned
  • Travel within the business unit and occasionally outside the business unit

Qualifications

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
  • BS or MS in Engineering, Architecture, Business or Marketing preferred
  • 10-15 years of business development and or operations experience within the construction industry, preferably in the metro centric Chicagoland geography and corporate, pharmaceutical/life sciences, and industrial market
  • Candidate must possess excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to produce highly professional proposals and presentations.
  • Maintain professional memberships and participate in local or industry organizations and events.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to produce highly professional proposals and presentations
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to changing needs
  • Experience working collaboratively with operations personnel in a team environment
Gilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.

Gilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability status.

\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EQualifications\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EEXPERIENCE/EDUCATION\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E BS or MS in Engineering, Architecture, Business or Marketing preferred \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E 10-15 years of business development and or operations experience within the construction industry, preferably in the metro centric Chicagoland geography and corporate, pharmaceutical/life sciences, and industrial market \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Candidate must possess excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to produce highly professional proposals and presentations. \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Maintain professional memberships and participate in local or industry organizations and events. \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EKnowledge, Skills, & Abilities\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Strong verbal and written communication skills \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Ability to produce highly professional proposals and presentations \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Excellent organizational skills \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to changing needs \u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E Experience working collaboratively with operations personnel in a team environment \u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003EGilbane offers an excellent total compensation package which includes competitive health and welfare benefits and a generous profit-sharing/401k plan. We invest in our employees’ education and have built Gilbane University into a top training organization in the construction industry. Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test. Gilbane is not accepting unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters at this time.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EGilbane is an Equal Opportunity Employer. item.title: Sr Credit Analyst
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Work from any CWB Office or Branch Location in CanadaCWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank.
At CWB, we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up – as individuals and as a team – to accomplish our strategy.

Our Commercial team includes a diverse group of banking professionals who strive every single day to achieve strong results for the bank and their clients. Our team of designated commercial bankers knows the value of relationship building and brings that perfect combination of stellar stewardship, client support and financial expertise to the table. No day is ever the same in commercial banking. Whether it’s providing proactive client solutions, stellar service support, consultation sessions or financial advice, we’re there every step of the way for our clients to ensure they reach their personal and business dreams. It’s this top service that we are known for.

Opportunity Overview

The Senior Credit Analyst, utilizes advanced skills in credit writing, financial statement analysis, loan structuring, risk management and communications to provide exceptional service and responsiveness within business line functions of credit underwriting, loan applications and recurring credit review.

The underwriting focus of the Senior Credit Analyst is primarily directed toward more complex and higher value credits that require in-depth knowledge and experience to appropriately assess and mitigate all attributes of risk in alignment with CWB’s defined risk appetite. This position provides direct functional mentorship and guidance to newer credit analysts, as well as support for effective risk-based loan pricing and profitability management as required.

What Your Day Will Look Like
  • Credit Underwriting. As a skilled credit underwriter, you will: process applications, analyze, collaborate, write, structure, recommend and approve terms and conditions of credit within related delegated limits. Review, report, defer,
  • Risk management. You will utilize your risk management skills to ensure appropriate measures are put into place and risk assessment protocols and structures are implemented, while balancing risk and reward in line with CWB’s risk appetite. You will be responsible for ensuring data integrity and portfolio quality.
  • Creative problem solving. Acting as a go-to resource to provide solutions & functional support with complex credit applications or when faced with negative results or performance trends
  • Coaching. You are a great teammate and love to work collaboratively. You see the value in working together and have achieved many professional wins because of this mentality. You become a trusted partner and coach to those on your team that need and crave feedback and support. You will assist in elevating their growth & development.
  • Partnership development. As a key resource for many business divisions, you will create relationships with different CWB groups.
Who you are & what you bring
Credit knowledge. Mentor. Collaborator. Financial savvy. Coach. Compliance strategist. Trusted partner.
Knowledgeable. In all things banking, lending, collateral security, leasing documentation requirements & equipment financing.

Client focused. You have the right tools implement stewardship strategies and provide advice to exceed client expectations while maintaining positive relationships.

Excellent communicator. You are confident in your written, verbal and presentation skills. You take pride in your ability to influence and negotiate win-wins.

A strategic planner. You’ve heard it your whole life, but you’re a planner and a great one at that. Your innate eye for details and strategy allows you effectively multitask and meet deadlines.

Think big and beyond. Although you pride yourself in being detail oriented and can see well into the weeds of problems. You have a knack for strategy and solutions.

Technologically proficient. You are adept at learning new software that you will use on a day-to-day basis.

Foundational Knowledge & Experience

A Bachelors Degree in business or related discipline and a have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in banking or business lending inclusive of 3 years credit adjudication. You already have or are working towards an accounting or financial designation. You have a real passion for credit structuring, credit underwriting and risk management that runs through your veins. Your hard work ethic, in-depth financial knowledge and decision making skills are the main attributes to your success and it’s your competitive advantage to rise above that makes you stand out amongst your colleagues.

Why work for us? Benefits to benefit you.

Your voice matters. Help us shape our voice around important social & cultural matters.

The opportunity to make a difference. Build a team. Make an impact. Put your mark on the CWB landscape.

Flexible work arrangements. Make work make sense for you. Remote work. Relocation. Alternate schedules.

Physical health and mental fitness are priorities. Generous time away to practice self-care and family-care with 100% company paid benefit & support programs.

Community giving. Drive economic prosperity in your community. Get involved. Volunteer. Fundraise. All with CWB support.

Bring your whole self to work. Inclusion is a journey requiring practice & experience that results in a powerful outcome.

Innovation. Learn. Grow. Enhance. At CWB we play to win. When we fail, we fail forward.

Connection. Join, participate, lead an employee regulated group (ERG). Find a community within the CWB family.

Organization wide coaching services. Strategic career design is something we work hard to deliver for all employees.

Recognition. Peer to peer recognition program. Both “in the moment” and monumental!

Financial rewards. Yup! We pay you too. Base plus performance incentives. In fact, this role has incentives on top of incentives!!

Retirement investment strategy. You can’t work forever, so we have a RRSP contribution & matching program with financial advisors at the ready to help you make the most of your wealth.

Company ownership. The knowledge and opportunity to impact the bottom line and be rewarded for it - every day, with our employee share purchase plan.

Great Places To Work. CWB recognized as one of 50 Best Workplaces in Canada

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture 2020

Discover CWB. Find your purpose. Apply today.

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/13/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

item.title: Credit Collector & Controller
item.content:encoded:
One of our favourite pharmaceutical clients is looking for a Credit collector and controller for 40 hours a week. The position home based, where the company is located in the Amsterdam area. The role is currently scheduled until the summer of 2021. Extension is to be determined.

Credit collector and controller

For a top 5 pharmaceutical client I am looking for a Credit collector and controller. You will be part of the CI2C team (Customer Invoice to Cash) Benelux: one colleague in Belgium, CI2C Lead in Netherlands and 4 colleagues in Budapest.

Portfolio: Local NL and export market and if needed, support the Belgian collection team.

Principal Responsibilities

Credit Controller/collector duties and responsibilities of the job
  • Manage delinquent accounts for debt collection efforts.
  • Keep track of assigned accounts to identify outstanding debts.
  • Plan a course of action to recover outstanding payments.
  • Negotiate payoff deadlines or payment plans.
  • Handle questions or complaints.
  • Investigate and resolve discrepancies in payments or accounts.
  • Work together with the Credit Risk team, Customer Service, Cash application when required.


Responsibilities And Duties In Addition For Export
  • Validate and release orders
  • Prepare journal entries for commission, pharma contribution etc.
  • Reconcile provision accounts
  • Validate Letters of Credit and Bank guarantees and communicate with the bank
  • Support in month Close processes
  • Prepare payments for fee/commission to customers by invoice or credit note


Details
  • Start date: January 2021
  • Project length: August 2021 (extension TBD)
  • Location: Amsterdam area (the Netherlands) / Home Based


Skills & Qualification
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Good business acumen for problem solving
  • Competency with large ERP systems
  • Confidence to deal with a range of stakeholders
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize a demanding workload


Required Languages
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in Dutch, English and French language;


Apply now

Are you the Credit Collector & Controller I'm looking for? Please contact Tom van Marsbergen via +31 (0)20 522 1588 or t.vanmarsbergen(@)realstaffing.com

delinquent accounts for debt collection efforts.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EKeep track of assigned accounts to identify outstanding debts.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EPlan a course of action to recover outstanding payments.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003ENegotiate payoff deadlines or payment plans.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EHandle questions or complaints.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EInvestigate and resolve discrepancies in payments or accounts.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EWork together with the Credit Risk team, Customer Service, Cash application when required.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cu\u003EResponsibilities And Duties In Addition For Export\u003Cbr\u003E\u003C/u\u003E\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cul\u003E \u003Cli\u003EValidate and release orders\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EPrepare journal entries for commission, pharma contribution etc.\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EReconcile provision accounts\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EValidate Letters of Credit and Bank guarantees and communicate with the bank\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003ESupport in month Close processes\u003C/li\u003E \u003Cli\u003EPrepare payments for fee/commission to customers by invoice or credit note\u003C/li\u003E item.title: Managing Consultant Energietransitie
item.content:encoded:
Werken als managing consultant bij BMC betekent adviseren op topniveau. Praktijkgericht werken aan oplossingen voor complexe maatschappelijke vraagstukken op strategisch niveau. Met en vóór onze opdrachtgevers. Je gaat aan de slag met uitdagende projecten waarbij denken, doen en leren samengaan. De passie voor maatschappelijke vraagstukken is jouw drijfveer.

Je komt vast in dienst bij BMC (voor 32 - 40 uur per week). Je leidt externe projecten en voert deze uit binnen het werkveld van jouw expertise(s). BMC ondersteunt de publieke sector met toonaangevende vakkennis in zes domeinen. Veel maatschappelijke opgaven overstijgen het werkveld, daarom werk je vaak in teams waarin verschillende expertises samenkomen. 

Integraal werken met Fysiek Domein als thuisbasis

Als managing consultant energietransitie is het Fysiek Domein, waarin circa 125 adviseurs werkzaam zijn, jouw thuisbasis binnen BMC. Vanuit deze thuisbasis werk je bij en voor onze klanten. De opdrachten die je gaat doen zijn vaak in teamverband en intern domeinoverstijgend. De duur van de projecten varieert van een paar maanden tot een jaar of langer. Het is gebruikelijk dat je meerdere adviesvraagstukken individueel of samen met collega’s tegelijkertijd oppakt. Je vindt het dan ook leuk om in teams samen te werken en ondernemerschap is jou op het lijf geschreven. Dat maakt geen dag hetzelfde. Tevens zet jij je eigen netwerk in om jouw opdrachtenportefeuille voldoende te vullen.

Jouw focus op de energietransitie 

Wij zoeken collega’s die als managing consultant kunnen adviseren bij de energietransitie. De energietransitie raakt iedereen, het raakt ook alle domeinen binnen BMC: fysiek en sociaal domein, bestuur en bedrijfsvoering. Wij sluiten in onze advisering aan op onze core-business en richten ons bij de energietransitie op het voorbereiden van de publieke sector op de toekomst en de uitvoeringskracht. BMC richt zich op:

  • de organisatie van de samenwerking, waaronder governance, programmamanagement en uitvoeringskracht;
  • gedragsverandering en publieke steun voor brede actie, sociale acceptatie van maatregelen;
  • versterken van vaardigheden en capaciteit om de transitie te steunen;
  • het beleidsmatig uitwerken en prioriteren van projecten.

Werken voor een grote diversiteit aan opdrachtgevers

BMC heeft een sterke naam in de markt. Onze ambitie is het “centre of excellence” te zijn voor de publieke sector. BMC werkt voor toonaangevende opdrachtgevers: ministeries, provincies, waterschappen, regionale samenwerkingsverbanden, gemeenten, zorginstellingen, woningcorporaties en onderwijsorganisaties. Daarnaast betreffen onze opdrachten steeds vaker samenwerkingsvormen tussen deze en met andere organisaties. 

Onderdeel van BMC: ontmoeten, inspireren en leren

De adviseur staat centraal bij BMC. Regelmatig worden er bijeenkomsten georganiseerd voor kennisdeling op actuele en inhoudelijke thema’s en is er aandacht voor jouw eigen ontwikkeling op het gebied van (advies)vaardigheden en kennis. Nadrukkelijk over de zes domeinen heen. BMC’ers voelen zich verbonden met elkaar, het bedrijf, het adviesvak en de publieke sector. Als managing consultant bouw je aan het merk BMC. Dit doe je via jouw adviezen, publicaties, blogs of als spreker op diverse podia.

item.title: Sr. Technical Program Manager
item.content:encoded:
Description

Amazon MENA (Middle East and North Africa) Expansion team is looking for an experienced Technical Program Manager to come up with innovative technology solutions that directly impacts a fast paced growth of Amazon in the new geographies.

In This Role You Will
  • Build solutions to take the great Amazon experience to 400M potential customers of Amazon in MENA
  • Work with new customer base & culture and tap into a fast growing ecommerce market
  • Enrich Amazon by bringing back new, cool and innovative things that are happening around the world
Our mission is to provide a one-stop shopping experience to MENA customers that includes:
  • Connect millions of new customers and sellers through the Amazon peculiar experience
  • Tailored customer experience with RTL (Right-to-Left), currency, payment methods, mobile experience.
In This Role You Will
  • Invent, Develop, Integrate and Migrate existing technologies to deliver the great Amazon experience
  • Extend and Customize the Amazon Platforms that meets our new customer needs
  • Identify Problems and Develop Solutions on behalf of our customers and sellers that are unique to the geography.

Basic Qualifications
  • 5+ years in a technical project/program management role in a related industry
  • Experience with Agile software development lifecycle and/or Service Oriented Architecture
  • Experience defining and implementing programs
  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
  • A Master’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
  • A proven ability to bring clarity to ambiguous situations
  • Experience leading complex projects involving multiple geographically dispersed team
  • Strong presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, technical leaders, and developers
  • Experience working with a full end-to-end e-commerce stack
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
  • Experience in writing status reports and conducting status meetings with project stakeholders and organization leaders
  • A proven track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and deliver results
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1273488

item.title: Project Fusion: Functional Workstream Specialist, Performance Management 50%
item.content:encoded:
Take the next step in your career at ABB, working in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

Our mission Human Resources (HR) is to help ABB stand out when it comes to our people - from leadership, performance and talent management to rewards and career opportunity. In all that we do, we seek to create competitive advantage by dedicating resources to attracting, developing and retaining talented individuals who are customer-focused, collaborative, innovative and driven.

You will be working as a Functional Workstream Specialist for Fusion Project in Global Business Services (GBS) of ABB and will be reporting to the Project Fusion Functional Workstream Lead. In this global project role, you will be contributing to the end-to-end design of the Workday solution for one of these workstreams like Employee Life Cycle, Recruitment, Talent Management, Talent Marketplace, Performance Management, Payroll (USA/CANADA), Absence, Compensation and People Analytics. You will be working in a specified functional workstream for designing ABB’s future HR processes considering the evolving HR service delivery model including scope of services. You will also be fully unleashing and harvesting the opportunities of moving from today’s dispersed HCM landscape to an operating model that builds on a single Workday instance with best-of-breed add-ons, yielding a superior user experience for employees, line managers, HR professionals and applicants.


Your Responsibilities
  • Determining the end-to-end design of ABB’s global Workday solution for given processes within the given workstream in cooperation with a Workday functional consultant and business representatives.
  • Incorporating requirements of the Business Areas by collaborating with the Business Co-Lead and striving for “one hire-to-retire process” across ABB.
  • Driving projects that will be globally revamping HR processes, organization and application portfolio and leading the company into a new era of doing HR which includes optimizing consumer-level user experience and automation.
  • Meeting the business and legal requirements, globally and locally and ensuring adequate involvement of global and local contributors or stakeholders.
  • Adhering to project guidelines, for instance standardization, imposed by the cross-functional experts and being a champion in innovation, efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Ensuring audit compliance with Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICoFR), General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other regulations for accessing to and use of personal data within the company.
  • Covering one or several cross-functional fields for the given workstream, i.e. reporting, documents, people experience or configuration and applying the principles established by the cross-workstream field specialist to the processes in the given workstream.
  • Leading effectively through a performance management culture which will be driving the company’s values and successfully meeting/exceeding all relevant targets and objectives within the business.
  • Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

Your background
  • Graduate/post-graduate degree in Business Management, HR or related discipline.
  • 5+ years of work experience and knowledge in several fields of HR Business Processes, HRIS, Human Capital Management Systems and HR Master Data in roles at large technological and industrial companies with complex organizations and multi-cultural management.
  • Experience with Workday is highly favorable and must have strong leadership with vision and ambition.
  • Extremely structured thinking and strong communication skills to convince HR professionals, line managers and employees globally of the solutions delivered by Project Fusion and drive the change towards a common plan and timelines.
  • Must have passion for quality and speed, creativity and readiness for innovation to break new ground, integrity when dealing with highly sensitive data, can do attitude and resilience.
  • Collaborative working style appreciating the inclusion of geographies, levels, functions and cultures along with developing others.
  • Proven HR process management experience by having successfully operated, designed, optimized, automated, deployed and measured HR business processes of a global scope.
  • Professional proficiency in English, MS Office, digital collaboration tools/platforms.

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

HQ Talent Acquisition Team
ABB Asea Brown Boveri Ltd.

Let’s write the future. Together. www.abb.com/careers
We reserve the right to withdraw this posting at any time.
GBS HR Excellence

item.title: Administrative Assistant, Indigenous Services – CWB Private Investment Counsel
item.content:encoded:
CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .

All applicants are welcome, and we expressly encourage applicants to apply who identify as women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities (including physical, mental, sensory, learning impairment, etc.), Indigenous persons (including First Nations, Metis and Inuit), LGBTQ2S+ and/or racialized persons. We are specifically seeking diversity in this role, because at CWB we believe that inclusion has power, and we’re looking for some unique perspectives to add to this area of our business. We have a culture that thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration, respect, caring and camaraderie. If you have a voice to add to the conversation, we’d love you to apply.

Are you a results-driven individual? Do you thrive in a lightning quick, rapidly evolving environment and love nothing more than finding ways to overcome a challenge? If you found yourself saying “that’s me!” then we want you to come work with us!

As an Administrative Assistant, Indigenous Services you play an integral role in ensuring the efficient and effective support of administrative processes for the Indigenous Services team, sustaining a positive and supportive team environment, and providing excellence in service to team members and clients.

Make An Impact By

Providing end-to-end administrative support, including:
  • Department support for all HR processes, department functions and reviewing and responding to routine correspondence and inquiries for the team.
  • Facilitation of all premises and equipment requests.
  • Providing expense payment management and budget support.
What you will do:

  • Department support on end to end administration, including meeting arrangements, minute-taking, filing, invoicing, travel/meeting bookings, catering, ordering office and kitchen supplies, mail runs and distribution of the daily mail.
  • Coordinate administrative duties related to hiring and onboarding new staff and contractors, advising and working with hiring managers on process and documentation requirements.
  • Coordinate facility services, including seating/office plans, repair or maintenance, key/lock management, procurement of new furnishings and technology requirements.
  • Receive incoming invoices, validate to budget detail and prepare payment coding instruction details for Accounts Payable, ensuring the proper signatory authorizations are obtained.
  • Manage all client administration including account opening documentation, account maintenance and input into performance monitoring systems.
  • Respond to clients’ requests relative to withdraws, deposits, tax matters (where applicable), transfers in / out including the preparation and follow-up of instructions to Custodian and Managers to ensure completion.
  • Check, assemble and distribute quarterly client reports and prepare performance packages for in-person quarterly review meetings with clients as required.
  • Responsible for the preparation of all client mailings and month end reports etc.
  • Maintain filing system for all clients, prepare client direction letters as required
  • Provide administrative support to, and participate in, committees, task force and project teams as required.

Who you are:
Education

  • Some post-secondary education and/or learning courses preferred
Professional Experience

  • Minimum 1 year administrative experience supporting senior leadership.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite of products, including but not limited to Outlook, Word, Excel.
Personal Competencies

  • Portray a team player and a “people first” attitude at all times.
  • Demonstrates excellent administrative and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize job responsibilities and manage high volumes of information effectively.
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically and professionally at all times.
  • Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with management, staff, and clients to enhance professionalism and productivity.
  • Strong and highly flexible, solid interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Clearly conveys information using the tools necessary, engaging the audience to ensure the message is delivered and understood, creating a positive first impression with confidence and respect.
  • Good analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision.
  • Follows policies and procedures when completing tasks.
We put our People First at CWB by offering:
  • Base salary plus additional bonus compensation.
  • Career growth. We are passionate about investing in our employees’ development and supporting them in reaching their professional goals.
  • An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay).
  • Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP) and we will match a portion of your contributions to help you build your share ownership faster.
  • Matching employer contributions to your retirement savings.
Inclusion &

Diversity
CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.

Accessibility

CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.

#DiscoverCWB #teamteal #obsessedwithyoursuccess

Closing Date

  • P osition closes at 12:01am on indicated close date
    • 02/19/2021 Inclusion &

    Diversity
    CWB Financial Group is committed to being an equitable employer, providing an inclusive environment for a diverse workforce, including but not limited to, women, persons with visible and invisible disabilities, Indigenous persons, gender and sexual minorities, and ethnic visible minorities. We believe that inclusion has power. In fact, that’s one of our values. We know that diverse teams unleash new ideas and perspectives. We work to create an organization where people can be proud of who they are, and allies for those around them. We know that there is power in our differences and we are committed to providing equitable treatment to all employees, applicants and clients. And beyond that, we celebrate our people and those differences.

    We're proud to have built a culture that thrives on idea-sharing and collaboration, and we're always finding ways to continue to create a warm, welcoming and inclusive work environment. We have a strong ethics program, a mandatory Respect in the Workplace eLearning program, comprehensive policies related to employment equity, and a strategy and an going strategy to ensure diversity and inclusion thrives at CWB.
    Accessibility

    CWB Financial Group is committed to providing all applicants with equal accessibility. Believing that inclusion has power, we strive to create an accessible environment for all, focused on the principles of independence, dignity, and equality. If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment and selection process (from application to offer) please submit your request here and one of our recruiters will reach out to you directly.
